Reviews.Title: “Sober hotel, with good service, delapidated room, poor breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Pieter H
Reviews.Content: The location of Piram hotel near Stazione Termini is perfect. The service of the hotel is OK. The staff is friendly. Nevertheless our double room was poor, at the roof level (6th floor). Small bath room, simple handy things like coathooks were missing. The bed was old, much too short for my 1,90 meter. No number at the door, so we needed to figure which door our key fits with. Breakfast of EUR 10 is not worth. Horrible orange juice, watery coffee, a toaster difficult to use. We survived with the yoghurt. Typical Italian hotel; too expensive for what you got.

Reviews.Title: “A good value hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: businesstravelling
Reviews.Content: This is hard review to write as I liked the hotel but it has a couple of irritating features. The hotel is very near the railway station, one street back and two along towards the front of the station. The area was Ok, clean and felt safe. During commuting times there was a few people sell knock off handbags but that was about it. The area around the back of the railway station which is roughly ten street back from the hotel is a little salubrious with ladies of the night, beggars but felt safe but a little edgy. The hotel is a turn of last century building and no great beauty from the outside. It is built around two central courtyards and has busy roads on two sides. It has an Italian feel about it with lots of gilt mirrors, fussy paintings, big chandeliers and two marble and stone staircases. There are two lifts, a wonderful old cage life inside the stair well and a small modern one. The lift by reception can be busy as it serves the breakfast room as well but the other end of the hotel ones are quiet. The breakfast room was in the basement as the room terrace was not open until May. The reception is manned 24hrs and the stuff were helpful but night time staff had less command of English. They were quite happen to offer up tips, direction and book tickets over the web for no extra fee. The room was on the fourth floor at the side. It had the old single glazing and shutters plus modern double glazing and shutters so no street noise. The room must have been refurbished recently as the doors, bathroom and some furniture were new. There was a door card system with a keypad to say do not disturb, adjust air con, etc. The electronic system could be controlled by reception who could adjust thing like room temperature. On the first night the room was very hot as we found the air con came on during the night automatically to heat the room. Reception just said no problem I shall put the temperature down to 28! Room was good size, large window with huge drapes and ornate plaster ceiling. The bathroom made the room L shaped. There was a good shower, toilet, bidet and sink with cupboard underneath, soap and shampoo. Room was cleaned daily and towels changed daily. The room furniture was: Large mini bar and free electronic safe. Yes there was an open waldrobe with a curtain – couldn’t see the issue myself. New bed, chairs, and padded bench. With old chipped fancy inlaid desk and side tables. Fancy lights and old paintings completed the Italian look. Overall nice to know which country you wake up in these days of the mass chain. The infamous breakfast buffet was overall very good value for money. It was very Italian i.e. cake, cake and cake of the day. Plus sweet bread, sliced bagged toast bread, ham, cheese, cereal, yogurt, tinned fruit salad, hot scrambled egg, bacon and pancakes. Some items would not appear but over 10 days that was the general selection. A person would check your room number at the door and then you found and table. A waitress would then come around to take your drink order. A peak times it was clear the system could not cope. The one poor waitress had to clear, set, take coffee orders and deal with shouting people waiting there one made to measure cup of coffee. If you are in hurry for coffee and not an Italian insisting on a made to measure cup then the system needs patience. Tip to the tourist: Make friends with you waitress/waiter at breakfast and ask for a pot. Understand your Italian coffees types well and a little Italian pays dividends. Learn the air con controls to avoid over heating. Get a high room at the side if you like open windows/hate air con. Tip to the owners: Get you breakfast system sorted now. Put heated plated with black filter coffee and hot water on the breakfast buffet for non Italians. People can still ask for made to measure coffee. Get the door staff more involved in the service as you are short staffed and poorly managed. The lady manageress should break am nail and help so she understand the basic issue. Would I go back again? Yes, it offers good, safe location. 2 minutes walk train station, 15 minutes walk coliseum. Good value and it felt non chain and Italian. Would I order the breakfast again? Yes, if offered very good value. Patience was tested on day one but by day 5 the staff bought what we wanted but day 10 without even an order. The items were not the finest but for the price well worth doing and choice was OK. The railway station would not offer cheaper value as the cheapest option was 1.80 black coffee and 3.50 salami roll and you would have to queue for that made to measure coffee twice. One to order and pay then wait again while made.

Reviews.Title: “A fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kazzakiwi
Reviews.Content: This is a fine hotel, handy location, near the metro and airport shuttle. The rooms are big, bathroom is large too. The only trouble with it is that when we were there in March/April, it was quite warm, but we couldn't use the air conditioning. We asked about this at reception and were told " the mayor hasn't turned it on yet". We got a great laugh out of this, but apparently it was true. It just meant that we had to have the window open all the time, which meant it was a bit noisy, but I always take ear plugs with me to any hotel, so I was okay, but my partner found it a bit noisy. We also didn't try out the breakfast, so can't comment on that, but I would definately stay again, and thought it was a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory but nothing more”
Reviews.Author: Marybeth S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel while on a long weekend trip to Rome - first trip to Rome for six family members. We booked three rooms, all of which were different. The rooms were small but sufficient and clean. There were safes and refrigerators free of charge in the rooms. The beds were relatively comfortable, but the pillows were thin "rocks". The bathrooms were okay, though in my room it was dimly lit and there was no shower enclosure of any kind so the water from the shower ended up spraying all over the room, toilet and sink included; that was kind of a pain and made for a slippery floor throughout. Reviews on Trip Advisor suggested I ask for rooms at the back of the hotel which I did....BIG mistake. At 3 a.m. Friday morning a man spent an hour and a half loading a truck with laundry from nearby hotels. The noise was loud and kept us awake which made for a very tired group of people. There was additional alley noise the other two nights, but not as bad. We also had an issue with Internet access...the staff did NOT explain the policy well so we ended up paying for something we misunderstood; they told us they couldn't do anything about this issue. Overall the staff was okay, though not particularly friendly. The location is far from the airport, but that is the case if you want to be anywhere near any of the "attractions" in Rome. The hotel is not far from the Termini so that was convenient, though we found using public transportation in Rome was more difficult and people such as the bus drivers less helpful than in Barcelona from where we had come. We wouldn't stay here again...would try our luck elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, adequate accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Debbie C
Reviews.Content: Located two easy walking blocks from Termini station (easily reached by a simple 30 minute ride from the airport on the Leonardo Express), this hotel offered a great home base for a 3 day visit to Rome. The metro and all buses converge at Termini where you can also find free wifi at the AutoGrill restaurant. Buy a 3 day tourist metro pass and off you go quickly to any point in Rome. The hotel charges 15 euro for 10 hours internet access in the lobby that you can start and stop. The rooftop was closed during our stay. The staff was not overly welcoming, didn't smile much and offered to allow us in our room early for 35 euros. We declined and decided to wait the 2 hours until official check in time. We sat in the lobby and decide to watch a movie on my daughters computer and within 30 minutes, the room was ready and they let us have it without further delay or cost. We appreciated it. The room was on the 5th floor, interior, ugly view basically nothing but on the positive side, it was relatively quiet. The room was clean and comfortable though not large. The bathroom was clean, water pressure and temperature good, and the shampoo/soaps were good quality. We booked through hotwire so the hotel was a surprise but for the basically $50 per night we paid, it was fine. The hotel charges and extra 3 euro per person per night Rome city tax that you pay at the end of your stay. On the street directly behind the hotel going away from Termini is a small restaurant in a cellar. The food is delicious and the people are charming. Prices are extremely reasonable as well. I would call this a three star hotel. It does have an overpriced spa which I suppose is why it's ranked 4 star but I think the rooms and services are more important to consider. Breakfast was not included at this hotel, at least, not at the rate we paid. This is simply a good choice for a convenient location and adequate accomodation. There's a good gelato shop on the corner too!

Reviews.Title: “not a 4 star, kind of noisy”
Reviews.Author: IoanL
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 4 nights. The room was on 3rd floor and kind of OK. Each morning we were waken up by the garbage trucks coming to pick the garbage and making a lot of noise. The TV was bad, no good channels and in the last evening only one worked, but anyway we were not in Rome to watch TV. We had to wait for 20 minutes for the water to get hot enough to have a shower. And one night we couldn't sleep because of the AC. Also the rooms were very warm. The breakfast was very bad, nothing fresh and always the same things. In the last morning we went to breakfast at around 9 and we didn't find any eating utensils, and the service was horrible so we couldn't get any. If you can, avoid taking breakfast here. The good news are the price and the location, very close to every transportation system and you can go by foot to some sights.

Reviews.Title: “Huge room, good location, gorgeous rooftop deck, decent service, clean but DEFINITELY not a 4-star.”
Reviews.Author: Denise D
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised with this Hotel. The price was very reasonable for its location and though I was expecting a tiny roman room, our room was enormous (we affectionately referred to it as our Roman apartment.) The location was good. The hotel is older and lacked personality but the basics were sufficient. Besides - when in Rome - who wants to hang around in the hotel??? CLEANLINESS: Our room was cleaned daily and kept up nicely. The linens were fair. Towels were fine but the blankets were thin and cheap. Sheets were clean with low thread count. Most importantly, however, everything was clean. Maid service was fine. The bathroom was very clean when we arrived and even the lobby bathroom was very well kept. Common areas were likewise fine. ROOM: Our room was HUGE. Though you hear the rooms in Rome are tiny, our room was the exception. See my pictures. We had booked a standard room and it had a couch, full chest of drawers, wardrobe, dining table and chairs and the bathroom was also nicely sized. The windows were a small with no view but again, who's staying in the room? The TV was small and but it did have a keyboard for interactive features. (We did not use it TV at all.) The room is best described as big, simple and clean. Hardwood floors, lower sloped ceiling so if you are super tall, you might feel a little boxed in. Our room was remarkably quiet though, we were on a corner of the building. ROOFTOP DECK: Wow! What a view! From the tallest deck, you feel you can see all of Rome. The deck was very well kept and beautiful. We grabbed a bottle of wine and lounged under the stars surrounded by 360 degrees of the city lights. I wanted to see the sunrise from there as well but the deck does not open until later morning. Also, the deck closes relatively early in the evening (and doesn't "allow" alcohol...) so keep this in mind. The jacuzzi tubs were not heated when we were there so we did not go in. BREAKFAST: Breakfast is served from the rooftop deck and is a great place to start your day, however, the quality of the food is not worth the price. Though it was a decent selection of foods, it was quite simple, toast, cheese, yogurt, few hot items and the hot items were marginal at best. Bakery items were also underwhelming. Cappuccino was good, however, and the service was fair. From a pure convenience standard, it was OK but also consider that breakfast did not get started until the later morning so if you did the breakfast included, you could be waiting around for it to start up and that is a waste of time when there is so much to see in Rome. If it were cheaper and started earlier, it might be a better value. I'd skip it. SERVICE: Front desk was fine. They spoke enough English and were patient when I spoke my poor Italian which was a mishmash of Spanish. As I mentioned, service at breakfast was fair, nothing bad, nothing good. Maid staff were pleasant if you passed them in the hallways. We were provided help with our bags when we arrived because you have to climb a flight of stairs to get to the elevator. No concierge which is expected at a 4-star hotel. Also, a 4-star would have much better English speakers. LOCATION: It is a short walk from the Termini station so if you are traveling by train, it is fantastic. We had well-wheeled luggage so we just walked there, no problem! Piazza della Repubblica is right down the street and just another 10 minute walk gets you to the Colosseum area. There are many restaurants nearby and a few small grocery stores. The neighborhood is fine and a good jumping-off point for seeing the city. We walked everywhere and found the location of the Hotel just-right for our home base. Compared to the other hotels we looked at, Piram was very reasonable for its location. Though it is older, has few luxuries and no whistles or bells, the room size was fantastic, location was great and the rooftop deck was amazing. It is NOT a 4-star by any stretch of the imagination but the price was not 4-star for Rome either - fair enough! The lobby was quaint and elevator was TINY! Overall, however, we enjoyed our Roman Apartment and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service...”
Reviews.Author: m_travel_2012
Reviews.Content: Several Comments 1. I sent an email few days before my arrival asking for information in case of late arrival. The answer was at least rude. 2. We selected the hotel and the tariff among other things because: a) There was an amazing view for the roof during the breakfast. However, we were informed that the roof was close (and breakfast would be in the basement), we ask to have access only to enjoy the view, but we did not have any answer. b) We included the full access to the spa, with sauna and pool. But again, at our arrival we were informed that the pool was closed and only the sauna was working. When we used the sauna we had to change in a bathroom leaving our clothes over the basin & toilet with the articles of all other passengers. 3) Finally, in spite of that in general employees were cordial: one young lady in reception (afternoon shift) was particularly aggressive and rude with my friend and then with me with no reason. (I tend to assume that is the same person who replies my email). (Curly black hair) So, I paid for a room in a good hotel including breakfast in the terrace and access to the spa. I got a bed, breakfast in the basement, only half spa and a treatment that i have not had before. Best regards

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Jamie C
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the reviews before arriving my expectations were not great. However, just a short walk from Termini Station was just what we needed after a long trip and we were greeted by courteous and helpful staff. We stayed for four nights and we had no complaints about the service from any of the staff who were more than happy to help or advise. Four of us travelled and had two rooms both of which were of three star quality, basic but clean, large bathrooms, comfy beds and all the appliances promised in the literature worked efficiently. The Hotel had a feeling of having seen grander days but there is obvious refurbishment taking place and this may explain the range of comments from poor to excellent reported back from guests about the standard of their accommodation - both our rooms had double glazed windows which blocked most of the outside noise and allowed a good nights sleep Continental breakfast fare was good in quality and range but the English breakfast offer was limited. All in all good value for money if you want a relatively cheap, central accessible hotel which you can use as a base but do not expect the four stars it purports to be.

Reviews.Title: “good location but food and service at breakfast disappointing”
Reviews.Author: myLouisa
Reviews.Content: this hotel is very convenient for the main station and has a friendly welcoming atmosphere. we were surprised to be informed of a local tax of 3 euros each per night on arrival. breakfast was basic and service for tea and coffee with breakfast slow. room was spacious and comfortable although heating controls didn't work properly. no tea and coffee facilities in the room.

Reviews.Title: “TRES TRES DECUE!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sophiebox
Reviews.Content: I was VERY VERY VERY VERY disappointed by my stay. - The bathroom was small contrary to what was said on website. - The walls are so thin that we can hear all what is happening in the next bedrooms... - People from the hotel make reparations or cleaning in the corridor at 8 AM! I AM ON HOLIDAYS!!! - The breakfast was very basic, not very good and is ALWAYS the same thing each day. And we have to ask for cofee, which arrives COLD!! - There is only one elevator for 6 floors of bedrooms so we often wait a long time before it comes. - There is a second elevator that gets blocked each time. - On your website you mention free WIFII and internet in the room which is a lie! We have to pay for wifii (and it is VERY expensive) and it only works in the reception! A LIE!!! And internet on the TV is payable too! A LIE!! - I choose this hotel party for the SPA but there was no massages available and the jacuzzi was closed! Really a shame! I will NEVER come back to this hotel which is expensive for what it offers and I will not recommend it to anyone!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fine for budget travelling”
Reviews.Author: noramarieask
Reviews.Content: Before my trip to Rome I spent quite some time browsing through these reviews to try and get a picture of what to expect of this hotel. So I thought I'd lay down my two cents in this... Firstly, the hotel rooms were just fine, clean enough and at an "okay" standard. Unfortuneatly we got a room with no windows (there are a few of them actually!), but at least we didn't notice any noise. The beds aren't very comfortable, but it was just fine. The drain in the shower was clogged though, so when we had a shower, the water went all the way into the bedroom, but it was okay. Marble floors, so nothing got soaked, and we just let them know when we left. The man in the reception laughed it away and said that "we create pool...for you!!" He was so funny, he almost made everything worth it! The staff is not snippy, sour or angry. I think it depends on where you're from. Maybe if you're from the US, you are used to the staff always having a fake glued-on smile, but we're from Norway, so it's not uncommon that people don't always smile while talking. I found the staff quite pleasant and helpful. If you can afford to stay somewhere else, DO IT. But if you're on a budget and you just need somewhere to sleep for a weekend, this place is just fine. However, some people here say that the breakfast is awful and that you should upgrade it... Don't. It's not worth it. It's STILL awful! Save your money and go out for breakfast instead :) Hope you found this helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Backpackers pretending to be 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Dmens
Reviews.Content: Solution to aircon that is stuck at 28C ? (exciting the bedbugs to bite all night) ...open your window to the smelly service alley/courtyard!  "you have no other choice...do that or you can just stay hot!".  Nice.  Such appalling customer service.  Once you've paid, you're garbage to these people. Enjoy Rome - choose a better hotel!

Reviews.Title: “My trip was great!”
Reviews.Author: Becky F
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved our stay at this hotel. It was soooo conveniently located! You could either walk to see things or take a bus, metro (A nd B), or train. The station was right across the street. Easy to get to from either Airport by bus. Our room and bathroom were very clean and large. Our room was very quiet and the beds were comfortable. We slept great. We also did not have any problems with the receptionists. They were very helpful and even helped us find out how to get to the Roman Aquaducts by bus. They also accomodated a pack and play for our baby. We did not have breakfast at the hotel. There are 3 Mcdonalds within a 5 minute walk from the hotel as well as a supermarket at Termini Station. Our room had a fridge. For the Location and Price this hotel is awesome. Great trip!

Reviews.Title: “you can't get worse”
Reviews.Author: SteveA478
Reviews.Content: This must be the worse hotel I have ever been to. The receptionist girls are very rude. The cleaning girls shout in what appears to be Romanian. The rooms are dirty and squallid. Breakfast is appalling. There is the lady with short brown hair who is very rude, she shouts at the chambermaids NEVER AGAIN

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Siva K
Reviews.Content: Had a nice experience at hotel, only issue was staff needs to give attention to check-in/check-out

Reviews.Title: “Choose other hotels close to terminal”
Reviews.Author: Reabc
Reviews.Content: Cold face reception wifi charged for 15 euro/ 10 hour Blanket smells from warehouse,bed sheet has holes. Take long time to get hot water for bath

Reviews.Title: “Food location”
Reviews.Author: Jonasf75
Reviews.Content: Good hotel with great location near Termini station. Cleaning was very good and the room was big. The hotel lobby wasnt that nice but it wasnt a big deal. Price was good to so I don't have so much to complain about. We didnt try the resturant. I recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Such a disappointment !!”
Reviews.Author: Martin S
Reviews.Content: We had been to this hotel 2 years ago and had had such an enjoyable stay we decided to book again this December - what a change and what a mistake !! On arrival we were told to pay the full price of the 3 night stay - 211 euros. We thought this was a bit odd but paid as we had had such a good stay 2 years ago. The problems started when we were given our key to Room 152 and told it was on the 1st floor. However, there are no signs on the walls of the 1st floor to indicate where our room was located. Unfortunately, the room numbers jumped from 126 to 151 but we only realised this after about 10 minutes of searching for 152 !! When we had booked we had requested Soya milk for breakfast and on checking in we were told this had been arranged. When we went for our first breakfast, we were asked to pay 10 euros each for breakfast even though we had booked for English breakfast when we had booked on the internet. I had to go back to our room to get the email confirming our stay to show the waitress that we had English breakfast. She then accepted this. However, when we asked for the soya milk, she could not find it!! I have an allergy to all dairy products so soya milk is quite important. She said they would go and get some and it would take only 5 minutes. In fact it took nearer 15 minutes. When the carton arrived , I asked for it to come to the table in the carton. However, for some reason, it was brought in a jug and it was hot !! So they had to go and get a 2nd carton !! More delay !! We had hoped for a Full English breakfast but the only hot food were some scrambled eggs and some very greasy and fatty bacon !! A major problem is that although the waitresses were quite helpful they hardly understood any English. Our room did not have any BBC channels except for BBC World News and even this did not work !! We complained to the reception staff who tried to fix it but without success. After a day or so it did eventually work. The air conditioning did not work and the room was heated at 24 degrees. Again I queried this with reception but got no help but was simply told it was working - which it did not !! The shower room was a wet room which would have been fine except there were about a dozen or so small mosaic style tiles missing off the floor which was potentially dangerous. The shower only had a cheap shower curtain and there was evidence of mould. The mirrored cabinet on the bathroom wall was fixed far too high and my shorter partner could only just see into it. The room was quite spacious but there were handles missing off some of the furniture and one drawer would not open. The double bed had only one thin pillow on each side. The duvet did not have a cover and was stained with what looked like body fluids. We asked for it to be changed but all we got was one thin blanket. We were promised a replacement duvet the next day but this did not arrive !! There was no plug in the sink and there were no tea/coffee making facilities. The attitude of the reception staff was - generally - quite unhelpful and in one case, she was quite dismissive. The Spa is quite limited and has no changing facilities. Overall, this hotel has deteriorated since we last stayed 2 years ago and there is no way we would ever go back again or recommend to anyone else to stay there. Such a shame as it is welll positioned near the train station.

Reviews.Title: “ok place to stay”
Reviews.Author: kxz255
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Piram Welcome Hotel for 6 nights when we visit rome this year. I choose the hotel because it is close to central terminal. We uses metro a lot. Hotel is clean. breakfast is good. But there is one thing I was not happy about it. The AC is our room is not working. I called front desk. They said they gonna fix it in an hour. When I came back. It is still not working. I called 4 times in one day and no one was able to fix it. The next day, I called again before I went to Colliseum. After I came back, it is still not fixed. I went down stairs and grabed one staff to my room. He said their computer showing AC is working. But admitted it is not working when he actually see it in my room. And he said he will fix it immediately. after 30 minutes. nothing changed. I went downstairs again. And eventually got it fixed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Silvia-1961
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at this hotel. We paid 90 euros a night for a double, which included a cocktail upon arrival. There was a misunderstanding, and we didn´t get it, but the very nice woman at the desk gave us a complimentary dinner at the restaurant, a couple of days later!!!

Reviews.Title: “terrible - not worth even considering!”
Reviews.Author: lcanh
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it was close to the Termini train station as we were travelling around Italy on trains. When we got there, the receptionist was very abrupt and unwelcoming, her questions were more like barking commands rather than polite statements. They told us we had to leave our luggage with them and go away because our room wasn't ready. When we did come back to check in, there was a receptionist and in my opinion, the only polite receptionist, asked us to pay the whole amount up front. The bellhop didn't help us with our heavy bags and they just told us what level our room was on and that was it. When we got up to the level we couldn't find out room cause there were no signs and the rooms were so randomly numbered and not sequential and after not being able to find it we went back down to reception and the bellhop begrudgingly showed us. The bathroom was cramp, the aircon was stuck on heat and so the room was always too warm and when we asked reception to fix it they said it was working fine. the pillows were terrible, almost paper thin, had to call reception for some more and took them an hour to bring them up. They said there was room service, and when we called down to ask if we could order something to eat the receptionist told us to call the bar and then hung up on us. The bathroom was very cramped and very dimly lit. Because the floors had no carpet we could hear everything from all other rooms! on our last night the occupants in the room next to ours were making so much noise at around 4am and we called down to reception to ask them to call the room and ask them to keep it down and they said they couldn't do anything about it. All in all the worst place I've have ever stayed at and I've stayed at some pretty bad motels and hostels! DO NOT BOTHER STAYING AT THIS HOTEL! Pay some extra money if you can and stay somewhere else! the price isn't worth the terrible experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: DNR8883
Reviews.Content: While starting our Italy trip off in Rome we stayed several days at the Piram Hotel and got put into an apartment right on the Via Nazionale! Fantastic location withing walking distance to most attractions as well as the termini. Room was clean you didn't hear any surrounding noise The only downfall was that we were not located at the hotel and never made the breakfast buffet in time but overall a pretty decent stay. The staff were helpful and friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sofia P
Reviews.Content: Although we enjoyed our stay, the location was very convenient right next to the main train and bus station, so it was easy to reach from the airport, and the price was good considering the location. However, this should not be classed as a 4 star hotel because of the following reasons: 1) On arrival and check-in we had to pay for rooms straight away, however we were not told that there is a City tax, which we were only told about at the check-out when we have spent most of our Euros. We should’ve been given the option to pay the city tax in advance too, or be warned that there will be an extra charge at the end. 2) There was no iron in the whole hotel. A 4-star hotel should have an iron. 3) The hot tub and spa on the roof and 7th floor that is free of charge to the guests was closed for the autumn/ winter season, and there was no notice about that on the website or booking. The 6th floor spa had an extra charge. 4) It said on our booking that Full English breakfast was included in the room rate and our reservation, however in the morning we were sent down to the ‘free breakfast’ section with bread and cereal type food. They said Full English breakfast had an extra charge. 5) The door in the toilet in the room had a broken lock. Some of these things may be minor, however they prevented us having a perfect stay, and our expectations were not fulfilled.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing out of the ordinary”
Reviews.Author: mp6
Reviews.Content: When I booked this hotel for my partner and I, I thought we had stumbled across a bargain in an area of Rome that would benefit us. I was right about one part; the latter. The hotel is situated nice and close to the main metro station allowing easy links to the main tourist spots, however the hotel itself had clearly been photographed in a very positive light in its advert. The TV failed to receive the majority of English stations during our visit and the noise from surrounding streets did cause us to wake a little earlier than desired in the morning. Overall the hotel was clean and good value for money, but its profile on Hotels.com obviously highlights the positives without a mention of possible problems e.g. noise.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel but a Little Noisy”
Reviews.Author: michaeldouglascasten
Reviews.Content: Based on my stay I would say that all the problems that the hotel has had before have been fixed because the hotel itself was faultless. It has kept some great original features but with all the modern conviniences. The room I had was modern and tasteful but was quite noisy around 5AM when deliveries or rubbish collection started everyday. My room faced a small side street on the right hand side as you face it so maybe avoid that side of the building

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and no major complaints”
Reviews.Author: dradams93
Reviews.Content: We were a little nervous, having booked this hotel, at some of the reviews for this hotel. However we were pleasantly surprised and extremely relieved on arrival. The hotel is a 2min walk from Termini and is therefore an ideal base for your stay in Rome. The staff were very welcoming and friendly and the rooms are clean and very comfortable. The receptionist on arrival took time to explain the underground system in Rome and pointed out on a map the major attractions in Rome. If I could make one suggestion for improvement, it would be that the breakfast is generally limited in choice and the overall standard is quite poor. However we would consider staying at this hotel again on our return to Rome, if only on a 'Room Only' basis.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and incredibly handy location”
Reviews.Author: jcgdublin
Reviews.Content: Welcome Piram Hotel as a very good hotel with room service available for coffee/tea in the room and everything very clean and tidy. The old style elevator next to the new one was very good to try out and restaurant was also very good as did eat there one night. Bar and Restaurant staff were very friendly and very good english all around and was nice to have a couple of drinks once the days touring were over. But location was incredibly handy as with the train/tram/metro/open top bus/bus pass only 25Euros for 3 days unlimited being nearby Termini was perfect as most transport ended up back in the hotel area. A load of nice restaurants and cafes just made it a perfect trip coupled with the incredible history and

Reviews.Title: “Small room, but in good condition”
Reviews.Author: MikeZandvliet
Reviews.Content: I had originally booked at Hotel Termini, but the door there was locked, with a note saying that checkin could be done at Hotel Piram. When I got to Piram, the manager said I could stay there instead, which was certainly a nice upgrade to get. The room that I had was an internal room. It was a little on the small side (even for Rome standards), but was well decorated & in excellent condition. Comparing my experience to some of the other reviews here, I wonder if perhaps I got a renovated room? In any case, there was no sign that the other rooms were any different - but I only had a few glimpses of what was on my floor. All in all, no complaints, pretty happy.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Tourist Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: Shawn E
Reviews.Content: Avoid this hotel at all costs, too many issues to list. This is a one-star hotel calling itself a four-star hotel. A/C Broke TV worked only 20% of the time No hot water No water pressure Bad restaurant (cold food) Apathetic staff 50 degree F "Hot Tubs" on the roof Free breakfast, if you can find it Slow elevator Uncomfortable small bed (double is the size of a single) 18" sq shower is impossible to use No in-room wifi Concierge arguing with prostitutes in the lobby Hidden extra charges at check-out time

Reviews.Title: “Location good, hotel poor”
Reviews.Author: Bellicious
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is good, very central to transport links to get around Rome. However, the hotel itself was shabby and does not deserve the 4* rating that it purports to have. When we arrived we were put in an attic room where the aircon was so loud we couldn't sleep, the shower attachment was hanging off the wall and the bathroom light didn't work. We tried to call reception for over half an hour but it was engaged and in the end we actually had to go down to reception to tell them about all the faults in our room. We found out that the aircon is controlled by a computer in reception and they turned it off for us. The next day we complained about the quality of the room and a very helpful receptionist arranged to change our room for us, which was better than the original one. However the aircon was still a problem and the television satellite signal was faulty so we couldn't watch any television in our room. Also we asked reception to send us some more pillows as we only had one each and they were very thin and it took them approx. 5 HOURS to do this. The manager of the hotel offered us a free dinner in the hotel for all the inconveniecne we had experienced so on our last night we had dinner in the hotel and were given a menu to order from which we did. Half way through our meal we mentioned to the waiter that we had a voucher for dinner and he went what can only be described as mad and said we had to pay for our meal and that as we had a voucher we should have ordered from a different menu and not the a la carte menu. The other menu we should have ordered from for dinner with a voucher had much less choice on it and obviously the food was cheaper to provide. We spoke to the restaurant manager and he eventually agreed that we could use the voucher for our dinner that evening. Our tariff included breakfast but this was also provided very cheaply and the breakfast food was very basic and poor quality, tinned fruit, orange squash rather than fresh juice, dry croissants. All in all our experience of the Welcome Piram hotel was a complete debacle and we would definitely not recommend that you stay there. The price for the hotel was not cheap but it was a cheap hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect, but more than adequate”
Reviews.Author: Danishlady104
Reviews.Content: With my husband I stayed for 4 night in the beginning of october 2011. On the plus side: close to the central station and easily within 1 hours walk of just about everything worth seeing in Rome. Restaurants are plentiful in the area, not cheap, but I doubt you'll find cheap restaurants anywhere in central Rome anyway. The room was very nice and seemed newly redecorated (bathroom was new as well) and there was everything needed including minibar and a small safe. On the down side: water in the shower wasn't always warm and airconditioning didn't work (temperatures in october aren't high, but our room faced a quite noisy street and it would have been nice to get a cool room without opening the window). The television wasn't too good, most nights both sound and picture was breaking up and a few times the signal was gone. These are small things and we didn't bother complaining about them, so staff didn't have a chance to do anything about it. We did overhear another couple complaining at reception about the lack of airconditioning though and I'm sorry to say that the receptionist didn't deal with that properly. They were told to open a window and that was that. No promise to try and fix the problem. Other things I noted: breakfast is standard for southern europe, but if you're used to something more substantial, you'll probably be disappointed. It took us a day to find out that the only way of getting coffee served for breakfast, was to waylay a staffmember, they don't offer it. Staff was very friendly except for the receptionist mentioned earlier. She wasn't exactly unfriendly (to us), but seemed disinterested. And finally: you have to pay for internet access from you room. I don't know if that's standard in southern europe, but it is annoying and more so because it's not clear from the hotel website that it's not free.

Reviews.Title: “not bad”
Reviews.Author: Barbara L
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in Hotel Piram 3rd to 7th Oct Over all ok room cleaned daily with fresh towels . Breakfast fair but a bit sparce some mornings. Very handy to main station for transport to all the wonderful sights of ROME. Surrounding area seemed fine with plenty of places to eat at night at fair prices. Overall found hotel good did not really expect anything more . My only comment would be that some of the staff would need to improve on their social skills when dealing with visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay at this hotel as you will regret it!”
Reviews.Author: FeonaNChris
Reviews.Content: After checking in, we scrolled through the rest of the reviews. We realised that the first few reviews we read prior to booking this hotel were so off the mark. After reading two reviews that started with "where do i start.." we knew those were the real reviews. It would be simpler to just list down the facts - No cupboard in the room to put your clothes in. No handles or hooks to hang anything. Inside the bathroom or in the tiny room itself. The shower head was clogged. My husband cleaned it. Then the water doesn't drain fast enough. The shower cubicle overflowed with water after one shower. The tv does not work. They make no apologies for that. No safe inside the room despite what was stated in their manual. The windows open to the wall of the next building. The ledge was full of cigarette butts from previous occupants. The bed was partially wedged into a wall. On the second day, I found a bug on the pillow. On the third day, the loo door got stuck and had to be forced open. On the fourth day there was no hot water in the evening. The next day when we checked out, they charged us €3 per person per night because they said it was a four star hotel. WHAT A JOKE. On us that is. Spoilt our Rome holiday. Don't stay here. Congratulations to the front office people. They are very brave indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as made out on here.”
Reviews.Author: hector-grengros
Reviews.Content: Before making my decision on where to stay in Rome I was looking to stay as central as possible within my budget,if you are realistic then you will be happy enough with your stay. I didn't go there expecting anything great,especially after I read some of the reviews on here,but I'm realistic,if you are going to stay in a capital city in the western world for under £100 per night,it's not going to be luxurious,but it was clean,with a good sized bedroom and a/c that worked,with breakfast included,although not a great lot of choice.The location was good,right by the train station,just over the road from the bus tours and about a 15 min walk to most attractions.if there is one thing I would agree with is that a certain female member of staff who works there was quite rude but apart from that,everyone else was friendly enough. If staying in Rome again I would stay at this hotel,it's just a normal 3 star European hotel,do not stay here if you are wanting luxury because you won't get it anywhere in Rome for under £100 per night.

Reviews.Title: “An average, conveniently located hotel”
Reviews.Author: jobanoonoos
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Welcome Piram in June. Our room (which slept four adults) was comfortable and relatively spacious. The only issue was the location of the bathroom, which was only accessible through one of the bedrooms. The location is great - literally a two minute walk from the Roma Termini station. As such, it's great for a short trip to the city (particularly, if you're arriving by train). The breakfast was average and I would urge the hotel to improve in this area. Likewise, the excessive charges for internet seemed utterly bizarre - after two months of travelling around Europe, this was only the second hotel that charged for internet access - 20 Euros for one day's access, if you don't mind! Needless to say, we didn't use the service! All in all, our time at Welcome Piram was decent. I wouldn't rave about the place, but it certainly provided a comfortable bed and was in a great spot to explore the wonderful city that is Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Flemmono
Reviews.Content: Simple but yet stylish with good location near Termini station. The breakfast was a joke.

Reviews.Title: “Strongly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: silencio-profundo
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were staying at this hotel in July 2011. We bought a fantastic deal on ebay, which included a 3-night stay for 2, breakfast and one dinner (which was not mentioned in the voucher, but a very helpful lady at reception was kind to point out the main features of the deal, so it came as a nice surprise). I was quite worried about all the reviews I had read before we went there, as there was quite a dramatic difference from 'I will definitely come back' to 'Do not go there!'. The hotel situated in a perfect location. It's literally a 5-minute walk to the Termini Train Station (where you can take a shuttle bus to the airport). Also, it takes about 10-15 minutes to get to the Colleseum and it is very close to other attractions (you will be impressed how close everything in Rome is!). Frankly speaking, because of the location, we never used any taxis or other public transport. It took us about an hour or so to walk to the city of Vatican, but we did not mind, cause there was a lot of different attractions along the way. The room was not particularly big, but I very much appreciated the high ceilings! I am not sure about other rooms, but, unfortunately, there was a lack of natural light, which we did not mind, cause this let us sleep a bit longer and we were never in the room during the daytime anyway. Yes, unfortunately, there was no decent wardrobe in the room. The bathroom was very nice. It was quite small, but there was everything you need including a hairdryer. Quite a lot of space in the shower itself. The air conditioning was perfect (not quite sure how come everyone had a problem with it). There were about 20 channels you could watch, but unfortunately only a few of them were English. The room was promptly cleaned every afternoon. We never made it to the breakfast, so I cannot comment on that. I also cannot comment about the spa/swimming facilities on the roof, cause we had more interesting things to see in Rome! However, we tried a complimentary dinner for 2. It was a decent 4 course meal for two! Very pleasant and attentive service. The staff at reception was very friendly (again not sure why everyone complained about them), but we did not ask about any touristic info cause we were well prepared for the trip. Even without the discount we had, I still think it is quite cheap, and, when reviewing this hotel, people have to bear that in mind and should not expect the Radisson sort of quality.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible value for money!”
Reviews.Author: JessicaLangston
Reviews.Content: I purchased my stay at this hotel from ebay, so do shop about as I paid 25% of the listed price for a 4 day stay - anymore than this and it would not have been good value for money. Our visit to this hotel didn't start well. I had booked a room for one adult and 2 children and was shown to a very small room with one double bed. However after complaining we were eventually moved to a room with a chair bed which suited us but may not have if the children were older. The bed was incredibly hard and quite uncomfortable but not the end of the world really. Air conditioning is included and a must during high seasons. The hotel is steps away from the main transport terminus in Rome. There is no where in Rome unaccesible from this area, trams, trains, buses, taxes and the subway all come to this centre point. At the terminus there is also the tourist information where you can buy passes to all of the places of interest. I really liked this area as it was a great cultural mix however this is not a necessarily a positive for everybody. I over heard some visitors complaining about the number of asian men and a recording on a tour bus referred to the area as a dirty immigrant area. It certainly wasn't a dirty area but perhaps if you are racist / ignorant then this may not be the area for you. The room was functional and cleaned well everyday. The staff (all but the concierge) were grumpy and unhelpful in particular the restaurant staff at breakfast in the downstairs restaurant. The hotel has a lovely roof garden which was a very pleasant end to a busy day. Children were welcomed by other guests and there was an additional roof terrace for sunbathing. I would defiantly go back and use this hotel but only if I could get another ebay deal. It would not be worth the list price.

Reviews.Title: “Piram Sham”
Reviews.Author: dogodontgo
Reviews.Content: The person who rated this hotel 4 star must have been seeing double. And whoever’s wise idea it was to offer special room rates online should probably get in touch with the hotel staff – because it’s news to them too apparently. Breakfast is indeed included – if you make it downstairs before all the food has run out. Oh, and it’s not the breakfast they advertise EVERYWHERE in the hotel, on the terrace until 11am; it’s the other one that lasts until 10am, in the basement, that no-one knows about until they’ve missed it. Entry to the spa is indeed free – right after you’ve had a half an hour conversation with the spa manager to convince them of your special offer, and shown them the printed receipt to prove it. The rooms are indeed air-conditioned – but the hotel will decide on your temperature of comfort and won’t accept you telling them otherwise. Air conditioning comes on and off at regulated times of the day and can’t be modified. Wifi is charged at a bargain price of 15€ a day – and you can’t use it in your room. This hotel is overpriced without the special offer, and over-rated with the special offer. Expect nothing special and you won’t be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel”
Reviews.Author: stemacker
Reviews.Content: where do i begin ? this hotel is possibly the worst place i have ever stayed in, firstly on arrival the receptionist insisted on payment for the room the reason for which is they really dont care if you complain as they already have your money, when we were finally allowed into our room we found the tv had no signal and the air conditioning didnt work so i decided to have a jacuzzi bath to relax and that doesnt work too , i went to speak to reception and told i didnt pay for a jacuzzi bath but i can use their facilities for 10 euro and also i was told it wasnt their problem the tv didnt work.room was advertised with a balcony but unfortunately balony leads on to a alley and its very unsightly. breakfast is a shambles as my wife and i went downstairs for the breakfast but all there was to eat was fruit cocktail and single service packaged bread . rooms seemed clean enough but as we later found out to our detriment the bed was infested with bed bugs which caused many itchy sleepless nights , lastly there is NO iron in the hotel but we were instructed to walk up the road and pay for a ironing service. in conclusion this hotel is classed as a 4 star but i honestly have stayed in better hostels . please heed my words and do not stay in this hotel as it ruined our holiday

Reviews.Title: “You could probably find a better hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tiffany K
Reviews.Content: The hotel was OK. The rooms were clean and the bed was not to uncomfortable. Rome is a warm place, so we made sure our hotel offered air conditioning. Well this hotel claims to have AC but when we got there it was "broken". Every staff member had a different version of "broke" and if it was all rooms or some room and how long it had been out and when it would be working, we felt that the staff was just not being truthful about the situation. So the AC did not work, they commended sleeping witht the windows open, well the hotel is on a pretty busy road, so it was very loud with the window open and it was not much cooler with it open because again rome is warm. I asked for a different room, one that was not situated on the busy road since one with AC was not an option, well the new room was not on the road but in the middle of the hotel and the window opened to the small alley way with no breeze what so ever, and there were people (maybe restaurant staff) in the alley making a lot of noise. So again sleep was not possible. The las night we were there the AC was "working", it was blowing air at least, just not very cold air. When they came to the room to fix the AC they told me not to touch the control on the wall, so you are stuck with whatever temp and setting they pick. I can understand that things break, and if the AC was actually broken the staff was not very considerate. The staff seemed more annoyed by us asking the status of the AC, and did not offer any customer service to make up for the huge inconvenience to thier guest. My personal oppinon is that if your hotel is not running at close to 100% and your guest are suffering because of this you should offer a little customer service, a meal? A fan? Or how about a "I am really sorry" if nothing else. The location was not bad, close to tour bus stops (dont buy the bus they sell at hotel you can find it cheaper). I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fifth time here, but service going downhill”
Reviews.Author: HMTurnbull
Reviews.Content: Fifth time visitng this hotel as it is in a great location. Has always been adequate but this visit was appalling. No air conditioning for the four nights we were there. A could not care less attitude from the staff. On our first visit three years ago it was classed as a 3 star. It is now supposed to be a 4 star. The service and staff were much better when it was a 3 star.

Reviews.Title: “Ticked every box!!”
Reviews.Author: Michael S
Reviews.Content: I recently just came back from a week in Rome, it was my first time visiting therefore i wanted to try and walk everywhere and soak up as much of the city and sites as possible. This hotel was ideally located it a 5 minute walk to the colosseum and the main shopping streets. Just off the streets you have got the pantheon, the Spanish steps, the trevi fountain and a great park. The hotel its self is a pleasant and well presented hotel not much to look at from the outside but lovely inside. Pleased to discover there was a roof top garden fitted with sun lounges, a bar and 2 Jacuzzis. Great hotel and an amazing city will stay here again when we go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel amenities but in a great location”
Reviews.Author: rachel b
Reviews.Content: Good value accomodation in great location for main tourist attractions. Clean but basic room amenities, with limited storage for clothes/etc and virtually no space in showeroom for toiletries. Were advised on booking this was a 4 star hotel, which we would certainly not agree with. Also agree with some previous reviews that room air conditioning not effective enough. On the plus side we found the reception staff very helpful. A tip for the hotel - it would be helpful if there were some signs around the hotel informing which direction room numbers/restaurant/etc are in.

Reviews.Title: “READ THE NEGATIVE REVIEWS AND BELIEVE THEM”
Reviews.Author: Janap183
Reviews.Content: There were a few glitches with the room, despite the nice hotel facilities: 1 - The aircon unit in our room did not work. it was forever stuck on 29 degrees (on a sweltering Roman August day) and when we told reception, they informed us that they were sending one of their colleagues upstairs in ten minutes. This did not happened. When we informed them again after waiting for 2 hours, they said that there was nothing they can do. This, to my opinion, was terrible service. 2 - The wifi service wasnt working (Again, as with above, we informed reception). Same answer, same level of customer service. 3 - Our satellite tv stopped all of a sudden (See above. Again. They mentioned that it should work within the hour. Same thing.) The staff exude customer service to start off with. But it felt more like a sham, a front, excuses after excuses piled up afterwards. Because of this, i would not recommend this hotel. i have seen the manager of said hotel replying on tripadvisor (to some negative reviews) that he would compensate by slashing off a percentage on their next visit. But after their experiences and mine, I'm fairly certain we're all put off by the hotel's staff and will not be returning in the foreseeable future. A monetary compensation would be more sufficient for the discomfort that we have suffered.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel and great location!”
Reviews.Author: Jenjamin C
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well worth a stay, 5 min walk from main train station and the metro. Right in the centre and it easy to reach all the main attractions. Nice clean and tidy room with fresh sheets, towels etc everyday. Check in is at 2 but they let us check in at 1. Although it doesnt have a swimming pool, it does have 2 lovely jacquzzis on the roof terrace which is great after walking round in the heat. Breakfast is continental so a bit basic but did us well with cereal, crossiants, lemon juice and a cup of tea. We Would recommend this hotel for anyone who wants to see all the attractions in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: satyan_israni
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is very average with basic amenities. The best part of the hotel is its location. Its located quite close to the main Rome Train and Bus Terminus and just about 5/7 mins walking distance. Also there are several street side restaurants and cafes all around the hotel, so eating is never a problem. Although, there is no room service in the hotel itself. The staff at the front desk is helpful and provided us with useful tips on how to get around rome.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and will come back!”
Reviews.Author: martina k
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and the staff very friendly and helpful. I haven't used the spa but the roof terrace jacuzzi was an extra bonus to survive the heat. Piram hotel is very well located and allowed us to walk to pretty much every sight. It's just around the corner of Termini station, the main train station in Rome. The A/C worked fine too. I only came back from Rome yesterday and I have already recommended this hotel to my friends and family. I will definitely stay at Piram hotel again on my next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you paid for....”
Reviews.Author: John T
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel that was near the train station, for one night, before we left Rome for the airport and we ended up here. Sparsely furnished with a view of an alleyway and a shower with a clogged drain was the highlights of our room. On the plus side, the staff was very efficient setting up our car to take us to the airport but I feel we overpaid for the service. if you need a cheap hotel for a night, this is the place for you but go into the experience with a good sense of humor.

Reviews.Title: “poor stay”
Reviews.Author: Lillie D
Reviews.Content: we got it booked in advance by looking at the ratings, location on the website but it was awful to see the room given and pictures shown on site. Small room with small bathroom without any facility to keep clothes and towel. On booking we were given English breakfast but were provided simple breakfast. we paid for tripple room (Roms is with three twin Beds) whereas were given three single bed saying that room u booked is not available. If it was not available then why they people booked or show on booking. Rate difference between both rooms is approx Rs.2000/-. I will ask Hotel.com people to check this thru whom we got the room booked,because this will just spoil their credibility

Reviews.Title: “I would not recommend this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: turist_from_NYC
Reviews.Content: First of all, receptionists were simply unhelpful. Well, they waited for EXACT time to do check in (at 2pm). Moreover, they asked: are you first time in Rome? - and they tried to sell/recommend special tourist packages. Second disappointment: bathroom. It was not clean: mold, rust and etc. Third disappointment: a complementary breakfast. You have to get up very early to catch a full menu. It was the same (we stayed 7 days). Good: It is located very close to Termini and metro. However, at night Termini is not a good place to visit. I would not recommend to stay in this hotel. In my opinion, Termini neighborhood it is too touristy. Next time I would stay in Trastevere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hote, great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: aimankay
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised that hotel was so near to Train station as well as Bus station where I could get bus to any major tourist attraction. Room was clean and I was only expecting that. It had a safe with pin and a mini fridge. Stuff in the fridge was expensive so I bought my own drinks and kept them in the fridge. TV never worked and I wasn't bothered as I was there to see Rome not Roman TV. Breakfast was included in our stay and was nice and I loved the red orange juice. There are all types of shops and small supermarkets nearby and transport was never a problem. The Room had AC which was set to 28 degrees centigrade which initially I thought was too hot but with time I got used to of it. Staff was very friendly and spoke different languages. They even helped me send copy of my passport to me when I was in Venice and I am really thankful to them for this else I would have been charged by the train conductor for not having any ID while travelling in a sleeper train.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible staff”
Reviews.Author: Stub1
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff would not accept that we had prepaid the room, even though the confirmation clearly stated with capital letters: PREPAID. I had to spend 30 minutes arguing with the reception staff at check-in, then another 30 minutes at check out. We ended up having to pay at the reception to avoid missing our flight. Luckily Venere.com refunded the initial payment without any discussion. The hotel in itself has convenient location, 5 minutes walk from the Termini and Metro. The room was quite big with acceptable air conditioning and shower pressure. If you are looking for good service, this is definately not the hotel you`re looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Good accomodation. Reasonable rates”
Reviews.Author: OBrienHann
Reviews.Content: Booked here on a recommendation from friends who spoke very positively of the hotel. Stayed one night in July 2011. Had booked one night in 4-person suite on internet and had some difficulty at check-in as it appeared they did not have the reservation despite the fact that I had the printed confirmation in hand. They seemed confused and clearly did not have record of our reservation at all. Also I had paid an added 35 Euros for early check-in and breakfast. We arrived between 10:00 AM and 10:30 AM. It took close to two hours for them to resolve the check-in issue. This was the deal they promoted: "1 x Early Check-in @ €35.00 For 2 people Why don't you take advantage of our special early check-in? Your room will be available whenever you want and we will be glad to offer you: -Breakfast for 2 people in the room or Buffet Breakfast or -5 euro voucher to be spent for Food & Beverage" Clearly the room was not ready "whenever we wanted". They tried to be helpful but the delay was off-putting and they did not seem at all apologetic, though this could be the language/culture barrier. We did not feel all that "Welcome" that's for sure. We did get into our room before the check-in time but not in time for breakfast. They honored the commitment with a coupon for lunch at their location and despite my request that the additional 35 Euro charge for "early check-in and breakfast" be dropped they said we did get early check in because 3 PM is regular check in and they gave us a coupon for lunch. Was not worth more time spent discussing it so we went on with our day. Lesson learned...if booking by internet also phone in advance to ensure things will be place on arrival. Don't bother with the early check-in deal. For 35 Euros (for two people) it was not worth it. As for the room it was large and very clean. More than suitable for a family of 4 (two teens aged 14 and 17). Air conditioned room but did not get very cool...not really a big issue as it was comfortable enough even if a bit warm and humid. Teeny tiny TV on the wall (didn't matter because we were not there to watch TV of course but we did have a laugh at it). Location is close to Termini and within walking distance if you don't have too much luggage. Lots of nearby restaurants and easy walking (or metro access) to all the sites of Rome. Would feel safe walking around area alone during daylight but not at night. Food is average...breakfast was mostly pastries that did not seem fresh and were not all that tasty. Lunch was okay. Lots of options for food nearby so I would go elsewhere. Overall for accomodation the hotel is quite nice but due to the check-in issues and the overall reception we got I don't think I would stay there again. I am sure this is not everyone's experience...maybe we just hit a bad day...as I said at the start our friends spoke well of the place and had a good experience there. Rate for one night not including early check-in charge, was 210 Euros for a 4-person suite.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, but not satisfied with the staff”
Reviews.Author: Pnill
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is nice, but the staff wasn't quite sure what they were doing. When we checked in, we were told that the total price of the room should be drawn from my credit card the same day. They also told us that we had breakfast included in our room rate, and showed us the breakfast-area. The next day, we went down for breakfast, sat down and started eating, when a staff member came to us and told us that we didn't have breakfast included, and that we had to pay 20 euro(!) extra for a lousy meal. In the reception, the same receptionist as the day before now denied that she told us we had breakfast included. We had to pay 20 euro extra, for something we could have got for 5 euros outside the hotel. There was also a problem with payment of the room, they never charged my card as they told me they would do the first day, and I had to swipe the card three times for the room, city tax and the lousy breakfast. Every time i swiped my card I had to pay my bank a fee, so altogether the room suddenly got much more expensive than I had planned for. The rooms are ok, the beds are a bit hard, and the air condition in our room did NOT work. Thats bad when its 40 degrees celsius outside! All in all, OK hotel, but Im not impressed.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: veritymsmith
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here on a short break. The staff were friendly and helpful on arrival. Room and en-suite were clean and a good size, with a TV and the shower had decent water pressure. The location of the hotel is fantastic, especially if going to and from rome airports via shuttlebus or using any bus or train. Main attractions within easy walking distance. We very much enjoyed the jacuzzis on the roof (which are nice and cold) after a long days of walking with sore feet. We booked the 'romantic package' that the hotel offers (as it was the same price as regular), from which we expected to receive a welcome drink on arrival. We did not get this drink, but when we queried it the next day we got a free 3 course meal instead which was a pleasant surprise, and very tasty. The only complaint we have with this hotel is that we were given 2 single beds instead of a double, and this wasn't fixed though we were assured it would be. We weren't expecting much as we got a very good price but would strongly consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Nice Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JohnnySpider
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family for a 40th Birthday teat. We stayed in a suite which was both comfortable and large. The bathroom was lovely and the shower powerful. The air con was adequate, but not as good as some would expect. The breakfast (continental) was fine. The roof top terrace was beautiful and actually had a birds eye view of St. Peter's Basillica. The roof top jacuzzi's are a very and unusual feature of a Roman hotel, but very very welcome. I must go out of may way to comment on the helpfulness and cheerfulness of all of the staff, particularly the blonde receptionist (tall lady) - we did not catch her name. Overall, pleasing and happy stay. John and Sharon (from Liverpool)

Reviews.Title: “NO AC AND RUDE STAFF”
Reviews.Author: randybliss
Reviews.Content: The only thing i have good to say about this place is the location. The staff was rude they would not turn the ac below 83 and dont have a fan in the entire hotel DONT STAY HERE not a 4 star hotel by any means maybe 2.5 stars

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel room and wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Nadia_Elamin
Reviews.Content: Hotel was 5 minute walk from Termini station. The room was beautifully furnished and beds were comfortable. Shower and bidet had really great water pressure, and toilet had two types of flush. Shower was spacious, soaps given were nice and big and large fluffy towels. Large flat screen tv with internet and keyboard. Balcony was nice feature. Definitely will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: Emma853536
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. It is quite basic but I found it very clean and the staff were friendly. Rooms are quite big and although the bathroom was clean it could do with being updated - we had no shower curtain for some reason! Breakfast was bog standard but for two days it was fine and we sat outside to eat which i thought was a great touch in the heart of the city. Location wise we walked everywhere to the coloseum and trevi fountain! but on your doorstep are the train station, mentro, bus station and tour buses. I would recommend for couples only and only for max 2-3nights.

Reviews.Title: “We were diappointed, and we will not come back”
Reviews.Author: chimi53
Reviews.Content: I love the location of the hotel, however, the hotel felt short of my expectations for a 4 star hotel. The building inside is old and need upgrading. The rooms were dirty and I found bugs in my bed. I advised the reception and did not hear anything from them. So, I decided to check with the manager. She at first tried to tell me that I was alergic to something and my bumps were due to this. I asked her to come to the room with me, so that she can look at the bug I catched, and the ones in the room. After she saw them she transfer my family and I to another room. In the new room the air conditioner, phone and TV did not work. I advised the reception their aswer was the air conditioner will be fix the next day. The air was never fixed, and when I complained the receptionist just shrugged his shoulders. The hotel had a bar in the roof, the view was nice, but the drinks were expensive, and the apetizers were not free. The "restaurant" was not worth the price. The staff is disrespectul, unfriendly, and will not help. I find this hotel over priced, dirty and I would give it a 1 star. It is a shame that trip advisor is given the hotel 4 stars (the hotel has a sign in the reception that reflect this).

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fannyfan
Reviews.Content: No air conditioning in rooms.What little there is is on a timer that comes on periodicaly.$15 EURO for internet that after i purchased was told that it did not work on apple products such as iphones and ipads.Had a cab booked for 6:30 pm to take us to the airport for a 9:00 pm flight that did not show up so we had to rush to the train station.Finaly we had to cancel our final night i contacted Expedia about 5 days in advance because we were told they needed 48 hours notice.The only way they would cancel was if the whole reservation {4 nights} was canceled and rebooked for {3 nights} the cost was $250 dollars Canadian more than what we were paying for 4 nights.There was a 22 euro tax they said was a city of Rome tax that we were made aware of when checking out.Any Canadians we talked to had many of the same complaints with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - close to Termini”
Reviews.Author: Reiserundt
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in July, and was very pleased with the hotel. Compared with rates and location. We arrived very late the first night due a late flight. I was afraid of getting the "sorry, we are full - but you can stay at one of our apartments" message like other reviewsrs have experienced. So I emailed the hotel in the morning and told them about our late flight and they were happy to get that information, and they were welcoming when we arrived. The hotel is close to Termini, and easy to find if you check the map and streets before you leave Termini. The location is great for bus/metro around the town and also airport express. We did not have any problems with the AC, as other reviewers mentioned. Hotel were nice and clean, the staff were helpful. Comfy beds and no funny smells in the room. We had view to the backyard, I guess that reduced the streetnoise some. We had breakfast on the roof, and the buffet is quite good for beeing an italian hotel. Even scrambled eggs and bacon.

Reviews.Title: “super”
Reviews.Author: dijana-budva
Reviews.Content: Super hotel, great location, the staff are friendly.I will definitely stay in this hotel if I was to go back to rome and would highly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel on our 25 day European trip.”
Reviews.Author: Ilovetennisi
Reviews.Content: After complaining 3 times the first evening about the lack of air conditioning our receptionist told us he would switch our room the next morning. The reception people regulate the temperature from a computer and adjusted it 4 times the first night with no success. We packed up and left for a 14 hour tour, left the key, returned and were told that the manager said they would fix the air conditioning and we were not to be moved. The hotel went on trying to fix the air for several days, it was noisier, not cooler and the final result was that air conditioner leaked on our suitcase and several items in my suitcase were ruined. The last night we were moved to another room. The front desk people had absolutely no respect for their customers. The management simply did not care. They ruined the Rome portion of our wonderful trip. Don't make the same mistake.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, well located”
Reviews.Author: CLGonthemove
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed in this hotel end of June/beggining of July after previously using the same hotel myself two years ago on a trip with friends. We had arrived on an early flight, and so were not allowed to check in until 4pm, however we did use the luggage room located close to reception, which was useful as this meant we could sightsee and then come back for check-in!. The hotel is well located, near Termini and a short walk from the Trevi fountain and Spanish steps. This was useful when getting a bus from the airport (4 euros) as it was only a street or so walk. For the journey back we used the taxi service attached to the hotel, which although was expensive was very reliable (i had used this service previously with my friends and both times the driver turned up 15mins early!). The decor and amenities were very good, although it was a shame that i had not read about the hot tub's on the roof garden before going and had not taken a swimsuit - it wouldve been very nice to relax in after a hard days walk!. We also opted for the breakfast which was quite nice, with about the choice you would expect for a continental breakfast in any hotel. Only a few faults to note. As described in alot of posts there was some issues with air-conditioning. We found that when we tried to get it to work that it wouldnt. When we gave up however it did seem to work on its own and so we set the temperature when we first entered the room and left it, It would then eventually work of its own accord about 90% of the time!. Also the roof garden also seems to be expensive. We used this on the first night and were charged 12 euros for a beer and a glass of wine. We therefore only used the bar the once! The hotel doesnt look much from the outside (as also noted in other posts), however i dont think this really matters as the hotel inside is lovely and has a nice decor. I would definately consider using this hotel again if i were to travel back to rome, as it is comfortable and good value for money. The location itself is also very handy when seeing the sights, especially as it is next to the underground, which can be used for longer trips (to the vatican) for only a euro for a single trip, any stop.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ANGfromDERRY
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews on this hotel and was abit weiry of it, but thought I will try it out as I had my mother with me and I wanted to book a hotel close to Roma Terminial. The staff were friendly enough although I think Itailians can be a bit grumpy. The hotel is in a great location, clean, good size rooms, spa, food was excellent including the breakfast. I will definitely stay in this hotel if I was to go back to rome and would highly recommend it to anyone. During my stay the hotel was booked out and i never heard any residents complaining about anything.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, clean & comfortable, good value!”
Reviews.Author: alexdc11
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for a couple days in early July, and we were very happy with our choice. Great customer service, fast and efficient check in, clean rooms, good decor, and the old-school elevator across from the super-new Schindler was a cool touch. The covers on the beds weren't top of the line, and there was a bit of mold in the shower, but these minor details didn't detract from our overall positive impression. The location is FANTASTIC - definitely a great place to stay if you a) are coming in by train/bus from the airport and have a big bag - it's a very short walk from the train station; b) don't have too much time in Rome and want to walk to all the major points of interests with ease.

Reviews.Title: “A welcoming experience”
Reviews.Author: Tara244
Reviews.Content: Welcome Piram was located in a prime area a short walk from Termini Station and close to shops, sites and restaurants. The service was excellent and the reception were happy to help organise any of the day trips that were offered. Breakfast was excellent although limited. Rooms were very clean and comfortable.
