Overall, fantastic location and lovely hotel. The only complaint would be that wifi was very expensive and city tax was not included in the room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome (yeah right) Piram Hotel; my worst experience to date! We arrived in Rome quite late (around 8 pm) anticipating”
Reviews.Author: airamelis
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Rome quite late (around 8 pm) anticipating finding our hotel and getting a good night’s sleep. We had booked through hotels.com and had also seen their webpage, and were convinced that this would be a nice stay (beautiful rooms, spa you name it!). First we were quite surprised how difficult it was to find the hotel, but of course when the façade looks like it could need some serious TLC you don’t expect it to be a 4* hotel. We were “met” by the most obnoxious receptionist, with a sleazy smile and at look saying “I’m so much better than you”. After telling him our names, he smiled even more and started to tell us that he had some WOOONDERFUL news for us. Unfortunately a complete floor (so much for not checking with tripadvisor first:(…didn’t have time)was closed, so he couldn’t give us our room. BUT! He was such a kind fellow that he would give us this fantastic apartment just a short walk from the hotel, much better than a room! Already here we got quite suspicious. We tried to say that we wanted the room we had booked, since two of the friends we were travelling with also had a room there. That was not possible, and he would not listen at all. He could not understand why we weren’t happy when he had given us this fantastic opportunity. We were quite tired, and didn’t want to quarrel, so we settled for this “fantastic” apartment. (we later heard that our friends had gotten the same story with closed floor and apartment, but they managed to get their room at last). My friend negotiated that we should at least get free breakfast for the inconvenience. With a sleazy smile he claimed that we already had gotten a better option than we had booked for, but OK. After the “short” walk (not very short with two heavy suitcases!), we got into the apartment which was not that great at all. Seemed like it had not been cleaned in ages (dust everywhere, trash on the floor, stinky trash under sink not emptied ….I could go on). My friend checked our beds at once: BIG YELLOW SPOT on the sheets. Went back to the hotel and complained (the staff seems like we should be grateful for that they even bother to listen to us) we were promised new sheets. To be sure it was done (and nothing got stolen….we had already lost all trust now) we followed the guy. When we got back to the apartment, well, you did not have to speak Italian to understand what the guy was saying! After the session of Italian swearing, he tried to convince us that it was not a spot but how the light was falling on the sheet! But if we really wanted it, he would change the sheets free of charge(!damn right you will!). Other things that should be mentioned are that there were electric wires sticking out everywhere, also in the shower!! They also wanted a credit card as safety when we checked in, even if the hotel was prepaid (never tried that before). We had a terrible night’s sleep, since the walls were paper thin (neighbors watching TV all night) and because we felt very unsafe (if they could move us here, give us dirty sheets etc, what else could they do). In the morning we of course had to walk all the way back to the hotel to get our breakfast, which was terrible, but this was no surprise. So to sum it up: terrible TERRIBLE staff, terrible rooms (I can only speak for the apartment, but our friends room was no better), terrible feeling of being conned and a joke of a breakfast. Happy we only were staying for one night. I could have tolerated this from a hostel, 1 * hotel etc, but not from a claimed 4* hotel for 100€ a night! They even had a sign on the front desk that they were traveller's choice on tripadvisor.com, which is not true! I will never recommend this hotel to anyone and I will never book a hotel again without reading every single review of a hotel on tripadvisor!

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN - BROKEN PROMISES AND RUDE STAFF”
Reviews.Author: 1travelsallthetime
Reviews.Content: We were booked for the Apartment which is 2 bedroom, 2 bath, Kitchenette and pull out sofa bed and is in a building abuot a kilometer away from the main hotel. When we arrived at the hotel at 11:00 am, we were told to come back at 2 pm for check in which was completely fine. We left our luggage and returned at 2:00 pm. We were then told our room still wasn't ready and that it would be five minutes. At 2:30 p.m. we inquired when our room would be ready, and were told in five minutes. About 2:45 we were walked over to the apartment building by one of the employees of the hotel. The lift (elevator) wasn't working and we had to carry our luggage up 5 flights of stairs. We then learned from other tourist and employee's of the building that the elevator routinely and daily went out of service and was not reliable. We were told to dial 9 to reach the hotel lobby if we had questions. Our phone in the room could not reach the hotel as suggested and just rang into the other room in the apartment. We borrowed the phone 3 times from a business next to the apartment and were told the elevator would be working in 5 minutes. It still was not working by 4:00 pm. We then borrowed a phone again and were told to come back to the hotel and they would give us a full refund. We booked another hotel on the way back to the Welcome Piram. When arriving at the Welcome Piram we were greeted (for lack of a better word) by the most rude and obnoxious person - that I have ever met in my 49 years. He said there would be no refund and that the elevator would be working in 5 minutes. I tried to explain that we had already wasted an entire afternoon of our vacation with empty promises of "5 minutes" and were told by numerous other tourist in the building as well as employees that the elevator was always breaking and always a problem. He talked over us and would not budge on his position until we made a scene in the lobby and demanded to speak to a supervisor. Finally, at 5:30 pm we were given a refund. I would not recommend this hotel with this type of customer service to ANYONE. I understand that the apartment is a different building then the hotel, but the customer service is the same. The employee in question was named "Nicola" He was the rudest, and most arrogant person I have ever talked to in customer service. He laughed in our face and talked over us the entire time. His Supervisor finally made him give us a full refund. I told him that I would tell Trip Advisor how unprofessional and arrogant he was. He laughed and said that he didn't care and spelled his name to be included. Take it for what it's worth.

Reviews.Title: “Okay value, but A/C didn't work well”
Reviews.Author: CaperGal
Reviews.Content: This is a good, solid choice of a hotel. It's very close to Roma Termini, although make sure when arriving from the airport that you depart from the main entrance of the station. We left from a side entrance and it took longer than we thought to walk there. The rooms were fine, nothing to write home about but had lovely high ceilings and a clean bathroom. There is a fair bit of street noise (as with anywhere in Rome), so bring earplugs if this bothers you. The breakfast is decent - pretty much the same as anywhere else in terms of selection. The reason I am not giving this hotel four stars is because we could not for the life of us figure out how to make the a/c unit stay on. This made for a very uncomfortable night in 29C temperatures. Overall, I would stay here again but would make sure I asked about the A/C!

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel but you can't trust the staff”
Reviews.Author: ManateeCouple
Reviews.Content: We really liked staying at Welcome Piram Hotel. We were lucky to get a room with a balcony, and the breakfast was okay except for the "ham". The staff in the reception was of rather mixed quality. Upon the day of checkout we were allowed to leave our luggage with the hotel and it was put in a separate room we assumed would be locked up during the day. We came back three hours later to find that my bag had been opened and someone had removed my iPod touch from its casing. Rather clever, so I wouldn't notice the theft until later. Reaction from staff: We are very sorry, but it is not our problem. Wouldn't go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Termini station”
Reviews.Author: Fuchsiapower
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located near Termini Station, probably less than 5-minute walk. The room seemed big (probably due to the high ceiling). The bathroom had a bidet. The dinner we had at their restaurant on our first night was pretty good and was a good value for our money. Their breakfast spread consisted of bread, doughnuts, ham, cheese, cereal, canned fruits, and yogurt. Front desk personnel were okay. Eventhough we will probably choose a hotel closer to Piazza Navona on our next visit, I still recommend this hotel especially if you plan on taking the train to other Italian cities. We did not have to take a cab after checking out. We just rolled our luggage down the street to the Termini station to take the train to Florence.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the Train Station”
Reviews.Author: KenIz
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel if you need something walking distance from the train station. Nice clean rooms and a good rate for Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for sight seeing”
Reviews.Author: SurjitParkash
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in excellent location, staff friendly and helpful. Rooms and facilities are generally basic. Not 4 star standard it claims. My daughter and I stayed at this hotel over a long weekend. Our sole purpose for this trip was sightseeing. We wanted somewhere convenient and this hotel certainly is convenient, with many famous sights within walking distance (for the able bodied). Train station just few minutes away for further a field sights (vatican....). Overall we achieved our objective and had great time. Rome is wonderful place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent position. AC, room cleaning and hot water below standards.”
Reviews.Author: AdamMatan
Reviews.Content: We have arrived to Rome for a 5-nights vacation, and paid 680 Euros (~1000 dollars as for 2011) for our stay. Our demands are quite modest: Good location, Clean room, Air condition, hot shower - We don't expect any luxury. Pros: Location, Location, Location ************************************* The hotel's location is excellent - just near the Termini station, Rome's public transportation hub. This means we had a airport train, Italy train, metro and bus station 500 meters from our room. This saves lots of time and money on Airport transportation, eases the access to all city parts which are near a metro station (mainly the Colosseum and the Vatican) and most important - after the metro closes at 21:00, every second bus arrives to the Termini so we don't have to switch buses or start planning itineraries when we're drunk at 01:00. We also took a day trip to Venice, which was easy because we could find out the costs and depart early from the station. Furthermore, Rome's center isn't that big, so many times we just walked to our destination in order to feel the spirit of the city. The neighbourhood feels safe, well lighten, and has some late-night restaurants open, so walking wasn't scary. Cons: Air condition, cleanliness, hot water, tax ************************************************** * There was NO AIR CONDITION, and we stayed at late may. After we have struggled with it for 10 minutes, we called the reception. They told us it's due to a city regulation. We didn't find any reference to it on the web. Furthermore, the staff wouldn't provide us with any ventilator. We had to sleep with an open window, and wake up from the sounds of the near nightclub, the morning garbage truck and other city voices. This is totally unacceptable in a 200$/night hotel. * The shower and toilet wasn't neatly cleaned. We found some hairs of the previous guest in all over the toilet room. It really, really sucks. We took a shower with our sandals on because we didn't trust the hygiene level. This would be outrageous in a 30$ youth hostel double room, let alone a a 200$/night hotel. * There was only warm, not hot, water in the shower. Again, this really, really sucks. We walked many kilometers each day, and came back to the hotel dying for a hot shower to relax hour muscles. After we found out the water wasn't hot, we called the staff. They promised to help, but did nothing. Again, This would be outrageous in a 30$ youth hostel double room, let alone a a 200$/night hotel. * When we arrived, the receptionist told us that there was an extra 30-euros tax (3 euros per person per night). That's a good policy for a youth hostel, but when you charge such a high price for the room, I expect the taxes to be included in the price. * Breakfast was OK. Summary ********** Neighbourhood's excellent, hotel sucks. Try to find another hotel on that side of the Termini. This is a real shame because making this hotel excellent takes only a very little managerial effort: Fix the AC and the shower, clean better, and get 5-star ratings.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Hotel, Well Refurbished”
Reviews.Author: Janet039
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very close to Termini station, easy to reach all parts of Rome. The hotel has recently been refurbished, public areas very comfortable. Terrace at the side was disappointing. Rooms good but the furniture had presumably been picked up from junk shops and the small chests of crawers were neither use nor ornament. One modern lift and one lovely old fashioned one.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: holly1985
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend booked this hotel as a surprise romantic getaway just before christmas. I'm usually quite picky on hotels and send hours trawling the internet before i decide on which hotel to book-so I had no real prejudgment of what the hotel would be like. Location: Great location - 10 minute walk from the Collesseum and a 5 minute walk to Metro station (and very cheap at 1Euro for a single ticket). THe hotel is within easy walking distance from the Termini station (around 5 mins walk). Hotel/Staff: On arrival we were greeted by a most charming man who was funny and helpful. The concierge was also very attentive and polite. The entrance seems to be quite non-descript but is very ornate and beautiful once you are inside. There is a magnificent old lift that runs through the core of the hotel and a new lift for those who think the older model looks a little rickety. The Rooms: The rooms in the hotel weren't the biggest but did have two rooms (a bedroom and lounge) which were clean and nicely decorated. The lounge had a sofa, a table and two chairs and a minibar (very reasonable prices) and a free safe. B&B: We booked for bed and breakfast - but didn't make it to breakfast as there were so many little bistro/bakeries we wanted to try nearby. Food: Great food throughout Rome (obviously) but one which we loved was 'Chianti' situated near the Trevi fountain. Transport: You can catch a train or taxi easily from this hotel to all parts of Rome. The hotel even called a taxi for us one evening. Be careful however as many of the taxi drivers try to over charge you but agreeing a fee earlier when it would never be that expensive on the meter. All in all an excellent stay and a lovely hotel in a great area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service, Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GaryP1989
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed at Hotel Piram in April 2011. After booking this hotel through Last Minute I was pleased with my choice. After reading some of the reviews on TripAdvisor I was quite concerned to what sort of hotel I was going to go to, especially with talk of being moved to another hotel, and the staff not being the nicest of people. Upon arrival I was pleased to see this was not the case. The staff were friendly and very helpful, this was true for the whole 4 days we were there. The room we were in looked onto an enclosed area with other rooms all around, which made the room quite dark, (I am sure this is not the case for every room) but the room itself was very clean and spacious enough for the time we were there. There was a safe fixed to the wall of a large size, and the bed was comfortable. Breakfast you could say is a bit un-adventurous, but not terrible, plenty of ham, cheese, cereal and bread to keep you going until lunch time. I am sure that if you wanted to moan about this hotel then you could, but in all honesty, from what I experienced, you would have to be really looking, and from what I was expecting after reading some of the reviews on TripAdvisor, I was very pleasantly surprised. Also not forgetting you are in ROME, how much time do you spend in the hotel...go and explore! Rome was made enjoyable and easy by staying at Hotel Piram. Thank You!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location but Expensive”
Reviews.Author: Hedorick
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Piram is located very near Termini station and its convenient location was the main reason for our choice. The room is small, the bathroom smaller (though functional). There is no place to put your luggage except on the bed or in front of the door. The air conditioning isn't turned on in April, so we couldn't adjust the room temperature. Probably ok as I thought it warm and my girlfriend thought it was cool, so that kept us from fighting about it. I wouldn't recommend the restaurant for either breakfast or dinner. Not bad, just not that good with mediocre service. Two blocks away is "La Gallina Blanca" a much better choice.

Reviews.Title: “very good location”
Reviews.Author: thereresaferguson
Reviews.Content: i stayed in this hotel with my husband and two friends,,, the first thing i would say is be very aware if you leave your luggage in the luggage room !!! as this room is left unattended at times and my friends mobile phone was taken out of his hand luggage.... by whom we dont know ..... so just make sure you do not leave any valuables in your luggage!!!!!. apart from that this hotel was a good budget hotel.... not 4 star though but you get what you pay for !!!!! it was clean and the reception staff are very friendly,,,, the resatraunt seemed to be very short staffed at breakfast times and we felt guilty asking for a cup of tea!!!!!! the service was not good because of the lack of staff ! overall though would stay there agian...

Reviews.Title: “My greatest mistake to have booked this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Amritashekar
Reviews.Content: I travelled here with my partner last year in august. First shock is that the hotel doesnt display its name board, it was so hard for us to find this hotel. Receptionists were good, helped us with our queries on stations & travel to attractions. Rooms were pathetic. Bathroom was badly maintained. Food was not great either. It says 4 star hotel but is no where close to a 3 star hotel also. Totally waste of money

Reviews.Title: “Better than reviews. for money great!”
Reviews.Author: cazbar2
Reviews.Content: 5 min walk from ternimi. Not allowed in to room tll later (pm) but able to check in and leave luggage( in unsecured room) Had the romantica package with expedia( 1evening meal encluded) and was worth it as too tired to go out the first night and was better than reported. Restaurant busy. service good, house white approx E15 and drinkable. As with in a few steps away from Termini good transport.. We walked it all. Sensible shoes and early nights! Our room huge (no526) BUT if you needed to use the bidet it may be interesting.( SMALL BATHROOM) However good shower, hairdryer and beautifullly decorated. Breakfast the usual.( never didwork out what the pink juice was!) Breads, pastrys, meats, ceraels. fruits etc. only complaint was slow with the coffee or tea! We dint find anywhere great in local area to eat (I expect thats just us) and although we are quite choosy with regard to eating out found the hotel restaurant, busy and quite charming. We found it very convienient and walked all of Rome(We are quite fit and were exhasted)

Reviews.Title: “Pleasent stay and good location”
Reviews.Author: Pipertriple
Reviews.Content: We got checked in straight away and our room was nice and big. The position of the hotel was good, most things are walking distance as Rome is not very big and it is right by Termini train station. The breakfast was fine but it was the same every day, the choices were cereal, bread and cake. A bit repeatative. Our weekend was booked through last minute so it was included in the price. Overall the hotel was nice but if I was to go to Rome again I would probably stay a little bit more in the centre.

Reviews.Title: “The room / hotel”
Reviews.Author: lcm435
Reviews.Content: I and my wife went to Rome for the weekend (our birthday) we stayed at this hotel the staff was very friendly, but not quick off the mark! If you needed some help. The room was very small and the bed was very uncomfortable it felt like we were sleeping with no mattress. The television in the room only shows CNN news nothing else. It would be nice to have something other then news to unwind to in your room after a day of walking around Rome. The hotel is located very well, about 2 minutes from the metro. That as good as it gets. Next time we’ll find a much better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Certainly not a Four Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RayC43
Reviews.Content: Cramped room with small double bed and no view except dirty outside walls of same hotel. Poor breakfast. No room safe as promised.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location.....disappointing hotel ....”
Reviews.Author: Lovetotravel1978_10
Reviews.Content: We returned from the hotel a few days ago. The hotel is in a good location, beware though, if you catch the Leonardo Express train from Fumunciano Airport to Termini the platform is to the far left of the station. It takes at least 10 minutes to walk from one end of the station to the other. The hotel is then 100metres away. The lobby and reception are small and uninviting, the lifts seem to take forever to arrive. I had read reviews before I left and from recommendations I requested a room facing the street on the second floor...sadly this request was overlooked. We had a room on the forth floor (424) which overlooked an alley. The beds were comfortable but only one pillow each and the TV was so high and far away from the bed it was uncomfortable to watch. The "safe" was not actually attached to anything and could be lifted out of the cupboard that it was in....when my husband queried this, he was told that most of the rooms are like it. We knew that it was a continental breakfast but they were clearly under staffed. The food was not being replensihed fast enough and it took us ages to get a waitress to clean our table. We waited a long time for a tea and a coffee and there was no chance of a second cup! There was no orange juice which was also a shame. This was sold to us by Lastminute.com as a 4 star hotel but I felt that 3 star would be more appropriate. Friends were staying in a 4 star around the corner and it was far superior. Despite the negatives, it is in a really good location. There are lots of nice places to eat close by and it is ideal for transport links to sight see. It hasn't put us off Rome but would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, economical stay”
Reviews.Author: jessanj
Reviews.Content: I booked the Welcome Piram Hotel as part of an Expedia deal. It took me a little while to find the hotel since I came out of Termini station at the back entrance. However, it is very conveniently located about 5 mins walk from the station. It is far enough from the dodgy areas around the station. I had a standard room, Room 336. For me, it was a pleasant enough room. Had a firm bed - 2 singles pushed together but that doesn't bother me. The shower was great even though the bathroom was small. However, this is Europe and generally bathrooms are small. The walls are a bit thin so there is noise from the adjoining rooms and I had noisy teenage Brits one evening but then I think they left the next day so I had peace and quite again. There is street noise of course but I can sleep through that. I didn't have the breakfast option in my deal and, at any rate, I wouldn't have paid the Euros 6 per day for it. There is a coffee bar on the corner of the street and i had my capuccino and pastry for breakfast and paid no more than Euros 2 for it. There is a fabulous trattoria around the corner on the next street - Ristorante Ametricano (or something like that!). Pastas were coming in at around Euros 6 - 9. A 3 Euro house red turned out to be a huge carafe, so i was quite happy. A huge bread basket with the meal was only Euro 1. The hotel is great for getting around the sights by foot. I never used any tour buses. I only used the metro to get to the Vatican City and the nearest metro is at Termini. I would definitely return to this hotel in the future. I was not disappointed. It served its purpose and the staff were friendly and informative.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mwgfelix
Reviews.Content: Breakfast was adequate - although the waitresses did take an age to bring coffee and tea to the table and when it arrived it was always luke warm. Rooms spacious and comfortable (only one pillow each) Great location (between the Termini and the Republicca) - only a couple of mins walk to Basilica Santa Maria...and a further couple of minutes to the Colesseum. Plenty of bars, restuarants and shops around the hotel - our friends ate at the hotel and they said the meal was fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD LOCATION - THATS ABOUT IT”
Reviews.Author: Panesar63
Reviews.Content: Strange place overall. Weird deco and atmosphere when we got inside there. Room was not clean and towels smelled of oil or something? No hot water for 2 days and the shower head was producing a random jet of water which at times felt like it was piercing my skin. Free meal was giving which was rubbish. Breakfast served semi-warm coffee. When expressing our dismay they did nothing to help or sympathise. You can tell that an abundance of complaints has become procedure to them. Asked one of the main guys working in the restaurant bit for some advice of what we should do one day. He said "I don't know" and walked off. lol, wanka Would never stay here again. Only thing in its defense is location.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT book this hotel through lastminute”
Reviews.Author: kkpants
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a stay in Rome where we were booked into The Welcome Piram. I had read a few of the bad reviews but they seemed few and far between. I will now take more notice of bad reviews as we were told the same flood story as other guests and we were moved to an apartment down the road. Down the road was a good 10 minute walk from the hotel itself. The apartment was not a 4* apartment, it was grotty and smelly and not satisfactory at all. Thankfully I had a friend in Rome who spoke the language and she managed to make such a fuss that they eventually gave us a room in the hotel. The girl behind the desk even told my friend that as we booked the package through lastminute, that was the reason that we were not put up in the hotel. The hotel itself is noisy, we couldn't have the door open to the balcony as the bins were emptied daily. The cleaners don't really clean the room, they make the bed and that is about it. We put our towels in the bidet so that the maid would give us fresh but they just hang the towels up over the shower (as there is no where to hang the towels in the bathroom). We had to actually put the towels on the floor before they would give us fresh. The room is small but you could live with that if everything else was good, it does have a safe and a mini bar but really no hanging space for clothes, no coffee making facilities, no free internet, the list could go on. Staff were fairly miserable except one, Nicola, he was great, always smiling and chatty. I would not recommend this hotel and will be contacting lastminute to inform them of how their customers are being treated by this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The negatives were bigger than the positives!”
Reviews.Author: nsmooth56
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located two blocks away from the main train terminal in Rome and it is walking distance to all the main attractions in the city except for the Vatican (even though I still walked from there). Some of the staff members were helpful (received a great restaurant recommendation from one) and some were totally out of the loop. The rooms were very spacious, but our neighbor's complained for noise while we only had the TV on (in low volume). The bathroom did not include a tub, just a drain at the corner of the bathroom floor with a shower head and curtain. The biggest negative is that the internet did not work. I tried their ethernet connection as well as their wireless service and none worked. Claiming they had an internet connection was the biggest reason for me to choose this hotel, so you can understand my disappointment to have to deal with internet cafes that closed by 11PM. At checkout, I had to plead my case to not incur the charges because no one made a note that my connection did not work for the new shift. Another negative was that I booked my room for six nights and because I did not book the hotel through their personal website I did not receive any extra amenities. Other people received breakfast and a free dinner at their restaurant. Whether or not I book the rooms through their website or not, they are still getting my money at the end. I guess I would be more understanding if I didn't receive anything for a two night stay, but six nights deserves something - even if it is a single breakfast voucher. I expected a lot more from a four star hotel!

Reviews.Title: “great location for sight seeing”
Reviews.Author: Victoria9205
Reviews.Content: The room was a bit on the small side, bathroom was clean and had an already installed hair dryer and the mirror lite up to do hair and make up. no proper wardrobe , just a rail with a curtain over it, one pillow each and my neck was sore when i woke up the next day, most morning i was woke by the garbage vans. The staff were ok , some what not the friendliest though and tried to sell us a tour package which didnt really sound right (scam) pay 7 euros now and tried to just give me a piece of paper and 20 euros on the bus. We declined and found there was a couple of open top tour buses, hop on , hop off ranging from 15-18 per day and we opted for a two day pass for 30 euros, Nick at the hotel was friendly and laughing and joking with us both. He also booked our taxi for us at no extra charge for our return to the airport. As it was for three nights it was ok but if i was stopping longer i would have complained about the noise , the two beds that were pushed together, ( not very comfy) only having one pillow . We also had breakfast there , it was continental muesli , fruits , breads, juices , jams and spreads , i thought it was ok as i ate quite a bit ready for early morning trip round Rome, coffee was cold each morning and not much of it, half a small tea cup. Location is great near shops and restaurants, tour bus terminals, near the metro and other public transport links. Restaurants have a high service charge so what they say on the menu isn't the price you pay altogether as me and my boyfriend went out to late dinner on valentines day , and cost us 62 euros for steak , potatoes i had he had chips , a hand full of lettuce and a glass of wine and a pint of larger. The smaller places didn't put any charges on . Not sure I'd want to stay again as the staff where less than inviting and i didnt get a good night sleep .

Reviews.Title: “Staff rude and unhelpful, lots of street noise”
Reviews.Author: mbflips
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night as we needed to stay an extra night and the hotel we were staying at was booked. Front desk staff were very unhelpful bordering on rude. We tried to check in at 11:30 am and were told that the room was ready but we couldn't check in until 1pm, when we came back at 1 we had to wait 20 minutes as there was already a line of people trying to check in. Internet was 20 euro for 10 hours which is crazy. Once we got into the room it was clean, very spacious with two windows and the bathroom was huge. Only downside about the room was that we were facing a very busy street, too loud to sleep with the windows open. It's a good value for the money but there are lots of other options in the area, could probably find something better.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Jetsettergal_11
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I both enjoyed staying here. The hotel is right near Termini Station, but in a good area. Termini Station gets a bad rep, but we did not have any problems staying in the area. The Metro is right around the corner from the hotel. The front desk staff spoke English well and were accommodating when we got there before the check in time. They also helped us by giving us maps and site seeing recommendations. However, there was not a secure area to store our luggage. They asked us to put our luggage in a small room, which was not locked or guarded, and many other pieces of luggage were there too. We stayed in a double bed room(two twin's pushed together). The room was very clean and it was cleaned daily. The bed was very flat and hard, but I guess that is a typical European bed. The bathroom was super tiny, but served its purpose. They provided us with new towels everyday. Our package came with breakfast every morning. Breakfast consisted of breads, cheeses, jams, pastries and cereal. The elevators were always in use and we waited forever for them. We mainly just took the stairs. We never visited their piano bar, but every time we walked past it in the evening, no one was in there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, poor service, forget breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Benjaminbrum
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is fantastic as a base for touring the city. 2 minutes to Termini Station and bus station. Plenty of connections from there by tram, bus, metro and foot. The hotel isn't much to look at from the outside. The reception area has a baroque feel that doesn't translate to the rest of the hotel. The room was simply designed, good sized. The bed was comfy and the bathroom well sized. The minibar is very expensive, staff didn't seem to mind people buying their own drinks to keep in the fridge. There were some issues with the safe and being able to open it easily. The staff had an override code so were able to get things out (eventually). The staff on reception were rude, surly and unhelpful. It felt a little like they resented the disturbance of our presence there. We bought breakfast the first morning at six euros each and was disappointed at the food available and the greediness of other guests. No sooner than were the pastries put out than greedy guests had grabbed three or four for themselves. We then went to McDonalds for breakfast each morning after that for a delicious coffee and divine tasting pastries as good as anything you'd find in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: Dandrew87
Reviews.Content: Very good location 2 minutes from termini train/bus station on foot. We walked to most places. The colusseum,Trevi Fountain, Spanish steps,pantheon are all walkable in 20-30 minutes. Hotel looks a bit crusty on the outside but was nice enough inside. Our Room was a bit small and old fashioned but had everything you needed bed was comfy bathroom was a wetroom but done the job. Minibar is exspensive so get yourself down to spar for your beer and wine and stick it in the fridge. We didnt have breakfast included but there are plenty of little places around to grab something in the mornings and even a Mc Donalds up the road for anyone that has a pasta phobia. The staff when we checked in were a bit grumpy but after that had no problem's, There a bit tight with the pillows in the room so asked for another which i got no problem. So if your looking for a base to see the sights its perfect but if your looking to impress your new girlfriend then maybe not.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Clare1711
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in October 2010, which was my first visit to Rome. I didn't pay too much, perhaps £300 for 3 nights? Which I think is very reasonable for a city break in Europe. This hotel is in a great location, right by the main station for the tram/ underground and train. You can easily walk to most attractions- maybe aside from the vatican, but the tram is very regular and doesn't take long. The staff weren't overly friendly at check- in, but I was not there to make friends! I agree that breakfast was busy, but I didn't expect 5* service from a hotel this cheap. We went for breakfast quite early so we could explore and always found plenty of food. The room was a decent size, but with a tiny bathroom. It overlooked the front of the hotel which was on a very busy road, but with the window and the shutters shut at night it was quiet enough. The bed was really comfy- especially after walking around for 8+ hours a day. To sum up, this hotel was well worth the price, I didn't spend much time in the room, or the hotel I was too busy exploring which is what I imagine most visitors do!

Reviews.Title: “BAD SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: BarryHealy81
Reviews.Content: This Hotel Is a CON, Travelled to Rome on the 21st January 2011, arrived and was told that there had been a Flood and our room not avaliable but we could stay in there sister hotel 100 metres away which is a 2 Star. We was offered Breakfast (which is free) in bed as compensation (which we did not take). Next night returned to hotel to see if problem resolved which they say is but told hotel is now fully booked! 1 Night later couple Check into room next door to us told the same story that flood in hotel.............. STAY AWAY AND DEF DO NOT TRUST ( last minute wont do nothing about the problem either)

Reviews.Title: “Horrendous service in a good location and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: samchef123
Reviews.Content: Its a neat hotel 3 minutes walking distance from termini with good rooms but tiny bathrooms.The only positive is clean rooms and location. The service we recieved was hostile , horrendous and not professional. The staff think that they are lords of the manor. After 4 really bad experince in 3 days , I would strongly not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Avyavy
Reviews.Content: I agree with other people who say this hotel should't be rated as a 4* hotel... My boyfriend and I stayed there 4 nights. At our arrival, we were astonished by the front of the hotel, it looked quite old, like if it hadn't been restored for years... Especially when we compared its walls with the walls of the 3* hotel next to Wecome Piram (which looked quite better!). Anyway, when we arrived at 13.50 (chech-in is at 14) we had to deal with one unfriendly, sulky blonde that told us that she wasn't sure our room was ready so we had to wait till 14. I agree with other people who say that reception staff is unpleasant.. It is true, we had the same feeling! The blonde asked for our ID and she also asked for a credit card (she did the same with other clients). She told me she needed the credit card as security... but this is the FIRST TIME hotel staff has asked me for my credit card number... This was quite unpleasant too (we had the feeling they didn't "trust" their clients) and besides I didn't like the girl's attitude on the whole. She gave us a room at the second floor. The room was really small... I wouldn't probabily say anything about the room size if Welcome Piram was a 3* hotel, but since it is rated as 4* you'd expect to find the qualities you normally find in 4* hotels. Well, the room is definitely small for a hotel that claims itself a 4*! We had also a small bathroom (you can't hang the towels, 'cos there's nowhere to hang them, as other have said in previous reviews). However our room was clean and the towels were changed when we needed new ones. Breakfast is very very poor. We usually woke up at 9 and when we arrived downstairs there wasn't much left. A few off-the-shelves cakes (cut in tiny tiny pieces...), small pieces of bread, rusks, jam, butter, cheese and two kinds of watery juice: red orange and pineapple. Sometimes we couldn't find spoons or glasses and we had to queue, waiting for our glass ('cos there were other people waiting before us...). Sometimes we had to wait for the juice, 'cos there were just two jugs...Well I know the hotel is very crowded, but I guess they could try to manage breakfast better than that!! Anyway, as I have said, breakfast is quite poor and there is very little choice... If you didn't pay for breakfast in your booking, you can go in a bar and get a coffee and a croissant... I think it would be better than a breakfast-waste of money... We had to ate everyday the same tastless things. The nights at Wecome Piram were a nightmare, at least for us... We didn't manage to get a quiet sleep not even one night during our stay... The hotel is very noisy, at least for us! In the room next to ours there were some Americans guys... They came back every morning at 3 a.m. and they chatted like if they were in the streets at 3 p.m... They spoke in a loud voice, guffawed... We could hear everything, 'cos the walls are very thin.. So if you happen to have some neighbours like that... Well you won't sleep much! Then at 8.30 we were woked up (every morning) by cleaning women cleaning the upstairs room.. In that case also we could hear everything (when they walked around the room, when they moved forniture, when they sweeped). And finally, our last night we were woked up not by our friends in the room next to ours (they left the hotel the same morning) but by garbage collector... He stayed in the street with the garbage truck for at least 40 minutes, and it was such noisy... So, as others advised.. Bring ear plugs, just in case! Maybe you'll get a room facing the main street or a side street (our room faced a side street, but it was very noisy all the same, also because of the cleaning staff), and in that case you'll definitely need them. So to sum up... I guess the only pro of Welcome Piram is its location... (the metro/bus stops are really close and you're just a 25-min walk away from the Colosseum)... But I wouldn't recommend this hotel and we won't go there again, that's for sure. I think you can find better deals in Rome...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for a city break to explore Rome”
Reviews.Author: PimmsK
Reviews.Content: I'd highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a base to explore Rome. The location is fantastic, just minutes walk from 2 Metro stations that easily and cheaply get you around the city. Rome is also an excellent city to walk around, and this hotel is well placed for a stroll to Trevi, Spanish Steps, Collisuem etc. Our room was clean, large and nicely decorated. The bathroom was also very clean and very light and bright with a power shower. The only slight downsides of the room was a firm mattress (improved with extra pillows from housekeeping!) and only 1 english speaking TV channel (but we spent most of our time sightseeing so this wasn't a concern for us). The breakfast is fine but basic, just tea/coffee, cereal, fruit, a few pastries and some slices of cheese and ham - but not a problem as Romes restaurants will more than fill you up over lunch and dinner! Reception staff were pleasant and allowed us to keep our bags safe at the hotel on our last day instead of wandering around the city with them. All in all, I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone after a great base to explore a wonderful city. It exceeded our expectations and helped make our city break fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “lovely stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: craftysurfer
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Wecome Piram Hotel in Rome in December. The location of this hotel is excellent, only 5 minutes walk from the Termini station and only 2 minutes away from the Hop on Hop off bus tours. I would really recommend this hotel for its position in Rome, there are lots of places to eat within minutes of the hotel, there is a cheap chinese around the corner from the hotel. Facilities in the hotel are a bit basic, the breakfast is ok and typical for a city hotel, but enough to set you up for the morning. If you don't like strong coffee have tea! All together a fantastic mini break in Rome, we booked our hop on hop off bus tour prior to arriving in the city, this was an excellent way of seeing the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: galaxianova1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon. We loved it we got one of their apartments on Via Nazionale and we couldnt be happier with its location. There was a free wifi maybe from an office nearby. The location was so safe and very central close walking distance to most major sights and super close to the termini. We loved it even if we only had MTV on the tv it was our honeymoon so we managed...;)

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: AndrewJH
Reviews.Content: Myself & my partner have just returned from a trip to Rome and stayed for 3 nights at the Welcome Piram Hotel. We were very disappointed - the hotel is situated close to the Termini Station which is handy, but the area itself is quite rough and not the best district in Rome. We arrived at 1.35pm & were made to wait in the reception until exactly 2 pm until we could have our room key. Because everyone else was doing the same thing, we then had to queue up again to be given the key! We found the staff at the reception desk to be surly & unfriendly. The room was large but very sparsely furnished with a tiny flat screen t.v on the wall with a wire hanging from it, which was designed to be plugged into a computer for internet etc. The t.v didn't work properly - we couldn't access the internet (which the hotel charged 7 Euros to use). All we managed to get was an Italian children's channel. There was absolutely no information available in the room either about the hotel itself or sightseeing etc. When we used the shower in the evening, we had no hot water, which we complained about at reception and were told that it was because everyone else had used it! The one plus plus point about the room was the bed, which was large & comfortable. The breakfast was absolute rubbish - small pieces of bread with cheap "plastic" ham & cheese, bits of cake & croissants, tinned fruit & a watery juice drink. The tea/coffee was served by unfriendly girls who didn't crack a smile. We have both travelled a lot and have stayed at many hotels. This hotel would not be given a 4 star rating if it was in London - would recommend Rome but would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome Piram-very central”
Reviews.Author: PinkFarmer
Reviews.Content: We booked this through lastminute.com for 5 nights. For us it was nice. clean room, towels changed (probably because we put them on the floor??) The breakfast is OK. the coffee isnt too nice and its croissants (if your there early enough they dont put anymore out once the first ones are gone!) some bread, cheese, reformed ham, cakes, cereals and juices. Standard continental breakfast. Would recommend finding breakfast somewhere else if possible! We didnt go to the restaurant next door as we liked to venture further afield. It is a 2 minute walk from Termini station which was great for hopping on the metro (or a train to Pisa for the day!) Go around the corner and there is a fab little chinese restaurant, starter, main and side for 8.50 euros! bargain! and then there is a guy who sells beers, wine, soft drinks, fruit from a stall, we visited him every night to buy Peroni's! Oh and try that trattoria behind the stall for typical italian food-gorgeous!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, perfect for a short break”
Reviews.Author: beechdan
Reviews.Content: Got there late afternoon and after a little trouble finding (print a map beforehand!) found it to look not too impressive from the frontage. Inside is different though and after speaking to helpful staff got our room sorted promptly and loved looking at the old elevator in the centre of the stairwell! Food in the hotel not great, bit pricy for the meal but breakfast adequate if you like cakes, cheese, ham and quite hard bread. One thing go to the small chinese restaurant just around the corner, absolute bargain and lovely food/staff!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, but try and get a good deal”
Reviews.Author: Lisab78
Reviews.Content: Booked hotel on last minute.com, it was mystery hotel, so found out what hotel it was once it was booked. Excellent price with this deal, £223 for 4 nights. Central location, easy access to buses to/from airport, main train and bus station, metro. Rooms traditional style Italian, good size, no where to hang towels to dry! couple of simple things could have been added to make room more efficient. Bed hard. Breakfast as everyone describes is poor. Tried everything but only had cereals! Good hotel location for restaurants, try the authentic places just off the main streets. Easy walk to all main attractions in every direction. If you don't want anything fancy then you can't go wrong with this hotel - it is simple and clean. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful, but not luxury. Good hotel as a base if you're sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: Amber22_10
Reviews.Content: Hotel was OK, nothing special. Check-in 14:00, check out 11:00. We arrived early and paid €35 to have an early check-in and this included a buffet lunch. Lunch wasn't great but we just wanted to dump our bags and get on with the sight-seeing! Room was OK, nothing special but clean with plenty of space. Lots of clean towels, heating was on (some older hotels in Rome don't have central heating!!). There was a fully stocked mini bar whcih was quite expensive! Towels were changed daily, room always clean. Location is pretty good and you can walk any where in Rome from this hotel (we caught the Metro the Vatican City but did walk back to hotel). Aprox 20 mins walk from Pantheon, Colosseum, Spanish Steps, 15 mins walk from Trevi Fountain. Hotel is located at the other end of Via Nationzale from the Vittorio Emanuele II Monument also very close to Termini station which makes it easy to get too and from airport. I love Rome, this was my second visit and I'll be going back again. I wont be staying at the Welcome Piram. It's fine for cheap and cheerful though - and if youa re sightsee-ing you will not be in your hotel much anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Overall happy with our experience but...”
Reviews.Author: nicholasbrennan59
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed our time in Rome and would recommend it to anyone. The hotel was in a good location and has good links to the main termini metro, bus and main train station which is invaluable for getting home. When we arrived we were told to put our bags in a room which wasn't locked which was a slight concern at first, but everything was ok there. However, on one occasion we did get back after a long day out to the Vatican and found that our room door hadn't been locked properly by the cleaning staff. i did voice my concern with reception and they were very nice about it. In terms of the staff apart from the first time we arrived, we didn't really get a 'hello' from any of the staff on the reception desk. The room we had was very clean and tidy and if you're looking to live in an authentic hotel then i would recommend it! Throughout our stay the room was well maintained too so no worries there. Finally, the breakfast consists of a continental breakfast with some pastries, cereal, bread, ham and cheese, but the choice isn't massive but you can't have everything in the world, can you?!

Reviews.Title: “If you get it at a bargain price - then this is a good bet - if not cheap look elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Hillygirl2
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 5 nights at the Welcome Piram in Rome. We got a great deal as a 'secret boutique hotel' through lastminute.com. Only found out it was the Welcome Piram after confirmation. In its favour is: The location, the friendliness of all the staff, the cleanliness of the rooms and public areas. Against: not really a luxury environment, but adequate. Our confirmation said free internet access, but this was not true. Actually the TV volume level was so low that we tried to watch a film in bed but were unable to hear it so gave up. We also reported that the light in our bathroom had failed when we left in the morning and when we returned at 6.00 p.m. it was still not fixed. Breakfast was basic but adequate. However the pastries were not replenished so latecomers sometimes missed out. Overall we really enjoyed Rome and our stay. If you get this hotel at a good price - it is fine, but don't pay a high rate.

Reviews.Title: “Easy to Find and Authentic Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: jnnfr0486
Reviews.Content: The rooms were spacious - simple yet elegant - antique style Large bathrooms (for italy) AMAZING free breakfast buffet every morning Very easy to locate from the train station Easy walking distance to nearly all main attractions in Rome (except maybe the Vatican) hallways are tiled, so once in a while, we'd hear people walking if they were wearing heels...not a bad experience at all though!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again...”
Reviews.Author: lrbuster
Reviews.Content: Would Stay again Nov 18, 2010 I just returned from trip to Rome,Florence and Pisa.While in Rome stayed at The Priam Hotel(welcome Priam hotel)staff was very friendly and helpful and offered advice.Restarant had amazing food.The location was the best!Located in center of rome it was convient location to all buses and trains and subways,so was easy to find your way back day or night.The rooms were small but well equipped with mini bar,balconys,nice bathroom.Only complaint was beds were a little hard and the hairdrier did not work.Cool neighborhood block it was in ,near alot of places to eat great food,near places in interest the Nationale Meusuem,Santa Maria maggiore and the Baths of Diocletian

Reviews.Title: “Well what a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jimandsimone1990
Reviews.Content: Travelling in a group of nine ranging from 18 through to 43 we managed to bag an absolute bargain here. We arrived with trepidation after reading some of the reviews on here (which are invaluable). When we arrived 1min walk from the main Termini Station, the staff on the front desk was charming and very helpful. When we checked in which was smooth and trouble free we went up to the rooms. All the rooms were very clean and tidy, flat screen TV, mini bar, shower and or bathroom which were all well equipped and air conditioning. The beds were large and very comfortable. The large breakfast room in the basement was well stocked for a continental style breakfast and tea and coffee was waitress service and was supplied on request. All in all I think this was a very pleasant hotel and I think it has been given some very bad unnecessary press. I would definitely go back and recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Honest (but long) Review”
Reviews.Author: HenryBoston
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 week while on vacation in Rome. The hotel is very clean and very nicely decorated, the rooms are nice and spacious, and the hotel is in an excellent location. Here is an honest, but long, review of our experience: Pros: Location is perfect (location is also a con because central Rome is very NOISY). Situated within close proximity to two Metro stations: Termini (main station in Rome) and Repubblica. Only about a 25 minute walk to the Colosseum and there are many restaurants and shops in the area. The complimentary breakfast was great and included baked goods (donuts, croissants, cake), cereal, freshly squeezed juices, fruit (from a can), milk, water, coffee, tea, cappuccino. The breakfast staff was hard-working and courteous and made sure that guests had what they needed. There were 2 bell-boys while we there and they were both the friendliest people in the hotel and we really enjoyed their big smiles every day! One day our room was not cleaned, but this was resolved with a quick call to the front desk. One of the bell-boys brought us up what we needed (towels, TP, etc.) and he was so kind and pleasant. I hope the management is aware of how great and courteous their bell-boys are! The cleaning staff was also very pleasant and did a great job. We were able to check in 30 minutes early (1:30pm), probably because the front desk staff felt bad for us because were falling asleep in the lobby! We got to the hotel around 9:00am and we were able to use the restrooms and provide all of our check in information, check our bags, and we were provided with a map of the city. The gentleman who checked us in was nice, but there was a female front desk rep who snapped at me when I asked if we could check in before 2:00 (we came back from exploring the city around 1:00pm). She was NOT so pleasant, and we were grateful that the "nice" guy let us check in a little early. Cons: The hotel staff (front desk) is friendly, but they do not seem to care all that much about customer satisfaction. Maybe it's just their attitude, but they were difficult to figure out. The bag storage room in the reception area is NOT locked and anyone can walk into it. While there was always someone staffed at the front desk, it was still a little disconcerting that our bags were not secured. The bell-boy was not there when we were able to check into our room, so the front desk staff told us to get our bags from the closet (instead of offering to help us), so we had to maneuver around the closet and other guests' bags. We really could have taken anything from that closet, but we did not, because we are good people. The hotel restaurant is just OK, and NOT worth visiting for dinner. We ate dinner there one night and our server was not very friendly. There are so many other options in the area with better food and lower or comparable prices, so we do NOT recommend wasting your time with dinner here. One of the hotel owners or managers or someone important dined in the restaurant with his significant other and their DOG, and the DOG received better and more courteous treatment than we did! The dog had it's own little pillow seat and water dish and we could not even get TAP WATER (we were denied tap water and told it was not an option, even though it is served at breakfast in the same restaurant). Internet access is expensive. We did not bring a laptop, but you can access the Internet from the TV in the room. We were explained the rates when we checked in and chose NOT to use the Internet. It was something like $10 for 24 hours or $15 for something else. There is a great Internet/copy/fax place a short walk away on Via Napoli, so don't waste your money on Internet access at the hotel. Lastly, the A/C in the hotel was turned off (November), so our room was very hot. It took me 1 visit and 4 calls to the front desk to finally be informed that the A/C was off and our only option was to "open the window". Of course, with the window open we could NOT SLEEP BECAUSE ROME IS A VERY LOUD CITY! So, this is why we rated the sleep quality so low. Overall, we would recommend this hotel because it is in a great location and it is a great value. But, bring earplugs and try to get a room NOT facing the street, if you choose to stay here! If you read this review, thank you. We apologize for it being so long, but we wanted to provide readers with the most accurate information as possible!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: COOKS76
Reviews.Content: I chose Welcome Piram because of the reviews and the rate of the hotel. Its location is very good, close to Republica, and termini, and yet in a calm street the breakfast a bit poor, but friendly waitresses, and helpfull concierge. and the hotel has lunch and dinner menus for good rate. the rooms are nice and clean, but simple. recommended hotel for its rate.

Reviews.Title: “Fab time!”
Reviews.Author: louise-sian
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked by my partner as a birthday present! We stayed in a superior room which was spacey, very clean and had a lovely bathroom! Was nice and close to a metro station so was really easy to access all the tourist spots! we did struggle with breakfast provided at the hotel due to it be all sweet, so had breakfast locally. We were actually in walking distance to the trevi fountain which had some amazing restaurants!

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service????”
Reviews.Author: tonisnyder
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews of hotels in Rome I thought the Welcome Piram would be perfect for our stay. Loved the location of the hotel, The room was large for Rome standards. The problem is the noise. Very noisy hotel. We aske Nicolo at the front desk if we could have the air turned on and he told us if we were hot to open the window and if we were cold he would give us a blanket. I was a little shocked by that answer. I also asked him if he could help us reconfirm a tour and he said to me that if he did not book it he would not help, just call from the room . the next day I asked the front desk again to help with reconfirming my transfer to the airport. they were not to thrilled to help so they asked me to leave the confirmation and they would do it, this after i was so very nice, thanking them, etc. When we came back in the afternoon, they told me the line was busy the one time they tried. I had been gone for over 7 hours. So I took my confirmation, used my cell phone and reconfirmed. The hotel is very noisy so if you plan on stying at this hotel, make sure you bring earplugs. When I say noisy, I mean, ambulance, cars, people talking, fire trucks, police cars, and they don't stop at night, they go all night long. Breakfast was good, but don't expect more than one cup of coffee. they just give you the minimum. I travel to Rome every year and thought I would try a new hotel this time. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Felt cheated”
Reviews.Author: nappytraveller
Reviews.Content: Checked in on Friday evening however like Mary and Joseph for some reason there was no room at the inn, so we were placed in the "attico", this in reality is a10-15 minute walk away from the hotel in residential building. The" attico" is very old and in need of refurbishment, it was at best shabby, damp and very old fashioned, the electrics were extremely dangerous, half of the lighting did not function, 1 bathroom only had a dribble of water from the sink. the external door did not lock from the inside as it is not possible to put the key in the lock from the inside, 1 hard push from the outside and you can be in. The only redeeming part of this room was its terrace, alas access was restricted as the door was pad locked so we could only look through the window. There was damp in the bedroom and through the bathroom ceilings, much of which was falling away due to the excessive moisture. The "attico" is essentially an illegal structure on top a building, partly constructed out of pre-fabricated sheets similar to a caravan. we complained and were told we would be moved to the main hotel the next night. On arrival the next day we were told there was no room to move us to but they could put us in the "rooms at the termini" 2 minutes walk from the hotel, the rooms here were small but modern clean and tiny, however they are right next to the tram line so the noise wakes you promptly at 6am when the first tram comes past.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in city center...”
Reviews.Author: OSUnumber45
Reviews.Content: The Welcome Piram Hotel is a hidden gem in the Termini area of Rome. Many of the top sights in Rome are within walking distance. If you're not into walking then you are near a Metro station. Also many quality restaurants and shopping within walking distance. The room was tiny (it's Europe so that's to be expected), but very clean and remodeled. We weren't in the room much except to sleep and maybe take a break in the middle of the day. The bed was very hard though, something my girlfriend and I both never got used to. Although we were usually so tired at the end of the day that we still fell asleep very quickly. Renovations were going on in the hotel during our stay so there was quite a bit of noise at times, although it wasn't that bothersome as it never took place while we were trying to sleep. Overall I highly recommend the Welcome Piram Hotel. For the money I would have to say it would be hard to find a better deal in that area of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in central location.”
Reviews.Author: April0304
Reviews.Content: I've just spent a week at the Piram Hotel and would go back. It is within 200 yards of Termini station but in a relatively quiet street. The room was basic but clean and comfortable. Bed linen was changed mid week and towels every other day. The en-suite shower room was small but fully tiled and the shower worked very well. Breakast was a well stocked buffet with fruit, fruit juice, cereals, croissants, cheese, ham and, if you could eat them for breakfast, doughnuts. We found the staff polite and friendly. The building is old but has been renovated and re-decorated and there is a new lift as well as the original 100 year old wooden one, which still works silently and well. It is pushing it a bit to award this hotel 4 stars but it is comparable to other 3 star hotels I have stayed at in Rome. I enjoyed my stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, annoying air conditioning system!!”
Reviews.Author: miss_kd86
Reviews.Content: The hotel was OK. The location is quite good as its not long to walk to anywhere and is a two minute walk from Via National. The biggest issue was the air conditioning system, as it is very annoying! It is controlled by reception and you can ask for it to be switched off. If however, you switch it back on again it keeps turning itself back on when you have switched it off! Also it is too noisy to sleep over. The breakfasts were average with the usual continental style breakfast, however a lot of it is high in sugar - so if you don't like too much in the morning not the best place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive internet”
Reviews.Author: path1956
Reviews.Content: The internet cost's 10Eur for 24 hours, But we woud'nt use its that long, only for checking emails once a day. The beds are very hard and we had to get an extra pillow because the one in the bed was too small. The aircondition are unajustable, so it was either very cold or very hot. There is very much noise from the street. The bath is very small, and if there is water on the floor there is no drain to take it. Both the sink's were stopped so we had a lot overflow of water.

Reviews.Title: “rome trip”
Reviews.Author: MAK786
Reviews.Content: the hotel was excellent very centrally located booked after doing lots of research but not central to the site but the good thing is you can get buses in rome just outside the hotel. rooms quite big and staff very helpful will recommend others too

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms, well located”
Reviews.Author: MQ007
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for four nights in June. The hotel offered a 20% off deal for a 4-night stay, plus we got a further 10% off through Expedia so it was very affordable 4-star at $107 AUD/night. The room featured the main room with king size bed, drawers, TV, safe, and small wardrobe. There was also a small space (not really a room because it didn't have doors, but it separated the main room and bathroom) which was very handy for storing suitcases! The bathroom contained a shower, sink, toilet and bidet. The shower and hand basin were good sized, but if I was the designer, I would have swapped the location of the toilet and bidet. The toilet was jammed into the corner of the room and you needed to sit down whilst navigating around the hand basin. However, the bidet had clear access (a bit annoying since we didn't plan on using it). Still, it was not a terribly tight squeeze, just an unusual design choice. We were also fortunate enough to get the one room (on the second floor) with the old-style balcony overlooking the street. There were a few tiny balconies on rooms at the back of the hotel but they overlooked an Asian restaurant so might not have been quite so enticing to open at night. It was very well located, near Termini station, so when we arrived from the airport, we just took the train from the airport to Termini then walked ~5-7 minutes to the hotel. It was quite easy to find (good, because it was after midnight by the time we arrived at Termini). We chose to walk to the Colosseum, Forum, etc, because it was advertised as "15 minutes walk". It's not. It's actually more like 25 minutes walk and if you're doing it in the heat of the day, it's a bit unpleasant. We could have chosen to take the local rail network to the station at the Colosseum but preferred to stroll down and buy icecream whenever we needed a break (we have been to Rome before and were just visiting a few sites this time instead of trying to cram EVERYTHING in). The hotel has a laundry service but it's overpriced, of course, if you're travelling on a budget. We chose to walk a couple of blocks to the self-service laundromat and just do it ourselves. The reception desk can help you find it by giving you a brochure that has a map to the laundromat. Be sure to stress you're looking for the "self service" laundromat - my first attempt at getting directions from one of the reception staff led me to the nearest dry cleaners, not a laundromat. When you exit the front door of the hotel to go there, if you turn left, you'll know you've been given the directions to the dry cleaner - you must turn to the right. The hotel includes breakfast in the price but it was not a good breakfast unless you went early. If you arrived at the middle-end part of the breakfast timeslot, you didn't get the full pick of pastries, etc, and the two types of juice were "weird tasting sickly sweet pink" and "I think it's grapefruit but can't be sure"... Still, that's not really an issue if you're intending to eat icecream all day anyway. :-) Internet was not included in the price of the room and whilst I had intended to walk to the nearest McDonalds (about 1.5 blocks away) and get free wifi, I discovered Italian McDonalds do not offer free wifi unless you have an Italian phone (which I didn't have). Therefore, if you want internet, you're going to have to pay for it. There was an internet cafe next to the laundromat if you're wanting to avoid the hotel fee and are prepared to walk down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Near Termini, OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: yahooholidays
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean, quiet but pretty basic. It was 40+ centrigrade at the end of June and we were so pleased to have working airconditioning. Reception staff were knowledgeable about Rome, were able to pass on tourists tips and were always willing to advise. The attached restaurant and piano bar served tasty italian food and was surprisingly good value . Breakfast was the typical italian array of cakes, pastries and cereals. Good coffee though. There is a roof garden for sunbathing which has views over the city. There's moden lifts and old, rickety wooden lifts ... never take the wooden ones unless you have a your own toolkit ;-) We booked this hotel as a stop over for a couple of nights before getting a cruise. The priority was to be near Temrini railway station. The hotel is one block away from Termini - perfect. Central Rome is a 10-15 minute walk away along Nazionale. Rome isn't really a big city. We were amazed how many places we could walk to on the first night (kids aged 7 and 10). That turned in a pattern - walk, explore, jump on a bus back to Termini and the hotel. The hotel made a great base for exploring.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great location”
Reviews.Author: donegalguy1
Reviews.Content: This hotel received mixed reviews, so i was a little bit concerned before our 3 night stay. However, i had absolutely nothing to worry about. The hotel itself was very clean , the room was tidy and made up every day. The staff were very helpful and friendly and couldn't have done more for us. Upon arrival , the two guys at reception discovered it was my wife's birthday, sang "happy birthday " to her and gave us a bottle of wine along with a complementary meal. These two guys had a great sense of humour which we really enjoyed. The hotel is located 5 minutes walk form termini station, from which you access any area of Rome with various forms of public transport . In conclusion, some people complained about the staff and the tidiness of the hotel, I think they must have stayed at a different hotel and got the names confused.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Holiday in Rome”
Reviews.Author: edenpark08
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at this hotel. It is a nice hotel actually with huge room and comfortable bed. From the moment we checked in this hotel we can feel that we are welcomed. The receptionist brought us to the room and gave us the tour about facilities in the room. The bathroom was quite small but they had shower, and bidet as well. This hotel nears the Termini station which is a good start to explore the city. However, it was quite difficult to find this hotel because they do not have big signage. They just write 'hotel' at the front door so you need to ask someone to get to this hotel. A useful tip to find this hotel in when you come from Termini station, go straight to the Termini bus station and cross the road in front of the bus station. Walk for about two blocks and you can see this hotel at the corner of the road. The breakfast was ok but limited choices of meals. They just had bread, cheese, bacon, pastry, cereal, fruit and yogurt. For us it was acceptable because it was included with the room. So we do not bother so much about the breakfast. Please beware when using the facilities in the room. They have flat screen tv in the room but you have to pay for the movies you watch. Internet cable was provided but you have to pay as well. The air condition was set to just 25c and you cannot adjust the temperature. This was quite annoyed for us because because the weather outside reaching 32c. If you wish to get cheap food, go to kebab shop and convenience store. If you're on the tight budget, do not eat near Termini. Walk a bit behind this hotel and it is worthy. Overall, I would recommended this hotel due the its location as well as huge room.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service, clean rooms, good location in NE city centre nr Stazione Termini”
Reviews.Author: smokinjoe65
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights with my girlfriend. It is clean and very convenient - close to Stazione Termini and Via Nazionale so about 15-20 mins walk to central Rome with buses and Metro nearby. Staff were very friendly and helpful, spoke very good English and able to book attractions, do online check-in etc. Rooms are clean, fairly basic but air con, en suite, mini bar etc.Breakfast average but adequate.

Reviews.Title: “great value , handy location”
Reviews.Author: baldwinLondon
Reviews.Content: the piram proved a splendid choice for our 3 day city break to the eternal city. located in a quiet street just near the bustling main railway terminus, it may not be in the most romantic location but is perfectly placed for getting to and from the airport and to all parts of rome when time is of the essence. spacious airy room, very jolly reception staff (particularly the wonderfully helpful nicola and gretty) and charming throughout. both modern and charmingly old fashioned lifts operate in tandem. the buffet breakfast is in truth pretty sparse , and while the evening menu in the hotel restaurant offers good value (4 courses for as little as if euros) you have to choose wisely - the lamb chops on our 2nd night were absolutely delicious, but the fried meat and vegetable combo we plumped for the following evening was as truly awful as any single dish i can ever recall being served up in a proper restaurant. nonetheless, the piram a great place in which to base yourselves. apparently the hotel is now 4 * rather than 3, but its taken them 3 years to get official approval from the mayors office so they can put the new sign up, and still waiting . that's rome !

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 Star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dora-D-Xplora
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a perfect base for sightseeing as it is a 2 minute walk to the Termini. The staff are friendly and really quite helpful about what to see and do. The mini bar is well stocked and at fairly reasonable prices. The 'breakfast' selection is extremely limited but ok to get you up and going. The room was clean, but tired, the beds were very uncomfortable and we had trouble sleeping in them. The 'bathroom' was tiny. No room to put toiletries etc and barely even enough room to dry yourself and change clothes. This is not a 4 star hotel, possibly a 3 star at best depending on your standards so if you can put up with these negative points, then you will have a really good base from which to see a beautiful city

Reviews.Title: “We stayed in the Welcome Piram Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Craig_Broadfoot
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Welcome Piram Hotel between 20th and 24th July 2010. Got a great deal on the room as a last minute booking and overall were absolutely delighted with our stay. The location is brilliant, literally 5 minutes from Termini station and less than 5 minutes to Reppublica Metro. Lots of good quality and affordable restaurants around the hotel also. As for the room, we had a double room. The room itself wasn't the biggest but had everything we needed. The double bed was two single beds pushed together, but was very comfortable. Pillows were very good also. Room was complete with air conditioning which was much needed, a very good quality safety depoist box, lots of towels, really good shower, and a nice bathroom. One criticism would be the lack of space to hang clothes up but that's a very minor point. Room also had a balcony which we didn't use but was a nice feature. Breakfast was also included in the price which for a free breakfast was pretty nice. Espresso, Cappuccino, tea and coffee are served by the waiting staff, while the rest is buffet format consisting of cereals, juice, bread, cheese, ham, sweet croissants, cakes and donuts. We had a slight problem one evening when we couldn't get the safe to open with our passcode. A quick call to reception however and everything was sorted out by the very helpful staff. Overall a great break in Rome made better by a great, comfortable and convenient hotel. Many thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Worldtour08
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great, 2 blocks from the main metro station-Termini. Pretty much all the main attractions are within walking distance, the Vatican being the furthest away but you could make it in 30mins. The staff were helpful and polite and the cleaning staff kept our room spotless.
