The minibar was very reasonably priced,the bedroom had aircon,very powerful shower, safe,tv,internet(at an extra cost),plenty of towels, shampoo and soaps. Buffet breakfast comprises of all cold food but is very adequate(croissants, doughnuts, bread, cheese, ham, jams,cereal, tea, coffee and juices). We had lunch and dinner twice in the hotel, the set menus are 15euro or 25euro and were very nice, there is also a la carte choices. Food in the hotel was as cheap as any other restaurant in Rome that we went to. The reception staff recommend to use Ciao Rome as a bus tour, we took this option and would not recommend it to anyone, they were punctual at most stops but always overcrowded, we had to stand a few times, comapred to all other bus tours this one seemed to be worst, with lots of tourists complaining while on the bus. My advice would be to pick another bus company, or alternatively just walk around the city and save the 25-30euro per person cost of the bus.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: julia020
Reviews.Content: Excellant service from start to finish, Especially Nicola on reception, He was polite funny and very helpfull. Hotel was very clean, The rooms were comfortable and cool, thanks to air con, made up everyday. Loved the breakfast. Although near Termini station, it was close to Republica Metro, and away from the hustle of everywhere else in Rome, Would certainly stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here for 4 nights early July 2010...”
Reviews.Author: Musicman007
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights early July 2010. Hotel is brilliantly located 2 mins from Termini and Santa Maria de Angelis ( beautiful basilica). Room was large and adequate however aircon doesn't go low enough in summer. Very clean overall. Breakfast is adequate and if you get a deal on lunch etc it's well worth it. Negatives - none really other than aircon. Some beautiful furniture in our room. Close to pick up for all tour buses and 15 min walk to Colosseum, Trevi fountain, 20 mins Spanish Steps. Don't go to Roof garden Restaurant close by - it's a giant rip off! Other good restauants nearby. Ciao!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, reasonably priced, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Richardzz1
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, clean rooms, friendly staff, well positioned near the station. 4 star hotel - not luxurious but reasonably comfortable rooms, well decorated with standard fixtures and fittings.

Reviews.Title: “good position”
Reviews.Author: roberthuggs
Reviews.Content: the hotel location is very good!!! Clean rooms, clean hotel. the staff are friendly (Suzanna, Selda, Altan) they are so helpful and friendly. I remember the guy with glasses he's called Nicola. He's lier!! I will send to hotel all my friends and I will go back in the future...The restaurant was wonderful...I advice to everybody... I hope to next october to Rome

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Lullie964
Reviews.Content: I would definately go back to this hotel. Yes, it was a little tired in decor but if you can get past this the location could not be better. The hotel staff were great to us and its a shame other people have not had a simliar experience. The breakfast is fine - enough to get you going and the doughnuts were lovely. The rooms were clean and not as noisy as I feared - although we were on the 4th floor, lower might have been different.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but...”
Reviews.Author: incabink
Reviews.Content: Travelled to Rome for the first time, with my husband and 9 year old stepdaughter. Primarily chose this hotel because of the location. Having a 9 year old we didn't want to spend an hour even getting to the termini, before having to travel on elsewhere. This hotel is a perfect base for sightseeing as it is a 2 minute walk to the Termini. The staff are friendly and really quite helpful about what to see and do. The mini bar is well stocked and at fairly reasonable prices. That's really as far as the good points go. The 'breakfast' selection, if you can call it that, is extremely limited. I wouldn't even say it is a standard continental breakfast set up, for example there are no cheeses, meats or fruit. It really doesnt set you up for the day and there doesnt really seem to be any alternatives nearby. The room was clean, but tired, the beds were very uncomfortable and gave myself and my husband backache. The 'bathroom' was tiny. No room to put toiletries etc and barely even enough room to dry yourself and change clothes. When you are a family, in one room, you need at least some degree of privacy to change etc and the bathroom area was hardly suitable. It may have just been our room, I don't know, but if you can put up with these negative points, then you will have a really good base from which to see a beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jody84
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 5 night stay at the welcome piram hotel. When we arrived at termini station, it was literally a 5 minute walk away and was pretty easy to find. When we arrived at the hotel, we were welcomed by friendly staff, who checked us in and gave us a map of all the attractions and the routes we needed to take to get there. The rooms are quite basic, however very clean with a nice bathroom. There was a safety deposit box too which was free of charge and a T.V. with limited channels in English. Breakfast was served between 7.30 and 10.30 which consisted of croissants, doughnuts, cereal, cake, yoghurt and bread. There is also juice and coffee on offer. I found my stay at the hotel really enjoyable, and found the staff to be really friendly, although reviews i had read beforehand had said different. Its in a great location for the termini station and walking distance from many sites(the only one we got the metro to was Vatican city, which would be about a 30 mins walk).

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: GoOSUBeavs
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the positive reviews on Trip Advisor, and I must say that I was very disappointed. First off, this place is not anywhere close to a 4 star hotel. It's a 2-3 star hotel. I've never written this bad of a review for a hotel before, so allow me a chance to elaborate... Our room was on the 6th floor, in what appeared to be a separate but adjacent building. To get there, you first had to walk up stairs, then take an elevator to the 5th floor, then walk to the other end of the building, then walk up more stairs (or take an ancient manually-operated elevator), then walk down the hall to the room. I've never been to a hotel that was so difficult to get to my room. The "double bed" room was really just two single beds pushed together. At some point when I climbed into bed, part of the bed broke off from underneath. Now I weight about 180 lbs, so there's no excuse there! The shower was terrible. Imagine a stream like you would get from a garden hose, and that's what came from the shower head. The water was only lukewarm, except very early one morning when the temperature was fine. At any other time it was warm enough (for me) to take a shower when turned all of the way up, but others may find it not quite warm enough. The bathroom contained no towel rack. Towels were provided on a chair in the main room. The worst part of the stay was the awful air conditioner, which sounded like a helicopter taking off, when it worked that is. Most of the time it would not even work. It would turn on for about 45 seconds, then shut off for 5 minutes or so, and repeat this cycle. The end result was 1) we were never able to sleep, since it was so loud, and 2) the room never cooled off adequately. Eventually we resorted to buying citronella candles and leaving the window open at night. While most hotel breakfasts in Italy are poor my American standards, this one was the worst of all. While some breads were available, there was not one single piece of fruit. Also, on the first morning we ordered coffee but the waitress never brought it to us. We decided not to try for coffee again on future mornings. The only nice things was what appeared to be red-colored orange juice, which I've never seen before and was quite tasty. Contrary to other people's opinions about the location, I actually liked the location. It was a couple of blocks away from the main train station, which made it convenient to get just about anywhere. There were many restuarants in the area, though we were only able to find a couple of bars nearby. I can't believe the rave reviews that this place has been given. I can't emphasize more that this place should be avoided.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with this hotel - great location!”
Reviews.Author: MisterDOS
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at this hotel during Easter of 2010. We were in Rome for 6 nights and pre-booked four of them at this hotel over the Internet before we got there. My girlfriend doesn't like the idea of being tied down for a whole trip at one place, and we thought we might spend a night or two in Assisi or somewhere. But after our first few nights, we liked this hotel a lot and added on the other two nights. This hotel was very nice for the price and the staff were great. But the main benefit of staying here is the perfect location. You are only approximately one-and-a-half blocks from the Termini train station that you can use to get everywhere else. You are directly on the A line that takes you to the Vatican, etc. (we found it most convenient to hop on this line at the Piazza de Repubblica station) and you are also directly on the B line that takes you down to the Colosseum (use Termini station). You are within a very short walking distance of all of the central sites: Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, Piazza Navona, etc. I guess there are places to stay that are closer to the Pantheon or down in the Trastavere area, but then you would sacrifice being so close to the Termini (metro lines, trains for daytrips, etc.) When we checked in, since it was Easter, we needed to pick up tickets for a Vatican event and we were going to head to the Vatican to get them. But, as an afterthought, I asked the man at the desk where the street address (of the ticket place) was and he gave me a map and drew directions. It was actually down by the Trevi Fountain, so that saved us a huge amount of hassle. Our room was clean, breakfast was ok (not super) but it was nice to order cappucinos in the morning and have them custom-made for free. The hot/warm water situation (often a problem in less expensive European hotels) was not any problem for us. We had a wonderful stay. My only suggestion to the hotel staff is this: The Termini is big and kind of confusing for out-of-towners. The Metro system is easy - I am talking about catching a train to Assisi, Sienna, etc. If I owned the Welcome Piram hotel, I would capitalize off the proximity to the Termini station and offer a map or guide to the train station and catching trains to various locations. For example, we had no problem using the ATM-style ticket machine to buy our tickets to Assisi, but when it came time to catch the train, we had to figure out that we were looking for a train bound for Perugia. By pure luck, we ended up on the right train. Maybe the hotel could offer a brochure or one-sheet to make this easier for people that are new to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel but we were poorly treated”
Reviews.Author: voyager60_10
Reviews.Content: Arrived for a four night stay and told that there was a problem with our room as they had to close two floors but they would take us to another hotel for one night. Hotel they took us to was less stars and definately not as good - we had a stall selling music at top volume outside window! Arrived back at hotel next morning to be told problem was on one floor and we could not get into room until after 2pm. We were compensated by being given a free meal - which is part of other packages they offer. When we did not use voucher on night they had indicated we had to argue with them to be able to use it another night. We also suggested they cold take us to airport free of charge but they certainly did not agree with that! They had a problem, which they made our problem and we certainly were not compensated for it. I would not go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bartpj
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I stayed here for 3 nights on our recent vacation. The only good thing is the location, a walk from the train. Lousy room cleanup. Very challenged to supply the basics. Had to ask the front desk for toilet tissue. Lots of street noise. Rude and ignorant front desk attendants. Luckily we were sightseeing and did not spend a lot of time in the hotel, only to sllep on the uncomfortable bed, and shower in the smallest shower I've ever seen.

Reviews.Title: “Good, if you can live with lukewarm water!”
Reviews.Author: AltaPat
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel around 11:00 a.m and were allowed to store our suitcases until check-in around 2:00 p.m. Attached are pictures of Room 231 that are self-explanatory. Here are the good things about staying at this hotel: - friendly staff. Susanna and Caterina were wonderful and so helpful. The young men at reception were pleasant also. - the Queen size bed - the location of the hotel - pristine bedding and towels - windows that opened - cleanliness of the room and bathroom - lots of counterspace in the bathroom - decent breakfast. There was ham, cheese, croissants, bread, butter, jam, cereal, juice, a variety of sweet buns and cakes and coffee to made to order ie espresso, cappucino, cafe americano - air conditioning - full mirrors - mini bar where you can store some water that you can buy at the supermarket at the Termini for 1/6 the price The things we didn't like so much were: - no desk - small bathroom - lukewarm water - no soap holders in shower - air conditioner noisy - bed table on the right was wobbly - the bottom drawer in the dresser would not open - the hair dryer would not work unless the button was constantly held down and had a very short cord - the bed was hard - the decor of the room wasn't particularly attractive Some of the things that we didn't like wouldn't be bothersome at all if we were only staying a few days but after 13 nights, they became irritating.The worst thing was having to shower in lukewarm or even cold water. We were happy with the location of the Hotel Welcome Piram. It is about a five minute walk from the Termini train station. If you take the Leonardo Express from Fiumicino Airport to the Termini, it will cost only14 E each and eliminate the necessity of dealing with cab drivers in Rome. In front of the Termini there are buses that will take you anywhere you want to go in Rome, including the No. 40 Express to St. Peter's. As well, there is a Metro Station at the Termini and a 7 day ticket is 16 E a person. By using a combination of Metro and Bus, we were able to visit the San Callisto Catacombs and the Appian Way on our own. It's about 2 miles from the hotel to St. Peter's if you like walking. Beware of Roman drivers while crossing the streets! My word of advice about Rome is to avoid at any cost the restaurants that are close to the main tourist attractions. They know they will never see you again anytime soon and their food reflects it. We got caught once and had without a doubt the worst lasagne and spaghetti carbonara known to man. There are many restaurants and cafes within walking distance of the hotel,our favourite being Pastarito, V. Gioberti 25, about two blocks away. Pasta, pizza, and calzone 5-11 E are available and are homemade. We stayed at the Hotel Welcome Piram from May 20 to June 2, 2010 at a cost of 168 E per night. I don't know if that was a good deal or not and maybe some of the others who have stayed there could let me know - I would love to hear from you.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MOJO2020
Reviews.Content: I couldn't fault this hotel. We stayed for five days and found the hotel great value for money, the location was excellent and the staff were very efficient. I would definitely recommend this to a friend and will hopefully get back myself in the not too distant future!

Reviews.Title: “They think all Americans are stupid”
Reviews.Author: shellyse
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 10 day trip through Italy with hotel stays in Milan, Venice and Rome. We stayed at the Piram Hotel for 5 nights and to be fair the hotel is very clean, the rooms are large for a European hotel and it is very well located. The problem with this hotel is the staff. Upon checking in we were dealing with 2 young men whose focus was more on having fun and joking around than in helping customers. During our check-in they took our passports and asked us to wait a few minutes while they wrote down the information. It just so happens that during this time another front desk employee by the name of Santos came on and picked up a call from a guest who was asking about the air conditioners and why the couldn't change the temp. He explained that it was computerized and by the sound of it the guest did not figure out that by this he meant that they had no control over it. Finally he relayed the message that the air conditioners were not able to be used or turned on until June 1st (which by the way was not true, they were turned on May 27th). After he hung up the phone he just kept say "Stupid Americanos" to his co-workers and expecting them to laugh. He apparently didn't figure it out that we were two Americanos sitting less than 3 feet away and his co-workers also didn't see the need to stop him from repeating himself several times. Also, when we got in the room we tried using the shower and the shower head was so old and dilapidated that more water poured out of the side of it, over the shower doors and onto the bathroom floor than what was left for us to shower in. We complained about this every single day that we were there and the responses each day ranged from a shrug of the shoulders to an off hand comment about the shower being for more than one person. After 5 days it still wasn't fixed even with a pool of water in their bathroom every single day. All in all if you need minimal assistance and end up with a working bathroom you're ahead staying here, but if you expect to be respected and you are unlucky enough to be a "Stupid Americano" who might need assistance from the front desk, you might want to find some other place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: croctad
Reviews.Content: The Piram Hotel is well-priced and of moderate luxury, with a continental breakfast included in your package. The location is not pretty, but IS ideally placed: two minutes walking distance from Stazione Termini means that anywhere in Rome (or the rest of Italy, for that matter) is easily accessible. It is surrounded by restaurants of varying quality and price, and is within easy walking distance of the Colosseum, Roman Forum, Porta Maggiore, and the Spanish Steps.

Reviews.Title: “A 2 star hotel at best, very noisy”
Reviews.Author: DarrenMarcela
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights here, the sign says it’s a 4 star, id give it 2. The good This hotel is in a great location, close to the terminal and metro stations, lots of nice café’s and restaurants in the area. The bed was quite firm, this was ok for us (down to personal taste). Room was a good size and fairly clean. TV was pretty cool, lots of programs in many languages. The Bad Breakfast was ok although a little crazy at times, not really enough staff (they were working flat out) for the amount of people. Food was pretty basic (ham, cheese, bread, cakes, juice and coffee). Lift was so slow, might as well take the stairs. Front desk staff were ok maybe a bit moody. The Ugly. The bathroom and the noise. Lets start with the bathroom, small, and I mean so small you had to step over the toilet and then the bidet, to get into the shower (which was at best warm). The noise was the worst part, even with the double glazing, secondary glazing and wooden shutters closed it was like you were trying to sleep on a round-about. Building work noise from 6am, constant traffic noise with horns every few seconds and a few mornings I was lying in bed smiling to myself in disbelief because it was so loud. In summary, I wouldn’t recommend the hotel even if I’d paid half the money. The sign outside has 4 stars, I guess 2 are for decoration and 2 are for the standard of the hotel. If you wonder why the website only shows the front door of the hotel it’s because the outside is in a bad way. Don’t take my word for it, go have a look at Google maps and the street view. http://maps.google.co.uk/maps?rlz=1T4GFRE_enGB377GB377&q=hotel%20welcome%20piram&um=1&ie=UTF-8&sa=N&hl=en&tab=wl

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean hotel, good location and good food!”
Reviews.Author: Liza99
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean, well equipped hotel. Friendly, helpful staff. Good location. Good breakfast (no fried eggs, but lots of other nice things), great value for money buffet lunch - for 10 Euro you get nice selection of dishes to choose from. Recommend also for evening meals - much better value than any restaurant we visited during our 6 days trip, and fast service. Walking distance to train station (to get to the airport) and bus station, including open top bus tours. Walking distance to one of the main shopping streets too.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, area is good”
Reviews.Author: GrahamJ_8
Reviews.Content: walked past here when we arrived.....couldn't possibly be our hotel....!! It's very well presented. A bit of a warren inside as it straddles two old buildings, each with original lifts (modern elevator too). Lift goes from a half landing so be aware if can't manage 8 or so stairs. Room was spacious and looked north. Bit of traffic noise, but hey, this is the heart of a capital city. Breakfast was adequate but the room's small and a funny shape. The location is great. Its the right side of the railway station and easy to get your bearings - we walked everywhere. Minibar prices were good - the hotel piano bar was very smart but pricey. Definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: jaywalker2309
Reviews.Content: Was with my girlfriend and her folks for a long weekend in Rome, and stayed at the `Welcome Piram`.. its just a door on a busy street 1 block up from the main station, but dont let that put you off. Inside is very well presented and the rooms whilst basic are very functional and the staff very friendly. We got clean towels every day and the rooms very well cleaned. Location wise it was practically on the station itself, and is in walking distance of ` il Colosseo` and if a good walker the rest of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Strange feeling”
Reviews.Author: bo_palmblad
Reviews.Content: My wife and I was looking forward to a 4 nights stay in Rome in Easter, the weather was perfect but it should be a chaotic start at the hotel. We were meeting a very nice woman at the disc who informed us about Rome - what to see, where to eat, what to do etc. When we was ready to get our room key when she told us that they had some rooms 10 minuttes away from the hotel - it was included our a kitchen and we would life closere to the centrum - where we should be. When we accepted to SEE the room (we where not positive, but why not see the room?) She asked us if we were hungry, because the hotel would like to offer a free lunch - after we were inside and eat a lunch (DISGUSTING - never eat the restuarent at the hotel - we did drink the water (Price € 2 / person). Then we were followed to the room - we thougt it was a joke. Kitchen - and table (no chairs) - TV was broken, Phone was broken and the bed was a cheap IKEA bed - so much for a 4 star hotel.... (my wife is pregnant and I have some backproblems - so ofcourse we refused and returned to the hotel. Then we spoked to the Manager - he told us that we accepted the free lunch = accepted the room. I told him we would pay for the lunch (which we never eat). and with some other irritating problems - we finally got a room at the hotel after 5 hours.... The hotel is good - if we didn't have had the problems in the beginning - I would have been delightet... but now after I returned I feel like I should have a penalty becouse we stayd in 4 nights. When we checked out they wanted € 19,90 for lunch - Then I had enough - I refused to pay because they never told us the lunch only was free if we would stay at the ekstra rooms - the problem was that we never accepted to stay - but accepted to see the room... If I should look at the hotel in total - Nice room, good bed, stupid TV - Italian good programs (if you speak Italian...) if not - only news - could be a borring evening. If you a going to buy a movie - its old movies and cust € 11/each. Breakfirst - Well its Italian (dry bread and a lot of cookeys) - not that exciting - keep away from their coffe.... Conclusion - SAY NO - if they try to remove you to the ekstra rooms outside the hotel - I will comparer the rooms with a 1 - 2 star hotel - not 4 star as I pay for !!! Recommending the hotel - I really can't say - I would probely not stay at that hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for low money”
Reviews.Author: EMJ_Sweden
Reviews.Content: Went for three nights at this hotel. Located very close to the central railway station in a not so crowdy area. The breakfast was simple, as everywhere but good enough. Nice rooms, but very hard beds. Good restaurants in the closeby and easy to reach everything. We would definitely recommend this hotel if you want to stay cheap and workable, ask yourself how often you really will be in the hotel rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Piram Hotel is nic the best!”
Reviews.Author: NewlyWedded09
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a total of 6 nights and we LOVED this hotel. Located about 5 mins from the Train Station so it is easy to walk there with luggage. Checking in was easy, everyone there speaks good english. Internet is either 7 Euro for 2 hours or 10 Euro for 24 hours. We got the 2 hour one and it lasted us for like 3 days. Just used it for emails and updates really. Rooms are pleasant and clean, very nice modern bathrooms. Showers are a good size too. Beds are firm but I think that is pretty standard in Europe. Very quiet hotel, didn't really hear any noise. But Rome is a very busy city so you always hear cars, ambulances, bottles and garbage pick up in the middle of the night, but it didn't affect my night time. On the main level is a wine bar, and everynight there is live piano player and singer, the staff is SOOO FRIENDLY. We went there several nights and chatted with all of them. They helped us with whatever questions we had and tried to find us a theater with english movies. I cannot say enough good things about all the people that work there. In the -1 level is the restaurant which is GREAT. Food is good and good prices too. Breakfast is served in the morning and if you expecting a classic eggs and bacon that is now how Italians eat breakfast. Selection of pastries,meats,cheeses,bread,cereal,juice and milk. Plus the standard coffee's. Good breaky to start the day. There is a TV in the room but the only english channel is CNN so if you spend your evenings in the room maybe bring a laptop and bring some movies. Lots of people think that area near train station is seedy, but very safe area. Had no problems with anyone and didn't feel unsafe once. Rooms are safe and had no problem leaving our things inside the rooms. Great little restaurant down the street and good prices too. Very friendly area! Metro is like 2 mins away and I highly recommend using the metro to get around, very cheap and takes you anywhere you want to go and is easy to navigate! Overall would stay here again and would recommend to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Good all-round hotel for a city break”
Reviews.Author: citytraveller_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from 12th to 15th March 2010, in a classic double with buffet breakfast. The outside of the hotel is a bit bleak, but don't be discouraged. The room was very adequate for our needs, and reasonably sized. Plenty of drawer space, but a small wardrobe. TV was small and had little of use for English speakers. Toilet and shower facilities were absolutely fine. Buffet breakfast had a choice of two fruit juices, three cereals, bread, cheese and ham, yoghurt, jams and a delightful range of patisserie. Staff were very helpful, particularly Susanna on the morning shift, and were very ready to offer there advice on your daily schedule. Location was ideal for those travelling in from Fiumicino, as the bus and train terminal are about three minutes walk away. Obviously, if you plan to use the transport system during the stay, this adds to the benefits of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: TheMaharaj
Reviews.Content: Having read all the good and the bad reviews on this hotel, we decided to give it a try, upon ariving we were greeting by a friendly lady at the desk who promptly checked us in and showed us on a map all the touristy places and where to get busses/trains etc. Room quality was 7/10, we had a road facing room, larger than others but a tad noisy, and scaffolding as the main view of the hotel but i guess they cant do much about that. Breakfast is ok for a free one, loaded up on their cakes and bread & butter, not bad as a starter, central location to everything, great supermarket at the terminus 5 mins walking distance, easy access. Would reccomend.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Staff, poor value”
Reviews.Author: Morrica
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four nights and we could not believe the money we had paid for the quality of the hotel. We travelled throughout Europe and were very unimpressed with this Hotel. Firstly the check-in staff, he waqqs very pompous and rude. Then we were taken to our room and the porter tried to show us how to use the TV, it did not work, so he climbed on furniture for over an hour trying to fix it, including enlisting our help. After a long travel, we were exhausted and the bathroom door would not close 100% and we could not get the porter to stop trying to 'help' to allow us to settle in or use the bathroom. Eventually he left and we were advised that the TV would be fixed while at dinner. We got back, asked if it had been fixed, and were rudely told by the same guy that yes it was. It wasn't. We rang up, and were advised tomorrow it would be fixed. Again the next day we enquired, and we were told that the TV had to work (same rude guy) as all the hotel was all on the same connection. It still did not work. We then rang up again, and were told that someone would be up in 5mins to help. After 30mins we rang back and someone finally came. They came (the rude checkin guy and another person) and tried the TV and then told us very rudely, that we had to change rooms. It was late after a long day and we did not feel the manner of speaking to the guests was very respectful or appropriate in the situation. After almost an hour wait for them to return (when we were told to wait 10mins) they returned to show us to a new room. The rude man started what was meant to be an apology by saying, this isn't my fault it is the cable companys fault. That was the first time and last time we received anything like an apology. The new room was smaller- but at least the bathroom door fully closed. You don't travel the world for hotels, or TVs, but the TV was required to be able to use the internet- which we needed. Also the way the staff (particularly the male check-in staff) treated the entire situation was appalling. The comfort of the hotel, location and breakfast provided were all no better. There are much better hotels out there and with better value for money. Best to avoid-especially as this is the only negative review I have ever posted.

Reviews.Title: “A greek lover of Rome”
Reviews.Author: AthensAleka
Reviews.Content: I have booked this hotel together with our airtickets from ALITALIA, for a 5 day relax trip in Rome with my husband. Until we arrived, I wasn't sure that it would be a good hotel, because of its low price. I was wrong. Its location was perfect near the main station, were you could take buses for all directions. The metro station of the Republica square was only 3 minutes walk from the hotel and almost all touristc attractions were within walking distance, although we are not young and we get tired easily. Around the hotel were many good restaurants with good cuisine and reasonable prices, open until late at night. Our room was the right size, very well furnished and very clean and the bathroom was recently renovated. The staff was very friendly and polite and helped us very much. We don't use to have much for breakfast at home, so breakfast was good for us with a variety of sweets and coffees, but I think that for those that eat a lot in the morning, it should also have some hot dishes.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly service and comfortable stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: podda
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner booked this hotel two weeks before we went away. Upon arrival we were greeted by friendly staff who spoke good English and shown to a cosy, clean room with a nice small balcony. The hotel was in a great location...very close to the metro station and bus station and only about a 15 minute walk from the trevi fountain. We managed to see all the key sights during our two and a half days and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. This was a great hotel for us as a young couple as it gave us the chance to see all of the sights and get a reasonable nights sleep. The shower was great aswell, not one of the ones that drizzles but very powerful and perfect temperature. The breakfast wasn't quite to our fancy as it was quite sweet (lots of iced croissants and cherry tart) but food in the area was cheap and easily accessible anyway so it wasn't a problem. A great place to stay at a very good price!! Definitely worth it!!

Reviews.Title: “Not the best hotel on earth!”
Reviews.Author: PSP1967
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is well situated, with bus route to all main attrations and staff were friendly and helpful, however, the rooms weren't exactly luxurious.The windows didn't close properly so air con didn't work. The windows were very difficult to open too as the inside windows and shutters were in the way. The traffic was noisy until early hours of the morning.The lock on our (sliding) toilet door was on the outside instead of inside and the bathroom was very small and cramped.The beds were very hard and we all had backache on the third day of our stay.Would rate this as a budget hotel but don't bother if you're hoping for any great comfort!

Reviews.Title: “A Great base for Rome sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: CS30
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. After getting the train from the Airport into the Termini, we were over joyed when we discovered that we were less than a 2 minute walk to our Hotel. Although it may not look it from the outside, the Welcome Piram is a very nice hotel. The staff were very accomodating, and more than happy to advise us as required. Upon check in, we were told everything we would need to know for the weekend, which made things easier. The location of the Hotel is perfect, although located near the 'scruffier' end of the city, it made walking to the sights easy and near to the required amenities. We had the breakfast option, which consisted primarily of cakes and pastries, plus a selection of breads and cereals, all as much as you wanted. The rooms are cosy, but well equipt with a fridge (minibar) bathroom and shower, TV/Internet if wanted. The rooms blocked out all light which made sleeping a pleasure. The Welcome Piram is a great base for those on their first trip to Rome

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nick-sheff
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Clean, spacious rooms. Very helpfull staff. Great location for public transport (2 mins from Termini station) Walking distance to all the main sights.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't even get to stay”
Reviews.Author: Srixon
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through hotels.com on 5th January for a weekend stay on 29th-31st January. Booking confirmed and all well until an e-mail from hotels.com the evening before departure advising booking cancelled, apparently due to overbooking by hotel. In this day of computerised booking technology I am sceptical as to whether a hotel can accidentally overbook and wonder if it is something else going on or whether there was a genuine problem - but to figure this out and let us know late on the day before? Saying that we don't appear to be the first as the reviews on Tripadvisor suggest travellers booking here through hotels.com and other booking sites have had problems in the past. Being about to leave for the airport this didn't do a lot for our peace of mind but Nadine at hotels.com was absolutely fantastic, finding and confirming a room for us at the Mecenate Palace which was an excellent hotel. I should mention I tried to e-mail the hotel a number of times a week before to double check whether they had our booking but received no answer. I would suggest if you plan to book here you get a confirmation of your booking from the hotel before you set off. Shame because the hotel looked okay to me but admittedly with some mixed reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Upgraded to an amazing room!”
Reviews.Author: ErasmusTraveller
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we were upgraded to a superior room for no apparent reason. The room we were given was HUGE! and very beautifully decorated. It felt classically Italian, quite minimal but very comfortable. Very clean, very close to the main rail station and very inexpensive. The location of the hotel is perfect for exploring Rome and my boyfriend and I covered all the sights, without rushing, by strolling about for two days. A definite bargain, and you must ask to be upgraded if possible!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but VERY repetitive breakfast”
Reviews.Author: restless-linn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I picked this hotel because of its convenient location. We stayed here for 5 nights. It's very close to the terminus (about 2 big walking blocks). The staff were very helpful and spoke good English. The room is nice and clean. I only wish they didn't spray too much Glade in the room, though! Now the cons: The hotel is located on a corner of 2 streets and it can be very noisy with the cars honking. It can get pretty bad. Breakfast is very repetitive. For 5 nights there, we had croissants, donuts, breads and cereals everyday. There are wired and wireless internet access in both rooms and lobby but they are NOT free. There's a nearby internet cafe and it was only for EURO 1.5 per hour if you're looking to get connected. It's a lot cheaper than the hotel rates. The restaurants around the hotel are very touristy with tourist menus! If you're a foodie, try avoid them :) We had the worst pizza from around this area! We booked the hotel from expedia.ca and it was at a discounted rate. If the hotel wasn't on a discounted rate, I would not have booked with them.

Reviews.Title: “A bargain -- but you get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: wanderingchick
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent four nights in a quadruple room at the Hotel Piram. The room was comfortable: it was larger than anticipated, although sparsely furnished. The continental breakfast was okay, if repetitious (a daily spread of cold cereal and sweat pastries), and there was a dearth of non-tourist restaurants in the neighborhood. On the other hand, it was convenient to the train station. Plus: Free transfer from the airport, since we were staying for four nights. Minus: While the staff was largely accommodating (especially Suzanna), the daytime receptionist Nona was repeatedly rude.

Reviews.Title: “A very solid choice near Termini...”
Reviews.Author: hydro56
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the negative reviews here, I was a bit apprehensive about having prepaid for 7 nights at this hotel. But I got a very good rate for Rome and it was near the train station, which was perfect for my purposes. I really have nothing negative to say about this hotel. The staff were all very friendly and accommodating. The room was huge by European standards. I've stayed in rooms 1/5th the size in London. Everything was very clean. Items in the mini bar were a good value. Example: Coke for 1.50 Euro. This is one of the closest hotels to Termini Station, which puts you at the intersection of both metro lines in Rome and makes day trips by train a breeze. There are certainly more atmospheric areas to stay in Rome, but this locale is very convenient if you want to do a lot of sightseeing. There was a bit of street noise, but this is very standard for Rome. It would have been nice if the owners would invest in a bit more soundproofing. I did not try the breakfast. But there are plenty of cafes nearby where you can get a decent cappuccino and a pastry for a nominal cost.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: mehow
Reviews.Content: We got an extraordinary good room rate while booking directly on hotel's website and were very pleasantly surprised about quality of the hotel. Check-in and check-out were smooth and efficient. The room was small and overlooking the courtyard but very clean and modern with all necessary facilities. The only thing I can complain about was breakfast - only sweet stuff and coffee. No fresh bread nor any vegetables or fruits.

Reviews.Title: “Piram good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Brandonboy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here found staff very nice and helpful. Great central location right beside Termini (Train Terminal) 3 minutes walk to metro or train to aiport. Walk to major Rome sites in 15 minutes. Room is small but bigger than most European rooms(especially London Hotels). Newly renovated marble and includes breakfast. Great place to stay no regrets and will return! FYI outside does not look like much but the inside is totally different. One recommedation get a room facing street as garbage pick up in alley between hotels is at 5 am.

Reviews.Title: “This was the worst hotel experience in Rome”
Reviews.Author: tennismomof4
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel was the worst example of customer service we have ever experienced. They were rude, combative, and overall the poorest example of hospitality. The front desk employees gave false information regarding attractions and directions, as well as failed to make extended requested reservations. When asked about the hotel admitted error, we were told to take our money elsewhere and leave the hotel after spending 3 nights and several hundreds of dollars with their business. I would never recommend staying at this establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Are we talking about the same Priam???”
Reviews.Author: Gusser
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Priam at the end of August for 4 nights and were very happy with the accomodations. Adrianna checked us in and made sure we used our 3 days in Rome to our best advantage. She outlined an itinerary for us that was not too taxing and hit all of the highlites. Her suggestions from drinking water to bus tickets to eating places were so helpful. Our room was on the 6th floor and we had the use of two elevators. The people working the desk were always available to help us and went out of their way to be pleasant and friendly. August was a very hot time in Rome and our air conditioning worked very well and was so appreciated. Our breakfasts were abundant although a little heavy on the sweets and carbs but this is Rome!! There was also a good supply of cereal and yogurt. If guests are a little too demanding at the outset and have set their expectations higher than the establishment is able to or required to deliver, the experience for both will be soured. If one expects 5 star service then one should check in to a 5 star hotel and pay the 5 star rate. The Priam Hotel is excellent value for the money, great location, and we would not hesitate to give it our recommendation!

Reviews.Title: “A Special Kind of Rudeness”
Reviews.Author: Starbucky
Reviews.Content: My partner and I were going to Rome for the first time. It was a two day stay and the reviews for this hotel appeared decent when we booked it. Yet, upon arriving we discovered that we never had a chance at a pleasant stay. I went up to the desk attendant and said I had a reservation. She looked at me insanely and said, "For what?" Are we not in a hotel? Later when we asked if the room had a BATH (not a bathroom) she said yes with a sluggish eye roll. It was apparent she wanted to get rid of us as soon as possible. Later, when we were finally allowed in the room, a different attendant escorted us. She thought it was funny that we had to climb five flights when the elevator was working perfectly. (we were told otherwise) Of course, it was an unacceptable room with a silly view of sewage. Before we could get her attention she disappeared into thin air. We called reception and asked to have the room change. They said they couldn't do anything about it, again, very rudely. After a series of phone calls our room was changed. Now why didn't we get this one from the start? Overall, from check in, (to asking for a wine opener, being told to come down and get it only to discover it was lost long ago. The attendant was purring in French to some other woman and when I walked up to the desk her smile faded), to checking out and being scowled at this hotel was terrible. They lack pride in service and they make you feel like they're doing you a favor. FYI - the place where you leave your luggage is a open access room. It's hardly safe. If you're planning on a short trip and don't care if people are openly rude to you then this is the place for you. Good luck.

Reviews.Title: “No service, bad breakfast”
Reviews.Author: DutchJAWA
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights in the hotel. The hotel is situated near Termini, and Piazza della Republica. Although the location itself is very good (close to metro, bus and some sights), the neighbourhood is a bit dodgy. Nevertheless, we never felt unsafe when we walked around there. Our room was on the sixth floor. The room was cosy, but far, far away from everything, since there is only one staircase and one elevator which can be used. Our room did have airco, but it did not work. According to the staff 'because it is November'. Moreover, our TV did not work, but this time 'because it is Rome'. The furniture was scratched and it the room had quite a small wardrobe. Nevertheless, there were a safe and a minibar. The bathroom was decent, although the shower head was clogged with lime and did not work very well. We got clean towels every day. The staff were not very friendly and not helpful at all. They told us their standardtalk (about where everything was located), but that was it. The breakfast was bad. There were only some sweet rolls, some cereals (really cheap ones) and some toast. No cold cuts, no fruit. The coffee was disgusting, as was the 'orange juice' (or what it was...). We booked this hotel based on the reviews, but we were disappointed when we arrived. Everything in the hotel seems to be done in the cheapest way.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, wonderful furniture”
Reviews.Author: Cretamania
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed for a week in July 2009. The hotel is about 200 meters from the main Railway station, and a similar distance from Republica metro station. Not the best area, but two women felt no fear walking around at night. The furniture is wonderful; ornate, veneer mosiac antiques. Fabulous. It even has one of those beautiful art deco lifts in use. The staff are very friendly and speak excellent English. The identical twins have a great sense of humour, and don't wear their name badges. The staff are happy to advise on places to visit and how to get there. They answered every question happily, even recommending we took water from the drinking fountains instead of buying bottles. The housekeeping staff are friendly, and the room kept clean. There is a small fridge in the room. The bathroom was tiny, with nowhere to hang our towels. I hated the idea of putting them on the beautiful veneer bedroom furniture... There is no room service, but we saw people taking in a pizza, and were told the staff recommended where to go. We asked them to recommend a restaurant to us, and were told that all the ones in the locale were pretty similar. They seemed to be pretty identical when we tried them.. The breakfast is pretty poor, instant coffee and massproduced croissant. I'd happily stay there again, but would take a kettle and proper coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for 3 star (if you don't value breakfast)”
Reviews.Author: zedgurl
Reviews.Content: Only went for 4 nights and if had been for any longer wouldn't have been happy, but perfectly adequate for short break. Small room, microscopic but clean bathroom. Teeny weeney wardrobe, which doesn't matter for a few days. Breakfast was help yourself and if you like cakey pastries all well and good. If you don't go for sweet things then it's bread and butter or cereal. No cheese or cold meats as one might expect for continental type buffet breakfast. Ok though. No views but who cares when you're out and about all day. Bed big, clean and comfortable. Towels changed daily. I would only recommend this hotel with the above reservations. It is quite well located in that it's very close to Termini which is the main station/metro so easy to get to and from. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful and it was easy to leave suitcases when we arrived before check in time and flight was in evening.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for making our Rome visit a memorable one”
Reviews.Author: Montpesh
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in Rome to celebrate our 34th wedding anniversary. It's been our routine to spend the anniversary weekend in a new city. Thanks to the staff of Welcome Piram to make our visit enjoyable and memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Think twice before you book a room there because you might land in a cloak”
Reviews.Author: elisavova
Reviews.Content: I can't say much about the inside of the hotel as we were not allowed to check in, although we had a prepaid reservation for two nights! What I can say, though, is that the personnel is extremely unkind and treats customers in an unacceptable way, clearly distinguishing between them according to some unknown rules. When we went to check-in we witnessed how other two couples before us were accepted, whereas we were sent to the most horrible hotel ever, hotel Nizza nearby, because of some "problems with the room". After seeing how disgusting the other hotel was, we returned to claim our rights and were treated as nothing, not given any explanation for the change of the reservation and not being offered anything more decent. The only answer to any question we asked was "I can't do anything about it" and head shaking. Simply unbelievable! No dialogue was possible whatsoever, we were just sent away. Was it because we booked through hotels.com at a cheaper rate and those booking directly there at full price are let in? A hotel that sends its guests like this to smelly holes like Nizza deserve a review as bad as theirs.

Reviews.Title: “Funny how they relocate you. Read the reviews closely.”
Reviews.Author: AngelaUSA_9
Reviews.Content: Lost a day in Rome. Worst hotel expereince ever. When we arrived they told us there was a water problem and put us at a hotel across the street (Hotel Nissa- go on trip advisor to read about that one). This was a one star HOLE. So we waited at the lobby while they continued to let other people come in and register at Piram hotel. We later learned they were overbooked by the morning staff and apparently this is very common practice according to staff by both hotels. In fact, that same night they were still renting rooms in this hotel on another search engine. They would not let us go to a different hotel because apparrently they were all booked in the area. We found many hotels around the block that were available for what we paid. Basically, we had prepaid and therefore, they had our money and would not let us go anywhere else.The hotel they put us at had wires hanging out, holes in the roof and just frankly one of the dirtiest hotels I ever stayed at. My faimily was very upset because someone was making a buck on us obviously and the manager did not care. Spent our first evening and the morning in Rome trying to get moved back to the hotel. Also, parking is 8 blocks away at the radisson for 15 euros a day. They told us they would give us a letter stating they were overbooked so I could get a refund. The next day, I was told the owner refused. Definitely something funny going on here. I would never stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location with good value”
Reviews.Author: Mtl_Kid_Kodak
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel last minute for 90 euros and was not disappointed. From the outside, the hotel looks like nothing, but it had a very nice lobby. Our room was on the 6th floor and getting there you needed to walk up a flight of stairs as the elevator stopped at the 5th floor. Our room was very big, with a couch, double bed and large bathroom. Everything was spotlessly clean. Internet on specific sites was also offered free of charge directly in the rooms via the tv. The breakfast was decent although the coffee wasn't great, but there was an abundance of food so I definitely ate my fill. The hotel is situated right next to the termini station which made transportation a breeze. We could take a tramway, metro or bus from the termini station which was very convenient. The colosseum was also only 20 minutes away if you felt like walking. We were also able to park directly in front of our hotel for our entire stay, which was very convenient and not too expensive, directly on the street. Our only complaints were that our double bed consisted of two single beds over which they placed a queen sized contour sheet so we were sometimes obliged to shove our beds closer together. Also, on our last day, the hot water was not very warm and the pressure wasn't very strong - the hotel offered to send a plumber in the afternoon but we were leaving that same day so didn't bother. Overall though, we were pleased with the value of the hotel, given the price we'd paid.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: PaulandNadene
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at the beginning of the month. We booked 3 months in advanced and were able to get a great deal (for Rome!) and we were placed in huge suite. It was a great location as long as you are willing to walk 5-10km a day. We were able to see all the sights all on foot -- Vatican City included -- but we don't mind a nice walk. Service was friendly and very helpful. Breakfast was standard (coffee machine was terrible!), but the pasteries served changed each day.. and it was free! Room was clean & comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY AT WELCOME PIRAM HOTEL!!”
Reviews.Author: abc776
Reviews.Content: I read an earlier review of the hotel 'relocating' guests to other lesser properties. Same thing happened to me. I understand the owner has a string of properties which are half the 220Euro value I paid!! Very poor quality room, zero facilities, bad smell and the so-called room service breakfast simply didnt arrive. I've stayed in ALOT better hotels in Rome for much much less money. I guess if it's any consolation, I accidentally broke a couple of things when I left..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for the train station but a fairly average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vegas_Chick07
Reviews.Content: Just returned from staying at the Welcome Piram in Rome. This hotel was located literally 2 minutes from Termini station which was very handy for trains and buses. We were given a friendly welcome and the receptionist gave us a very handy map on which she marked points of interest and told us how to get to them. There are 2 lifts - one very old one which we didn't use, and one new one. We had some difficulty selecting the floor we wanted during our stay as the numbers were 'swipe activated' rather than being actual buttons, and it was sometimes difficult to make them work. Our room was clean and presentable, although the bathroom was very small. We discovered that the wash basin would not drain the water away and so informed reception who said they would get someone to take a look. When we returned that evening no one had been to sort it out so we had to ask a second time. Fortunately, this time something was done and we had no further problems. Some other small negatives were that one of the beds had a big hole in the sheet, and there was a distinct lack of plug sockets! I managed to find one next to my side of the bed eventually but it wasn't very handy for the mirror, if you were drying your hair for example. I would also advise that if you don't have a sweet tooth then you won't find much to your liking at breakfast! Apart from some cereal, the rest was a selection of pastries, cakes, tarts, yoghurts and plain sliced bread (with either jam, honey or chocolate spread). There was a selection of juices and hot drinks. I believe that this is typical of hotels in Rome though. The hotel was close to a Metro station so it was easy to get around. We walked to the Colosseum which took around 25 minutes, and to the Trevi Fountain which took around 40 minutes. There was a restaurant on the corner of our street which the hotel recommended to us, but it was fairly disappointing. The pizzas we ordered had a very hard, chewy base, and we asked for some water and a bread basket which didn't arrive, yet they tried to charge us for them when the bill came! The hotel's best feature was its close location to the Termini, but other than that it was a fairly average hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely hotel and great value for money”
Reviews.Author: JulsLarne
Reviews.Content: I stayed here and it was the perfect location, just around the corner from the termini station and stop 1 for all the tour buses. Clean hotel and friendly staff. Air conditioning leaves rooms nice and cold but ask for it to be switched off at night by reception or you may get too cold. Really good value for money. Would definately stay here again. Bedroom was clean but minimal. Bathroom was really nice with a jacuzzi bath. Fridge and room safe were provided also.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel but the location could be better”
Reviews.Author: linc2068
Reviews.Content: The Welcome Piram Hotel is a reasonable 3 star hotel which does a reasonable job at providing the essentials but doesn't strive for luxury. The room was clean and a decent size with plenty of storage space for a 4 night stay. The reception staff were friendly and spoke English fairly fluently, and were happy to recommend nearby restaurants and buses we could use to get around. The location, whilst not terrible, is not great either. The hotel is near the Termini train station and the area immediately surrounding the hotel is not the nicest. It is about 20 mins walk to get to the closest of the main sites and the walk is not the most inspiring. After the first day or so we started using the public transport more and that is a key advantage of the area. The Termini station is a significant transport interchange - with both metro lines stopping there and a large number of buses running past. If you get a 3 day Roma Pass you can use as many buses etc as you want, and they make it easier to get to places like the Vatican. One area in which the hotel could improve would be by offering a nicer breakfast - it was mostly a selection of cakes and donuts which is great if you have a really sweet tooth but I prefer something more savoury in the morning. Generally however the hotel was reasonable and there were no major complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel - way more than 3*, great location, great service, great value”
Reviews.Author: barrki
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Welcome Piram Hotel for 4 nights. It is situated in a great place - 2 minutes from Termini station from which you can take a bus or a metro to anywhere in Rome and a train to almost anywhere in Italy (the train to/from fiumicino airport gets there). It's near piazza della republica and Nazionale St. There's a great cafe with good pizza and pasta on the corner from the hotel and the prices are good. The receptionists were very kind and helpful. They gave us tips and referred us to the main sites in Rome and showed us how to get there. They even checked the weather for us and showed us The hotel's style is great too., The rooms have wood parquet and the furniture is antique. The bathroom appliances are all new and clean. The rooms are very spacious and cozy. The breakfast is OK - quite good for a European breakfast - pastry, cereal, bread, toast, jam, honey, chocolate spread, coffee, juice. All in all for the price we paid we got a whole deal more than we've expected in all terms - Service, Location, Cleanliness, Rooms - everything!

Reviews.Title: “Doubted reviews and false hospitality”
Reviews.Author: mourano
Reviews.Content: I had a reservation at the hotel along with my wife and daughter. Arrived in reception and the story started when a rude receptionist (head of reception) told us that someone will take us to an apartment that is close to our hotel, but it is part of Welcome Piram. She confirmed that it is only 5 minutes walking distance from the hotel and that is very convenient. We had an international flight with lots of luggage, so we had to drag these bags all the way through Rome busy traffic and sidewalks. We saw the apartment (that is not legally attached to Welcome Piram, and may be not ensured too) and was children un-friendly with a broken elevator that goes back to the 17th Century in terms of maintenance and size!! The apartment building has no name that indicated the relevance with Welcome Piram “hotel”. Our experience was only at the reception because we were not allowed to stay because we have a child, so how can you imagine the discriminative service once you really stay in the hotel. The hotel is well promoted as a property, but they may be forgot how to behave with guests and be friendly with children (this is not the Italian hospitality that encouraged me to come and visit Rome!!). We discovered later that they also charged us one night cancelation fees in a time we did not cancel...we thought this is so un- ethical. I think the hotel needs training on something called "hospitality". It does not have to be all about money. I will never recommend this hotel to anyone who is planning to enjoy Rome. I will recommend it to people who would like to feel sick once they arrive in the reception!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, fabulously situated hotel”
Reviews.Author: Canadaloves2travel
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was perfect for us! It was conveniently located between Termini Station (perfect for anybody using the Metro around the City or Leonardo Express from the Airport) and the Basilica di Santa Maria Maggiore. The breakfast offered a great selection of foods and the pastries were fresh. The rooms were very clean and cool- the only thing was the drain in our shower was not working properly, so it took a while for the water to go down and even spilled out into our room once. Internet was not working when we were there and there was no parking available- I would not recommend a car in Rome anyway. The staff was very friendly and recommended a delicious restaurant with a great Tourist menu. It was called the Ristorante da Giovanni di Valentino (36 Via Filippo Turati) and was located just down the street from the Hotel (less than a 5 minute walk).

Reviews.Title: “Everything nearby”
Reviews.Author: BoInCh
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel i the very centre of Rome. Close to everything. Hard to find. Only a small sign on the wall outside. Staff was very nice. Breakfast soso. Traditional continental. Aircondition in room did not manage to chill down enough but much better than none att all. Stayed two nights and we can recommend this one.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and clean”
Reviews.Author: cmr42
Reviews.Content: Although located in the so-called dodgy Stazione Termini area, this hotel was very comfortable, had great service and friendly staff and an adequate breakfast. 2 minutes walk to the nearest metro, which is great if you are in Rome for the sights. No complaints, but without a discount voucher (which I obtained from the website of a well known travel company) some may consider the Welcome Piram a tad on the expensive side.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location-Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaBoudreau
Reviews.Content: When we travel we are not looking to stay in a desitnation hotel, only a clean, safe, comfortable place to sleep and shower. This was all of what we wanted, with excellent access to public transportation. The hotel is right by a metro stop, bus terminal, and railroad station. Getting anywhere was really easy. The staff knows the right bus to take to get anywhere. Clean rooms, AC was not very effective, good service. I would recommend this for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Liz02Derry_N_Ireland
Reviews.Content: Having read mixed reviews on this hotel we decided to go ahead and book due to a budget. Glad we did as the hotel in situated in an excellent location, close to most of the major attractions (if you don't mind walking a bit). Breakfast was croissants, yoghurts, juice, coffee, tea etc. from a machine - not great but eat/drink as much as you like. Our room was basic but very clean, change of towels everyday, air con great. View from our window looked into back of another building, we didn't mind though as we were out all day and just wanted somewhere comfortable to sleep. Plenty of cafes, restaurants, shops nearby. Go to the termini station, just a few minutes walk for great shopping, there's also a supermarket in it. We didn't use a bus, metro or tram all week - just a taxi to Fiumcino airport on our return home €45.00 (for 3 people) organized by the hotel staff. Try 'La Gallina Bianca' restaurant for fantastic pizza, just a few streets behind the hotel. Spring water available free from the natural fountains scattered throughout the city. Would definitely stay at this hotel again due to the location.

Reviews.Title: “Would I choose to stay at Hotel Piram again? ..No I would not...”
Reviews.Author: whitescastle
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the hotel in late July 2009. We wanted a hotel in central Rome within easy reach of all attractions and sadly that is the only thing going for it. It is very convenient to the main railway station (termini) and other attractions. A four-euro railcard can get you anywhere you want to go but that sadly, is nothing to do with the hotel. I emailed the hotel in advance explaining that this was a special trip for my wife and I, a twenty-fifth wedding anniversary treat. I asked for a nice room with bath and shower. They did not even reply and made no reference to it when we arrived. They clearly did not read it. We were allocated a room on the fourth floor and if we had a cat we would have trouble swinging it. The room was small, dark and dreary. The bathroom, with a shower only, was so tiny it was uncomfortable to use. The only window in the room opened onto a space that could only be described as cave like with daylight barely able to penetrate to the bottom and dirty too. There are no decent views from any room but it would be nice to look out on the hustle ad bustle of the streets below at least. I explained that we were not happy with the room allocated and the following night we were moved to a larger room but still had to put up a view from the bedroom window that I preferred to ignore. Room facilities, generally were ok, towels and linen changed daily and the rooms are clean but you expect that to be the case at any reasonable hotel across the world and congratulations for that is not offered or given. Other facilities did not work. Breakfast was of extremely poor quality. The breakfast room is divided in two and, it too is very dreary. Basically it is a cafeteria with all drinks dispensed from machines and again very poor quality. Breakfast consists of chocolate filled croissants (I hate chocolate at breakfast), white label yoghurt, cereal (a strange mixture of muesli and cornflakes), Melba toast in packets and sweetbread. Tables are not cleared quickly and if you happen to enter the breakfast room at a busy time you’ll find it difficult to find a table that’s clean. Overall the breakfast service is very poor, shoddy and does not cater for those who are used to a decent continental breakfast in other parts of Europe. If you are from the UK, France or Ireland you will find the breakfast offered is well below basic standards you might be used to and is the direct opposite to the general standard you would find elsewhere in Rome. Front of house staff at the hotel are cheerful and pleasant but show little understanding of their guest needs. It would seem that they expect customers to accept their point of view regardless and were somewhat condescending towards my expression of unhappiness with the room originally allocated. I had to be assertive with them and say that the first room was simply not acceptable. I got the clear impression that they were not very well trained in hotel etiquette and customer care and got by on cheery demeanour alone. Services provided in the rooms include a TV with internet access and access to movies (11 euro per movie??) if you wished. Over a three-day period none of these services were available anyway. The only services available to us were a few non-english TV channels and one English language news service (CNN). Surely it is a basic service to have one or two English speaking TV channels available considering the large proportion of English speaking guests staying in the hotel and especially as the hotel offers its services internationally. There was a safe in the room and after numerous attempts to get it to work I gave up. Bear in mind that the internet is a chargeable service according to reception staff, however on the hotel website it says that service is free. Talking of the hotel website, it clearly gives a very different impression of what is actually true and I would ignore the impression of quality it gives. I found the general atmosphere at the hotel as rundown; a lick of paint in the public areas would be welcome. What could be a charming building feels somewhat less so. Overall, service (despite being cheerful) was poor. Some facilities in the rooms don’t work or chargeable despite statements clearly made on the hotel website. Breakfast quality and service is abysmal at best and the only, yes the only thing it has going for it is its location. There are plenty of great restaurants nearby and sadly there are a multitude of other really nice looking hotels in the immediate vicinity all look much nicer and offered at the same price as this one so, it might be wise to shop around first. If I was asked to recommend a hotel in central Rome based on my experience I honestly, could not recommend Welcome Hotel Piram.

Reviews.Title: “For the price, I couldn't ask for more”
Reviews.Author: jbui1018
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel for $60 a night, so I can't really complain about anything. Not everyone will get such a good rate, so I will not base my review on price. The hotel room is clean, but very small. The staff (Tim and Marlon) were very helpful. The location is decent, close to Termini Station. All major sites are within walking distance or you can take the Metro at Termini. The hotel didn't have an ice machine, which I thought was weird. The air condition was good and the rest seemed on par with a 3 star hotel for European standards.

Reviews.Title: “Credit card demand - even though already paid !”
Reviews.Author: Phil_K5
Reviews.Content: It was the first I'd ever needed to do this. I'd been all over the world and never once been asked for my credit card before I'd even been given my room number ! If I hadn't been tired from trying to find this hotel I'd have told them I hadn't brought one (which I hadn't intended to do, I had brought it by accident) I'm waiting for my monthly bill to see if they've stung me for anything. Room was basic but fine. Shower OK, but led to believe from the reviews here there'd be FAR more - even jacuzzis. There wasn't. Even the toilet seat wasn't screwed in properly, and kept slipping off one end. Clean, no doubt. Always well tidied. Breakfast awful unless you like doughnuts and glazed croissants (which were nice to be fair) bread, but no way of toasting them, coffee machines which were quite good - but like Spain, Italy does excellent coffee anywhere you may go. (The USA is the WORST coffee I have had anywhere by a LONG way) Unlike Spain, Italy does FABULOUS (if expensive) ice cream wherever you go too. Location couldn't have been much better, near Termini station. Don't make the same mistake I did if you're using the "Terravision" shuttle from Rome Ciampino airport. It drops you off on the OPPOSITE side of Termini station from where you need to be for this hotel. Walk through the station to the other entrance end, and then head to your RIGHT on the first line of streets after the main road running parallel to the station (I went left....) Great for Metro (which was much smaller than I thought it would be, and goes to less places) Get a Roma pass, for €23 for admission to 2 - Colosseum for example, and reduced to the rest, and free transport - metro and buses around the city. Didn't use buses myself. All in all, decent hotel and base. Would have given more stars but for that hugely annoying credit card thing and the poor breakfasts

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was just perfect for a three day stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: ScotsLoveItaly
Reviews.Content: What a perfect hotel. We had a lovely bedroom with corner bath on the 6th Floor, spotless clean. The staff were so friendly and in particular Nana who gave us good information on where to go/eat etc on arrival. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: winstneo
Reviews.Content: It was a fantastic location, you can walk to all the major sights, eg Colloseum, Trevi Fountain and etc. The breakfast was all different breads/buns and coffee plus some supermarket bought yoghurt, if this is not what you want, I suggest that you skip the included breakfast and save some money. Because the main railway station is just 3 minutes away, Stazione Termini, and with 3 McDonalds all within minutes of each other, I eat at McDonalds every morning.

Reviews.Title: “I had no problems...”
Reviews.Author: DominoLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel between 18 and 20 May 2009. Check-in was slow but since we were on holiday we just relaxed about it. Breakfast is as bad as everyone says it is, my tip is to turn left out of the hotel and at the first cafe you reach, you can stand at the bar for E1 cappuchino and 80c espresso. Croissants that haven't been double-glazed in sugar icing can be had for 80c as well. Don't sit down as everything will cost three times as much!! They also serve decent food and the service is good. We experienced low water pressure once during my stay, when we got up later than usual, but we had a lot of showers and it was fine and hot at all other times. Our rooms were clean, the air con wasn't massively powerful but we didn't wish to have a freezing room and then boil when we went outside. Our room was enormous, if sparsely furnished, with really nice wooden floor, nice old furniture and a very clean and new looking bathroom (room 453). We overlooked the road at the front of the hotel. Our room was pretty quiet though we did take ear plugs just in case. The area as a whole is ok, not as threatening as people make out, though I do live in south east London so maybe I am more used to it. The stretch of road that the hotel is on isn't great but turn left out of the hotel, and left again and there are a number of decent restaurants and small shops for snacks etc. The hotel is very close to Termini station as others have noted - so its very easy for train, metro and bus access. Trains leave Fumincino Airport every half an hour (6 mins past and 36 mins past I think). They leave Termini at 22 mins past and 52 mins past) The journey taks 30 mins and costs E11 each way. The bus takes 70 mins and costs E8. Walking times to the main sights (Trevi Fountain, Forum, Colliseum) are 15 mins plus, depending on your walking speed, and at 35 degrees you probably won't be walking too fast! Roma Pass - unless you are going to visit loads of museums it might not be worth it. It costs E23 and you get free transport (which is great). You also get free entry into 2 attractions and reduced entry into others (not inc Vatican City) but the vast majority of the attractions are musuems - not my cup of tea. Go to a street called Via del Governo Vecchio, between Piazza Navona and the river. There are loads of little Trattorias there and its less busy with cars than other streets near the sights. Trattorias are much cheaper than Ristorantes. We had a main course and beers for E15 each. You can eat hot panninis for lunch which are E2.50 each if you are feeling frugal, we we were. The exchange rate is TERRIBLE out there. The change places were offering £1 for 89c and then there was commission as well. Do your homework before you go to ensure you get the best exchange rate.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location & Very clean..”
Reviews.Author: jenzer88
Reviews.Content: The welcome piram hotel was a nice and very clean hotel, the staff were very friendly and helpful.However it was not as i expected from the pictures that they have up on thier website. As it was a special occasion i requested a room with a nice view and I also requested a room with a jacuzzi, I got neither. The room we did get was number 622 it was small but very cleanwhich is the main thing i look for in a hotel the windows were small and rectangular looking out on a wall as i requested a nice view i was not very happy with this. Its a great resting place for a anyone that wishes to sight see. I found the bed a bit hard but my boyfriend loves hard beds so he was delighted. The brekfast was the usual contenential brekfast with crossaints, dohnuts, cakes, bread, cereal that was nto tastey at all, there was 4 different types of juices lemon, pomergranite, pineapple and mango none of whichI found nice at all. This hotel is in a superb location it is literally around the corner from the Termini Station and there is a hop on bus tour stop at the termini station also which i found good.There is also a great Italian resturaunt called la cucina nazionalle its the opposite direction to the termini station if you continue straight for a minutes walk it is on your left. I Highly reccomend this restuaraunt we recieved great service and not at a crazy price. I had a brillaint time in rome and I would probably return again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: speckled_0
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a fab location. Its 2 minutes from the Termini Station, lots of bus routes, including various Sightseeing Buses and the Terravision bus which can take you in for €4 from the airport!
