The rooms were spacious and clean as was the hotel. The only downside we found was the breakfast. Its very simple, included bread yoghurts and a couple of pastries, but for the money you pay and location you get, its definitely worth it. Definitely value for money compared to many hotels I found, and if you're not looking for anything amazing, just a nice easy place to stay then go for it!

Reviews.Title: “More like a two star, not a three”
Reviews.Author: Nicki-2009
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and the towels were changed daily, and luckily we were in the same part of the hotel as the reception. The location was great for being able to reach everywhere we wanted to go, less than 5 minutes walk from the bus terminal and the train station, there is a direct train from the Leonardo Airport. The bus tickets are just 4Euros for the day and the bus journey is 10 minutes away from Vatican City, the Collusseum, The Spanish Steps and pretty much anywhere you would want to go. The breakfast was as described and unlimited, a selection of sweet pastries and yoghurt were available from 7.30 - 11am, the breakfast was self service but the food was not labelled and different pastries were in the same basket, however you could get as much as you liked and had a good selection of tea, coffee and fruit juice available. HOWEVER....... The pictures on the website showed a whirlpool bath which we were really looking forward to after a long day of walking and sightseeing, when we got there there was no bath, We complained and were told we could change rooms the next morning. This came as quite a relief as the room we were in had no wardrobes and the TV would only work on Italian channels. The pay per view did not work and the staff were unable to assist, this was very frustrating as the hotel offered nothing else in the way of entertainment. We went to reception the next morning to be told that the staff the previous night were wrong and that the whirlpool baths were not plumbed in in any of the rooms and therefore we would not be changing rooms. When we questioned the wardrobe we were told this would be corrected, when we arrived back at the hotel later that day we found that we had been given extra coat hangers but still nowhere to hang anything. The room had no tea or coffee making facilities just a mini bar which was fairly reasonable in price, but any tea or coffee we required we were sent down the street to the nearest tea room. (We strongly recommend the tea room on the corner for your evening meal, great food, fantastic service and reasonable prices). For a three star hotel it was disapointing to find there was no kettle, iron, tea or coffee, wardrobe or bath. The hotel did not even have a bar or restaurant. The taxi service back to the airport offered by the hotel was around 20 euros more than the advertised rate of all the nearby taxi stands. The beds were very hard and only had a thin pillow each and the bedding was not changed in the three nights we were there, the rest was therefore uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but not a 3 star - only for the confident traveller”
Reviews.Author: Treaders123
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband for four nights over Easter - positives were: > Proximity to major sites - most within walking distance > Clean rooms - towels changed everyday and fresh toiletries > Fairly good reception staff Negatives: > Wasn't in the main hotel - sent 200m down the road to Hotel Termini due allegedly to the earthquakes in L'Aquila which was a complete fib because looking at the reviews here they've been doing this for ages. > Slightly dodgy location - unless you're a confident traveller don't stay here. We had a fight break out right in front of the hotel. > Breakfast - could be better variety.

Reviews.Title: “Hostel *”
Reviews.Author: Miletravel
Reviews.Content: Even 2* rating would be too generous for this one. I saw some previous reviews were positive and maybe there are good rooms in this hotel but for me it was really the worst stay ever . The room was tiny, small window overlooking a scaffolding over a dusty road, and the noise was terrible from the construction works, the maid was trying to come in everytime we were in the room, it seemed, and I have no idea why because everything looked exactly the same after she left. Same towels too. Even toilet paper- we had to ask for extra, what a scam. ....Oh yeah, to turn the aircon off or on you have to call reception every time, "how fun"..... The breakfast was okay if you like cold buffet, some sereals, yoghurt etc. A bit boring for me though. The location wasn't great, in my opinion, because it was very busy near Termini, a lot of gypsies and dusty during summer.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: NottinghamBravo
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a very good location-near the main train (termini) station. However the road is bit scary with also some building work going on. The hotel staff were very helpful and made our stay pleasant. They also gave us tips like where to eat and how to plan our day, where to withdraw cash etc. The breakfast was very good and had good variety. However we were given room in an another building(about 50 mtrs down the road from the hotel building) we had to travel to the main hotel every morning to have the breakfast. We were told that all the rooms had bath but our room had a small shower!!

Reviews.Title: “Not what it promised”
Reviews.Author: folfox
Reviews.Content: Great location. Near termini so trips from airport and metro access readily available. Should not be 3 stars. Can get same value from a lot 2 stars hotels near Termini. Arrived early from transatlantic flight. Although check in is at 1:30, room was not ready until 2pm. Confortable couches in the main hall to snore at leisure. Internet not working. TV not working. Safe box could only be opened with a knife (according to staff, door was too "heavy" for the box...) Of course, I had to take the two elevators down to get the knife as it was all my fault that I decided to use the safe. Breakfast was included but coffee was far from good. It is hard to make bad coffee in Italy but they achieved it. If you want an overpriced 2 star hotel, this is for you. If you want a good 3 star hotel...please stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Reiseglad77
Reviews.Content: Only 3 minutes from Termini where the airport train terminate and the major interchange for public transport i Rome. Great location for sightseeing and visiting Rome. The interior is in traditional style and it makes comfortable. The hotel was recently reburbished with modern elevator. The room was airly and had a good size, but we had some problems with the temperature so it was warm during the nights. Some noice from the street by night, but it's hardly to find quiet areas in Rome. On the other hand the breakfast was poor. We were not used to eat sweety cakes for the breakfast so we found the breakfast not that great. The staff were friendly and polite. We paid around 95 Euros per night per room. Maybe the price a little bit high compare what we get??

Reviews.Title: “A great holiday headquarters”
Reviews.Author: metalsnake
Reviews.Content: Rome is too marvelous for words and for it to reveal its wonders, a traveller needs a good starting point. This hotel fits the bill. Unpretentious, clean(the only place in the world apart from home that my wife's allergy did not flare up),excellent location, friendly staff, generous rates, excellent access to public transport, away from tourist traps. If you were like me ,that just needs a place to keep your luggage in, a place to sleep and feel perfectly safe in a strange city... stay in this hotel and roam Rome when you wake up. But if you are the fuzzy type, go somewhere else. If you have the chance to moan and whine about this hotel, it just means that you are staying in your room too much and missing out on the great city that you were supposed to explore!

Reviews.Title: “Needs work.”
Reviews.Author: FrugalFly
Reviews.Content: We got a two bedroom suite on 1st floor, room 112, an upgrade from the normal double. It's right next to the breakfast room, also the street and construction, so don't get it if you plan to sleep in. There is constant construction and work being done in and around the hotel, which appears to be the case in all of Rome. We didn't mind as we were early risers. The in-room safe and minibar were broken, and the windows are part of wooden doors with no seals to block sound or prevent heat and cold transfer, so the AC was always on. They never fix anything in the hotel, I heard constant complaints about problems in rooms at the front desk, and they just talk, but do not act. We were told there were many broken safes in hotel, and yet they don't repair them. One bathroom bulb never got changed in three nights. We had NO PHONE in our room. Also, don't leave your key at the front desk, as a previous reviewer was right about constant change in workers and lax policies. The breakfast was very simple, some good pastries, but room-temp milk, horrid coffees and juices from machines. Also, just white bread with butter or jam, no toaster. The workers are on auto-pilot and will throw away whole plates of food when you step away to refill your coffee -- completely clueless, but very nice and friendly. Same service in room, they do a good job cleaning, but will throw away soap even though we are staying -- no coordination/organisation in this hotel, very wasteful. Our bathroom was good and big, with adjustable shower head, but slow drainage. There was no phone, and the room was very plain with bad paint. Good tv. As for location, the hotel is very close to Termini station (transport hub of Rome) so you can get anywhere. Lastly, the wi-fi internet is super slow, in fact useless, and they actually have the nerve to charge you for it, so you'll need to use internet cafes (like at the station). Safe location, but anywhere in Rome is safe, lots of police presence and not too much crime anyway. Also, bring a US plug adapter as there are only euro 3-post outlets. On a side note, most of the employees are from eastern europe, Russia or Ukrain maybe. Overall, this is a 2 star hotel. Nice lobby, pleasant workers, good cleaning, good bathroom, good beds, good location. However, constant noise and construction, no views anywhere (near station), mediocre breakfast, many broken things with no repair, unresponsive front desk and management.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok.”
Reviews.Author: animaltown
Reviews.Content: Nice place. Big room. Friendly staff. Close to the city. Close to train from airport. Very hard bed. Clean. Breakfast was almost ok - there was a lot with a lot of sugar.

Reviews.Title: “Closed on arrival, so no Welcome at all”
Reviews.Author: ChrissieWirral
Reviews.Content: Booked in from 19th - 21st September - weekend break. Arrived outside hotel - number 7 in road according to directions, to discover it was boarded up. Enquiries in hotel next door explained it had been closed for two weeks. We had not been notified of this. As it happened to be pouring with rain - we sat in another hotel lobby - noticed another few parties in similar situation and phoned expedia but struggled to get through. Priced a few hotels, and went to the a bookshop, equivalent of Waterstones, got a coffee and tried phoning again. Phoned England to ask someone to phone for us - but they wouldn't speak to anyone other than us. However, we did manage to get through, and they phoned us back and sorted us out a 4 star hotel the Best Western Mondiale at no extra cost for inconvenience so okay in the end. rest of our review and experience of Rome will be against that hotel. However - will mention that it did actually pour down with rain all day on the Friday - hadn't expected it in September. Bought umbrellas after from opportune sellers at Termini station and all round city - they asked 5 euros - we offered 3 - and they accepted. They were only good enough to get us through the day - but they did the job. Absolutely torrential all day, however absolutely glorious on Saturday - talk about extremes!

Reviews.Title: “great close to transportation”
Reviews.Author: barbwinegarden
Reviews.Content: It was a nice hotel with very friendly staff. The rooms were a good size. We love the old lift it was different to use and it added a certain charm to the hotel. It was so close to transportation it made it easy to get around the city. The area was not scary at all.I was out until 2am with my seventeen year old daughter and never felt unsafe. The breakfast was boring but we liked this hotel

Reviews.Title: “staff to be educated”
Reviews.Author: pengemex
Reviews.Content: Great location. We booked two rooms. They forgot to tell us that there was renovation going on in the hotel. Works were being made next to one of the rooms, so we complained. They gave another room (with a broken bed) which was in another building about 10 minutes walking, so our company was separated, but we could meet in the mornings as the other building did not provide breakfast so guests had to come to the main building to eat. The hotel has a very old elevator which is not working properly most of the time. I do not recommend the place for older travellers or people with physical disabilities. The reception personnel needs a big training both for English and politeness, they are not rude but leave their area for long periods of time (so guests must wait for their keys a lot) and also do not push themselves to solve problems. Rooms are clean though.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us!!1”
Reviews.Author: nikithegreat
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at this hotel for 5 days and returned on the 15th August. We were, like im sure many people reading this are, a tad concerned about what we would find at this hotel. We are both open minded about what we were going to be faced with though, bearing in mind we didnt pay much for the holiday. Upon arrival, we found the staff to be friendly and helpful and we had a great room on the first floor. it was clean and fairly cool. the air con was on and at one point we did ask for it to be turned down (the temperature) which i dont think was ever done but i cant complain at all, it was large enough for us, a great bathroom and tv. The breakfast wasnt great but (and this will be a running theme in my review) what do you really expect for the price?? any food was good enough for us! i it is also in a great location, as long as you are happy to stroll through the city streets then every attraction is accessable and if not, the metro is two minutes away. We even used the local buses to get to the catacombes so dont pay stupid pric es to get there, its just a rip off! the restaurants around the hotel are pleasent as long as you are aware that you pay ALOT of money for waiter service (we once paid £15.00 for a pint and a vodka and coke!!) but just use some savvy and you will find plenty of great restaurants and bars around. anyway, you will find this hotel a great place to stay as long as you live by the motto "you get what you pay for". It was clean and pleasent and in a great location and unless you want to sit in your room all day, a great place to rest your weary legs at nite before the great days sightseeing the next day! enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice!”
Reviews.Author: EveryoneLovesRaymond
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights and we were pleasantly surprised! Great location 2 minutes from train station and stop for open top tour bus. It took about 20 minutes to walk to the Trevi fountain and Spanish Steps and many restaurants and shops. Hotel was spotless and had lovely marble floors and a lot of character. Loved the old-fashioned lift too! Very friendly and helpful staff. The only problem was the very poor breakfast buffet.limited choice and disgusting coffee! It's better to go around the corner and have a cappucino, OJ and croissant for 6 euros. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Awful Customer Service, Not Worth Your Money”
Reviews.Author: nina045
Reviews.Content: This was the most expensive yet the worst hotel we stayed at in Italy. The staff barely spoke English and would not help fix any of the problems we brought up, such as lack of internet connectivity and issues with the safety box in our room. After a very frustrating experience of trying to connect to the internet, they offered us champagne, and we were excited about the 'nice gesture' only to be charged for it upon checkout. Rooms are small, but that's to be expected for European standards. Location is close to the train station, but rather a long walk to fun parts of town or the monuments. Overall, a big disappointment and you're better off staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Some good, some bad...”
Reviews.Author: MJRPA
Reviews.Content: I am very conflicted on how to review this hotel. My wife and I stayed there for 8 nights earlier this month. To borrow from earlier reviews, the best format will be in pros and cons: Pros --The room and bathroom were clean and tidied up nicely each day when we returned from our travels. --The hotel is very convenient to the metro, which is a two minute walk from the hotel front if you turn right and take an immediate left and cut through the neighboring piazza. --I am not sure if it is different in July, but we did not experience the same "issues" others spoke of on air conditioning. Our room was set to 25 C which translates to 77 F. This may not be freezing like some people keep their homes, but it is certainly not uncomfortable. Cons --The breakfast is simply awful. Juices and coffee come from a machine and the coffee in particular is undrinkable. This is coming from a certified coffee addict. Some freeze-dried Taster's Choice would have been better (anyone get the reference?). You are better off going down the corner and spending 5-6 Euro on a couple espressos and pastries. --The staff is unbelievably rude. As an American, I often despise our customer service-oriented culture. However, I came to find that when at our hotel I was missing that service. I kept thinking, "am I not paying you for this experience?" The breakfast staff looked miserable, the maids looked at you with a mixture of skepticism and disdain and the front desk...the most important part...was flat-out rude. The most comical experience was when we checked out. The front desk clerk, a blond woman who's name for the life of me I cannot remember, asked if we had anything from the minibar. I explained we had one water and promptly handed her a 5 Euro bill. She thrusted change in to my hand and turned away. I stood there for a couple seconds in awkward silence waiting for a thank you or receipt of some kind for our 8 night stay. She looked up about a minute later, miffed at why I was still there. I asked if there was anything else I needed to do to check out and she issued a terse "No!" and turned away again. So let me get this straight. I just spent hundreds of dollars at your establishment over the course of 8 nights, never complained about anything or asked for any assistance the whole time I was there. This is how I get treated? I wasn't expecting a red carpet exit, just simple manners. I guess the service in the States isn't so bad after all! --The only negative about the cleanliness of the room was the bed comforter, which was stained and had a strange smell. It was clear that it had not been cleaned recently and was not changed between guests. Of course it was summer and we didn't even need to use it...this may be an issue in cool months! --The hotel is noisy and I took a previous reviewer's advise and wore ear plugs. You can hear people in rooms around you and the traffic/construction is deafening from 6:45am onward. One happy morning it sounded as if a construction crew was throwing scrap metal down several stories in to a metal bin. I was almost ready to look for a bomb shelter! --The hotel offers a "wake-up" service on their in-room television. This is comical and you have to see it to believe it. You set the time you want to wake up. When that time arrives, the tv turns on at a barely audible decibel level for less than two seconds. It then goes to a blue screen and falls silent. Suffice it to say, unless the tv is sitting suspended above you an inch or two while you are sleeping, this is not a wake-up service! On that note... --There is no alarm clock in the room and utilize the front desk for wake-up calls at your peril. We asked for one 4 times over the course of our 8 nights and only received a 50% success rate. I strongly suggest you purchase a 12-13 euro travel alarm clock at the Kodak store a couple blocks away or have a watch with an alarm function. The last thing you need is to miss your flight home because the afore-mentioned "splendid" staff forgot to wake you up! All in all, a wonderful experience in Rome and I guess this hotel has two stars for a reason. I was a little surprised by how well it was reviewed and that was the main reason why we booked there. Would I recommend it? If you are planning to utilize the Metro (believe me, you really should as it is an invaluable way to tour Rome) then yes. If not, pick somewhere else. What the hotel does not tell you is that if you do plan to walk, it is uphill on the way back in all directions you choose to come. This makes for an interesting trek after a long day of sightseeing. I hope this review helps!

Reviews.Title: “Good value with just minor problems”
Reviews.Author: Diego_W
Reviews.Content: A good surprise when we arrived was that the room and bathroom were bigger that in any other 3 star we have stayed in Italy. The room was facing the street and there is no double glaze window so there was a tolerable street noise that did not prevent us from sleeping soundly. The room was clean, only problem was the supposedly queen size bed which was in fact two singles joined. They kept separating all the time which was a little unconfortable. You should know that the hotel is not within walking distance to the main attractions, but I already knew that, and preferred to be closer to Termini for better transportation choices. The area is very safe during the day but a bit deserted at night and the walk between Termini and Reppublica should be avoided. At night is better to approach the hotel from via Cavour or Nazionale and not from Piazza Repubblica. Regarding breakfast, I can see why some might dislike it, but we are used to continental so it was more than ok for us. The old elevator is a problem if your are in a hurry and in the upper floors, but it works. All in all, a bit expensive for what it is, but that is a problem of the whole city.

Reviews.Title: “Its okay”
Reviews.Author: dominomags
Reviews.Content: 5mins from train station which is good as taxi's are expensive. Good welcome at reception - Sylvia was excellent and gave us pleny of infomation. Breakfast not our style at all. Very sweet cakes and doughnuts and no bread and terrible coffee - Yuk!although the juice was good. Our room had no outlook and was in the 'new' back area of the building. It was also tiny, bed firm but comfy but pillow's like boards and we asked 2 days running for an extra one but it didn't appear. The bathroom was very nice with lots of hot water and nicely appointed. By the way there are 2 lifts in the building. One from the reception and one down the hall through the door near the bar which is not a real bar, just a nice dresser with some bottles on it and we didn't see anyone actually having a drink. The reception was quite nice with old style Italian couches and chairs and quite comfortable in the air con to sit and have a read before heading out. We stayed 3 days and thought it was okay but too expensive for what it is.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location by Train Station in Rome”
Reviews.Author: jdturn
Reviews.Content: This is a very old hotel but very clean and well restored. It's only about 2 blocks from the Train station which made it easy to walk to from there with luggage. If you like walking you could also get to all the major attractions fairly easily by foot. The Vatican was a bit far but still possible to walk to. Free breakfast was average and consistent with other hotels. But they need to get rid of the push button, automated espresso machine, it's just not the same. But close by are espresso bars. The hotel has an elevator I'm sure the Emporers of Rome once used! Ok, maybe not that old but it was functional. The staff at the desk spoke good English and were ok with the exception of Sylvia who was really very excellent! She gave the best service, even smiled, and had a great sense of humor too! Others at the desk were very professional too but didn't seem too happy at their job. We stayed here our first night in Italy and again passing through during the middle of our trip for 2 more nights. It was nice knowing what to expect the second time there and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Keep Looking!”
Reviews.Author: batchelorette1
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a small room with a tiny shower, no a/c in May (hot and humid), construction across the street, rain echoed in the area outside my window, terrible selection for breakfast (doughnuts, sweet, sugary things, terrible coffee), shabby lobby area, no wifi available, “dodgy” area of town, very nice front desk staff (but failed to secure a reservation for the Vatican, but didn’t tell us!), clean bathroom, shower ran out of hot water and shut off to a dribble from time to time. There was one tiny, very ancient elevator (my bag nearly didn't fit through the doorway), plus some initial stairs to climb to reach the elevator. This was definitely the worst stop of our entire 2-week vacation in Italy. There's no way this place deserves three whole stars!

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Alison014
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Welcome Residences for one night in June. We arrived on the overnight train from Zurich and found the hotel very easily. We were worried as we heard that the area around the train station was not very safe and full of gypsys and pickpockets, but we did not have any problems. The hotel was a 5 minute walk from the station. We arrived early and were unable to check in until 2pm, but the front desk staff was very helpful. They gave us a map of the city and highlighted the main tourist points for us. We were allowed to check our baggage in the baggage room and head out to explore the city. When we checked in, we were pleasantly surprised. After reading some of the reviews, we were fairly nervous about what we were going to get. They did mention that it was a "new room", so it might be an idea to request that before checking in. It was a large room with plenty of storage areas. The bathroom looked new and was very clean. The bed was comfortable enough, a little on the firm side though. As far as the no hot water complaint, we are unable to comment as we only showered during "off-peak" periods. For the money we paid, $150CAD, this hotel was good value for the money compared to other Rome hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Glad we did't cancel”
Reviews.Author: paul075
Reviews.Content: Dates From 15/06/08 To 22/06/08. So glad we didn't cancel with Welcome Residences, after reading reviews just before we were due to go we began trawling the net again but thought better of it mainly because of the extra money & having to be out of the centre. We arrived early found the hotel very easily. The receptionist was very helpful-explained the ins & outs of the hotel, gave us a map & told us how long it would take us to walk to various attractions. Then shown us where we could leave our bags until our room was ready. This was an ideal time for us to get our bearings & grab a coffee & something to eat. Went back to the hotel about 1:30 in the afternoon & the room was ready. We were on the 5th floor facing the Termini. The room was very pleasant & spotless & the en-suite was the same, there was space to tidy our bags waay & drawers if needed to put stuff away. Yes there is road noise but remember you are in the middle of Rome next to a very busy bus & train station. Breakfast is very Italian but if you want bacon & eggs you have to pay extra. Coffee is really bad but yogurt & fruit juice was enough for us until we stopped for lunch. My wife & I only took the tube once to the beach-WOW! Really worth a day out only 1 Euro & a 1 hour trip. We walked to all of the other attractions. St Peter's Square about half an hour. All in all Welcome Residences is a 3Star Hotel spotlessly clean friendly staff Central to everything & just what you need on a city break. Thank you all the staff for a great week.

Reviews.Title: “off to a bad start...”
Reviews.Author: deejay30
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel from 7th-1th may. our flight got into rome late evening, so when we arrived at the hotel (about 10pm) we threw our bags in the room (in an adjoining block) and went out for dinner. by the time we came back, after having a lovely late night stroll to the colisseum (approx. 3/4 mile away), it was almost 1am- so it was too late in the night to complain about our room, as we had just discovered was well below the standard we expected. it became apparent that the room had been newly renovated, but it also became increasingly obvious to our dismay that the room was unfinished and we had been shoved into this room before it was actually ready to accomodate guests. the toilet seat was missing, there was wire hanging out of the wall in the shower room. there was very poor ventilation and certainly no sign of any air con system. the bed (was the typical two singles pushed together) was actually like a fold out camp bed with a very thin firm mattress, that was impossible to sleep on. there were no furnishing in the room other than a couple of lamps, which didn't work. i could have cried that night if i had not been so tired. i could have coped with all this and not complained, but the final straw came about 7am when loud banging started both above and below our room. there were obviously workmen on the roof and in the apartments below us. we complained at breakfast time, and the staff were very dismissive. in response to my comments about the room not being finished, the recpetionist replied, oh some rooms are just like that. and about the workmen she retorted, well there is work going on on the roof, you know you need to expect some noise in rome. she made a bit of joke about where she could move us next that would not be noisy! as she did not want us complaining again! after a few hours, we got into another room and i must say it was great, really lovely and decorated with tapestries, complete contrast to the other room! the breakfast was ok, it was extrememely sugary, and no meat or cheese at all. the old lift was very special, we had no problems with it breaking down, which i'm glad about as we were on the 5th floor. the staff were very dismissive of ourselves and others,- we found it quite amusing to overhear some of their remarks- 'we can fix anything except the hot water, do not expect hot water in the mornings' (this was true, lots of hot water mid morning and later in the day!). an american couple were complaing that they were unable to receive BBC on their tv, but another couple they were travelling with could get it on their tv- the receptionists repsonse' oh they are just lucky that is all!' overall, we got off to a bad start, in a dodgy unfinished room, but luckily it was sorted quickly and did not spoil our trip at all. the reception staff weren't the most helpful, but the location was great and very easy for getting buses or the underground. i would recommend this to others as long a they are prepared to stand firm with the staff if they need to!!

Reviews.Title: “Could be so much better...”
Reviews.Author: PallasParis
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in June 2008 in this hotel and the basic feeling is "this could be one of the best hotels in Rome with so little imrovement!". If the owners cared a bit, just to ask their stuff to be more friendly and more discreet (yelling, banging the doors, etc in the corridors, never a smile in the breakfast room, incompetence or looking down at you at the reception by some), etc. If they could improve on easy things like the breakfast, the noisy guests, the rain-dependance of the TV reception, the hot water provision (all you read before is true), they'd have one of the best hotels in Rome because the location is excellent, the building very nice and the room we had overlooked the courtyard and was large, quiet (except for the people's noise!), clean and beautifully furnished. It has a mini-bar, a large shower, and air-conditioning which you should know is turned on and off solely by contacting the reception! Another issue: contrary to what our reservation with booking.com said there is no free internet wireless anywhere but in the room you can have cabled internet for 4 Euros an hour. So, we'd like very much to go back to this hotel hoping the owners have read the reviews here, that they care enough to have improved on these features.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: frogger19
Reviews.Content: Hotel rooms were lovely and comfortable most of the staff were friendly and helpful, however we arrived to 2 days of cold water far 2 cold for showering, not good when you have been sightseeing all day. We were offered a change to another part of the hotel about 5 mins walk which had hot water but no safety deposit box or security. We decided we would stay put as we did not feel comfortable in the other building. The water did warm up slightly but still no way near warm enough to have a good wash. Breakfast was very poor with very very limited selection 3 pastries and 1 bread 2 cereals. would stay again due to the location but would definately look at other hotels first of all this would be out last choice!! Close to termini station and perfectly located for the open top buses but let themsleves down due to the water situation.

Reviews.Title: “OOer..i've been to better..alot better”
Reviews.Author: Sandylaner
Reviews.Content: Positives. - 5/6 minutes from the terminus station. The room was very clean and the maids did a tidy job of making the beds after we raced away; looking forward to being ovverawed by the incredible arcchitecture and delectable gastronomic delights of Rome. We Loved the archaic lift, - a wooden glass pannelled lift from yesteryear, creaking and groaning as it hoisted you via straining pulleys into the air. and the ermm..ermm....struggling now..err..The sheets were clean and the TV had some English news channels...but i'm afraid for me - that's it!! I've only ever written good reports on here but this hotel has booked the trend. This hotel - a new experience - but poor one. I've been alll over Europe and I have to say this is the worst hotel i've been in for the price! cost was about £110 euros a night. The hotel has potential becaise the reception and rooms are fairly nice but its let down by extremely lax customer service. The staff were miserable and unhelpful. We asked for extra pillows as the ones they provided were to thin. Like soft sacks with balls of wool inside. 4 phone calls later we got the extra pillows for us to come down and collect (she couldnt leave reception!).. No hot water for three days. (barely lukewarm) The air conditioning could only be manipulated from reception. The room controls were only operable from the main computer downstairs. Bit of a pain ringing up to keep asking to turn it off - this after the water from the air con drips on your forehead as you try to sleep/ In addition to it rattling too loudlly stopping you from fully drifting off into slumberland. No welcome pack or information in room! Buy your guides and city onfo prior to booking in. The hotel itself doesnt provide much info at all regarding things to do, see or go. No tea or coffee in room. Very average breakfast. No meats or cheese. Just yoghurts,doughnuts,cakes, cornflakes or coco-pops yoghurt and a coffee from an 'orrible vending machine. The listed building wooden framed windows struggled to repel any noise from outside and easily yielded to the local workmans drill and early footsteps from hotel leavers. Sorry to be negative....but this is my experience hope you have a better one if you pick this hotel.It didn't spoinl my holiday becasue visiting Rome is an encredible experience and well makes up for a god awful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not what promised”
Reviews.Author: BobSpring
Reviews.Content: Their website promised air conditioned public areas and air conditioned rooms. Both of these statements were untrue. We arrived around the 24th of May and found our room temperature to be hovering around 85F. None of the public areas were A/C'ed. After numerous complaints to the staff I was informed that the a/c's on the roof were turned off. They advised they needed special permission to turn them on. They finally advised that our ac was on but our room never got below 81F. I requested some fans but was refused. No internet, the elevator was broken and I had to carry my luggage down 3 flights of stairs on the date of our departure because the bellboy did not come in until 7:30AM. This hotel is a joke and if it were not located so close to the bus and train station I don't think it would stay in business.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ajudes
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Welcome Residences, May 12-18, 2008. It is a basic hotel! One of the websites I consulted about it gave it a 2 star rating and I believe that is accurate. Whereas minimum money has been put into the decor & furniture of individual rooms, oddly they have placed gold painted furniture randomly around the common areas. The beds are cot like & quite firm, as are the pillows. The bath has a shower wand, but no curtain so it can not be used as a shower as such. There are no towel racks or hooks, so no place to hang towels. Our room was on the 6th floor. It had a long narrow window which did not allow much fresh air in. Being on the top floor, the room heated up considerably. Two days it was 27 degrees celsius (80 degrees)! There was no way to turn the air conditioner on, no fan, & little ventilation. It surely made sleeping difficult. I'd read about the noise, so we slept with ear plugs and that solved the noise problem. The breakfast was also basic. It consisted of cereal, croissants, donuts, breakfast cake, yogurt, & mystery juice & coffees out of machines. The bad coffee seems to be a main disappointment of most guests. As for the positives of this hotel: We loved the antique elevator which rose out of the center of the building. It is truly an antique & charming. The room, although tiny & hot, was clean & freshly painted.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Kazza78
Reviews.Content: Our room was very large with a Balcony. It could be quite noisey - but then you are in the centre of Rome, so what would you expect. For the money you pay and its a 3 star hotel I am surprised the other people reviewing this hotel expected anything else. Yes there was only 1 pillow and not many TV channels - but is that really what you come to Rome for. The location of the hotel was excellent and the staff were lovely. The breakfast wasn't great (but OK) and could get extremely busy around 8:30/9 am. So go early if you can. But again its good value for money. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ugghhhh.No hot water..”
Reviews.Author: PaulD08
Reviews.Content: My wife and selected this hotel based on the reviews on this website. The location is great just a short walk from the Termini train station. We arrived at 1130 am and they held our luggage while we began our last day of a three week European vacation. We stayed here as the final stopping place before flying out the following day. The room was nice and very large, actually a suite. However, that is where the good part comes to an end. There was no hot water. I brought it to their attention and they indicated they would do something about it. The following morning still no hot water. The bathroom also smelled like sewage!! The night we stayed Rome defeated Milan in a soccer match so a lot of vehicle horns all night. That was just a bad break for us. The night manager was unable to instruct us on how to use the internet!! In three weeks in the Greek islands, Sicily, the Amalfi coast, this was the worst hotel we stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare at Check In Be Warned”
Reviews.Author: messianic7
Reviews.Content: Be aware at check in. My wife and I arrived at the hotel at around 2:00 PM and was told that our room would not be ready until about 5 PM. Our reservation said 1 PM but we had touring to do so we took off. We were not told that our room would be in a different location evidently they own rooms at other sites. We came back at about 7 PM and told that our room was in your facility on Republic DeNational and that it would be simple to find. I was given a map and told that there was no one who could escort me to our room. I spent over an hour looking for the building. There was no signage and the instructions by the clerk was not clear. With my luggage I walked back to the hotel to get better directions. I tried once again and got to the correct building but there were two or three different hotels in that building none of them ever heard of Welcome Home Residences and there was nothing on the building that mentioned anything about the hotel or studios. I went back again and this time I told him I wouldn’t go again looking for some place that I couldn’t find. He offered to pay a cab this time to take me, but the cab driver couldn’t find it either. After four hours and four attempts I found the Apartment. The apartment was ok and it was a great location but impossible to find by myself. If there is no one to take you to the place don't stay there. You will never find it. We spent 3 nghts there and other then the firrst night it was satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “Very cheap - but a step too far?”
Reviews.Author: 121travel
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Residences is certainly good value, and far from uncomfortable - but it may be a step too far for the average traveller. The hotel was cheap, and very convenient, being situated right next to Termini station. Despite being quite close to some major roads the room wasn't noisy at all during the night. The staff were helpful, and spoke good English. The room was nicely decorated, a good size and had a very comfortable bed. I didn't even realise breakfast was included, so it was a bonus, but if you had realised and were expecting it you may well find it a bit underwhelming. Croissants, yoghurt and a bit of cereal - but the coffee/juice was pretty terrible and the dining area itself was pretty packed and noisy. Key point for us though was the lack of hot water during peak times. Now again this wasn't a complete disaster as you could always go back for a siesta and a shower in the heat of the day, but wasn't ideal. Such a shame as well, because otherwise the Welcome Residences would make the ideal place to stay for travellers looking for comfort on a tight budget. P.S. While we were staying there (May 2008) the hotel was being renovated. Would definitely see if you can get a newly renovated room if booking - ours was and it was lovely, plus it didn't cost any more.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Segs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel due to the good reviews that we read and we were not disappointed. The location is excellent. Just around the corner from the Termini and metro. (once you get off the bus, you need to walk through the station to the other side, turn right, then second left after 150 yards, turn right at next junction and hotel is just up on your left - two green plants outside). We found the staff to be very helpful. Our room was small (converted roof space) but it had recently been refurbished and was acceptable for the time we were in it. We had running hot water at all times (perhaps they have sorted out the problem!). I agree with the comments about breakfast, you can only eat so many doughnuts! but the coffee etc was good. The problem with the lift is that people do not close the doors properly and the lift will not work if both doors are not closed properly. We also brought the Terravision coach tickets before we went. When we landed we were met with 200+ people trying to get onto 2 coaches. A Tip - across from the terminal there are buses that do exactly the same route as Terravision for only 6 euros and they seem to be more frequent. It is a good 45 minutes on the bus to get from the airport to the termini. If you use the Terravision to return to the airport you should allow approx 3 hours and be prepared that if you turn up and the bus is full you will have to wait for the next one..and they are not always just around the corner. We booked out Vatican tour through www.myvaticantour.com and the tour was 3 hours long and bypassed all the queues but the majority of the tour was in the museum, ok if you are really into art. We also booked the colosseum tour through www.mycolosseumtour.com and this was also 3 hours long and was excellent, the guide was very entertaining. I would definately recommend booking these tours before you leave as they were fully booked when people tried to book when they arrived and the queues are very very long. I would not recommend a couple of restaurants near to the hotel -Smeraldo (via Principe Amedeo) behind the hotel - frozen pasta etc & Ristorante Terme di Diocleziano (roof terrace), at the end of street - very overpriced and not particulary good food. The cafe bar at the end of the room however was good for a drink & pizza.

Reviews.Title: “happy with welcome residences”
Reviews.Author: stozy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just spent three nights at the welcome residences and were generally happy overall. They put us in the 'next door block' and i was sure we would be back down to request a change of rooms as my wife does not like to be short changed. The girl on reception politely gave us detaled info on hotel and then the young man showed us to our room, he did not have to but this was typical of their friendliness.The room was newly refurbished and delightful, needless to say we stayed in it! The lift was a relic but always worked and did not get busy. Breakfast was as you would expect in europe, tasty pastries and decent coffee. The one problem we encountered was the noisy delivery men at 6.30am. Location is a couple of streets away from termini and was not affected at all. termini is not a den of evil as we thought it might be but just a tourist and city traveller hub.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: clare2521
Reviews.Content: After reading the others reviews, which were mixed, we decided to give it a go. What a huge mistake! All the bad reviews are right. The water is cold in the mornings, the breakfast is for kids, all sweet doughnuts and pastries and as for the coffee machine, might as well of drunk the dirty dish water. How hard could it be to of made fresh coffee and tea in the morning and have the many rude and unfriendly hotel staff that were milling around the breakfast room serve it to you. We avoided this noisey cramped room after the first try and took breakfast round the corner in the small and much more friendly cafe. Our room was on the ground floor, with a view to die for - check out the picture! It was nosiey and cold, bed sheets were dirty, curtains dirty and falling down and we both got flea bites from the beds. Big tip, take off the bed covers before you sit down on them as these are definetly not washed regulary. We asked to change rooms and were told to speak to reception the next morning, which we did and were met with blank faces and "sorry nothing we can do". Needless to say we spent as little time in the room as we possibly could. Hotel is right near the delightful Termini area, not somewhere you want to be walking around late at night if you are single girls. Final gripe was that they took the liberty of charging my credit card before I had even checked out, I did not authorise them to do this as I had wanted to pay cash, when I asked them to put the money back on the card, they said again, "sorry nothing we can do". What a complete lie! Reception were either rude or far too friendly, one even suggesting some extra curriculem activity in our room - if you get my meaning!! Not impressed with this hotel at all and being a travel agent myself I feel very embarrased to of made such a bad decision in booking it and even worse for paying over €150 a night. As the title goes AVOID AT ALL COSTS!

Reviews.Title: “Great base for exploring Rome”
Reviews.Author: Oasisgirl80
Reviews.Content: Compared to other hotels in the area of similar standard this is good value. Room was spotlessly clean and comfortable. We booked a twin room, and in addition to the bedroom there was a small lounge area with sofa, table and mini bar which made it more spacious. Excellent location - you can walk to most of the main sites in Rome (and its worth doing so as there is so much to see on the way) but it's also really convenient for the metro. Reception staff helpful and friendly and speak excellent English. The only negative was the breakfast - if you get the opportunity, book room only. Horrible machine coffee, sugary fruit juice and stale cake! Don't let this deter you from staying here though - just walk to the termini station where you can get excellent coffee and fresh croissants in one of the many cafes.

Reviews.Title: “mostly good!”
Reviews.Author: unknownis
Reviews.Content: Great location - 200 meters from termini station - within walking distance of all the major attractions apart from the Vatican. Staff was helpful, provided us with hot water to heat up our baby's food (as there were no tea and coffee facilities in the rooms) and provided us with a crib for the baby. Only bad points were the lift was very temperamental, quite a way to walk up 4 floors when it wasn't working. The showers were cold throughout the day. Breakfast was basic - croissants, bread and cereal. The room was spacious and clean. Would recommend the hotel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Expected Better”
Reviews.Author: weemurph
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights over Easter. I was expecting this hotel to be really nice after reading the reivews on tripadvisor but we were disappointed. The directions on the website were terrible, the hotel is only a 2 minute walk from termini station but it took us ages to find it. The staff were lovely and we were shown to our room which was not in the main building but next door with a separate entrance. The room was basic but fine except for a drain smelling in the bathroom, which we did complain about but nothing was done. There was also no hot water any morning to have a shower, which we also complained about, and they said they were aware of the problem but nothing could be done about it. We only ate breakfast there once but there seemed to be plenty of food such as croissants etc. We’re not usually that hard to please but for a 5 night stay in a 3 star hotel we expected a little bit more. I would not return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Amdram8
Reviews.Content: We had 4 nights at the hotel and after reading some of the other reviews were a little apprehensive but thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The room was very clean, spacious and comfortable. The water was a bit lukewarm in the mornings but at night water was hot. Breakfast was pleasant. Lots of sweet things but cereal, bread and juice too. Staff were very helpful. Great location for Metro and walking to sights. Lots of places to eat near to hotel. We ate at Trattoria Leopetti on Via Farini which was lovely. Terravision shuttle bus was great to and from the airport, we bought the tickets in England at the airport. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome Residences apartment - Not what we booked but great for us”
Reviews.Author: cdchess
Reviews.Content: My friend and I booked 2 rooms at the Welcome Residences. When we arrived the receptionist said he had one double and one single only. They seemed confused we wanted separate rooms! I sensed a double booking. However he asked us to wait 5 mins because he could offer us a 150 sq m apartment in the local area. We thought about this and were prepared to give it a go. The apartment is on Via Nationazle (slightly better locationwise) and the building has been mentioned before in a September 2007 review. However we got a massive at least 150 sq m (1600 plus sq ft) top floor apartment with three big terraces. The apartment is for six people with two double ensuite bedrooms and a room in the middle where you can layout a bed. There is also a kitchen, dining area and living room. It was very clean and other than a dodgy ironing board and iron in OK condition. Basically it was like living in a fully furnished penthouse apartment for a week. It suited us really well as we could head back from the sites and chill out with a beer in the living room and store stuff in the two fridges. The only issue with this apartment which has daily maid service is that there was a sulphurous smell when running water in one of the ensuite's. My friend who got the room, lived with it, but it was a genuine issue. There was absolutely no problem with my ensuite so we guessed they were off two different water supplies. We also walked the 5 mins to breakfast at the main hotel each morning. In conclusion, this was not what we booked but it turned out well for us.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Room, Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: JayK102
Reviews.Content: Having had to spend an excessive amount of time in our hotel room due to some freakish stormy weather over Europe this March, I can say I was very happy with the quality of this hotel. It was clean, comfortable and spacious. There were only 2 TV channels in english (MTV and Sky News) so recommend you bring a portable DVD player or something if you want to watch TV (think someone has previously mentioned this). There was hot water with good pressure for most of the day, boiling hot on some evenings! I know others have commented otherwise on this, so I guess it must be pretty intermittent. Nice convienient easy to operate free safe in our rooms as well. The building works are still going on so expect some noise if ur staying ur during the day. The location was perfect for getting airport transfers from the Termini (5 minutes away), good selection of restaurants close by (recommend Pastarito for any vege's heading out to Rome). The Colosseum was a nice walk away, as was many of other attractions. We walked from the Vatican up to Piazza Novona, the Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, and back to the hotel one day - thoroughly recommend walking as the best form of transport around Rome, you get to see so much more! The breakfast was very sweet, but I liked it! Sugary, Hazelnut Chocolate Donuts, Croissats, Tarts, Bread, Toast (in packets), Coffee/Tea/Hot Choc/etc, fruit juices, cereal, etc - plenty of energy food!

Reviews.Title: “would definately use it again”
Reviews.Author: mackie1963
Reviews.Content: gillian and billy, corby, england feb 23 2008 fantastic hotel, don't let anyone who gives it a bad score put you off. it was ideally situated,rooms were spacious, very clean and towels were changed every day. although it was continental breakfast, there was quite a selection of croissants and pastries. the hotel staff were very pleasant and helpful. the hotel had a fantastic feel to it and what a great elevator.overall we couldn't fault this hotel and we would definately stay at the welcome residences next time we're in rome

Reviews.Title: “Nice but no internet”
Reviews.Author: NYGella
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, good location, near train station and the service was fine. The problem was that I chose this hotel because of the Internet access in public areas – complimentary and Use of nearby fitness center (discount). I was disappointed to find out that neither were available and it is still advertised as such.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for sightseeing in Rome”
Reviews.Author: ali_c78
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Welcome Residences for 4 nights. I'd advise you to book the Terravision coach which stops at the Termini which is literally 5 mins walk to the hotel. Reception staff were very helpful and suggested places to visit. Room was very nice. Some building work going on but we knew that anyway and it didn't bother us that much as we were out during the day. The only thing I would say is that the hotel walls are very thin. This wasn't particularly good as we had some passionate italians next door who kept us awake! I would definitely go back to the Welcome hotel as value for money, not like Rome which seems very pricey compared to other cities I have travelled to.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, would stay in again”
Reviews.Author: MESchlegel3
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel, breakfast included which is nice while traveling!! Really close to the train station which is great as well. You can walk almost anywhere in Rome but your close enought to where the buses stop so you can take them as well. The floors were cold but the room was quite large. If you only speak english they only offer MTV in English, otherwise I hope you bring a dvd player. Internet is only offered in the lobby which is a bit of a hassle, would be nice to have it in the room but they said they were working on it. The front desk staff was very nice and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “go for it!”
Reviews.Author: tezwend
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have recently returned from our first visit to Rome, staying at Welcome Residences. It was everything we could have hoped for. What a pleasant surprise to stay in a hotel which had atmosphere and style, so unlike the sterile boxes one takes for granted. The locale is ideal: very near the Terminus Station and within walking distance of all the major sights. I am not exaggerating when I say this must be the cleanest hotel I've ever stayed at. Not only were the floors, bathroom, etc., spotless - but it seemed as if all the furnishings and curtains had been cleaned that very day. The breakfast was fine if you had a sweet tooth, but a slice of plain buttered toast would have been nice. The staff were not only helpful but chaming. This must be the best deal in Rome. Go for it!

Reviews.Title: “How good was our welcome”
Reviews.Author: traveller598
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 3 night stay at this hotel. Great location; we could walk to all the main sites although it is close to the trains and buses. Very helpful desk staff. The room was quiet and very clean and recently renovated - flat screen TV with sky channels and remote controlled heating and air conditioning unit which worked well. Bathroom excellent. Only slight disappointment was breakfast - Plenty of food and well presented and fresh but there were only sweet things on offer.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased with Welcome Home”
Reviews.Author: IsraelTravlingirl
Reviews.Content: Great location and no worries about the neighborhood. A 5 minute walk from either Termini Station or Republica Metro Station. Internet station one door down (cheaper than utilizing the hotel internet). The shower was strong and hot. Staff was very nice and helpful with my tourist related questions, and they have an easy-to-follow map for free. I was disappointed in the breakfast which consisted of TONS of pastry items, yogurt, cereal, and a really lousy coffee. Lovely decor, great price, and great location- I definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: AndytBeverley
Reviews.Content: Good location close to Termini (bus from airport to Termini around 30min then 5 min to hotel providing you dont get lost) You need to walk through the railway station to the other side, turn right, then second on the left after 150 yards, turn right at next junction and hotel is just up on the left) Room excellent, only negative was no hot drink making facilities) Staff friendly and despite mix up over room it was resolved quickly. 15 min walk to Collesium/ Palletine hill. We walked on Sunday on route taking in Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Ravona Piazza, Pantheon and then over the river to St Peters and the Vatican. Can all be done on foot. Recommend Ristorante Terra Di Siena in Piazza Pasquino near Piazze Ravona and the bars and restaraunts in Campo Di Fiori

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravellerOslo
Reviews.Content: My wife and me have felt in love with Rome. We have been to this lovely city a numbers of times and we have found that Rome in December is fantastic. The weather is in general good and it is not crowded. We have found it very good to be in the area of the main railway station Termini. There are a lot of hotels in this area and the prices are good. So in September we booked a trip for Rome from 3rd December until 7th December. We found this hotel on hotel.com and the price was not that bad. We found out later that the price went down via another web site. Well, you can’t win all the time. We arrived in Rome on a Monday and took a direct train to Termini. Very good! The price was 11 Euro maybe a little more than average, but the trip was good. A person contacted us at the airport and offered to drive us to the hotel for 40 Euro!! So watch up. The hotel is situated only 5 minutes walk from platform 24 where we arrived. At the front desk we were welcomed very nicely and soon after, with help from the staff, we were in the room. Well it was two rooms, one front room and the bedroom. All rooms had recently been renovated and looked very lovely. The bathroom was perfect. Big and easy to move around. We had some trouble with the sink, but when leaving one afternoon I mentioned the problem for the front desk and when we returned only a few hours later it was fixed. Very good. The breakfast at the hotel was for us good. Remember you are in Italy and they have a different breakfast than in the northern Europe. Being located so near to the main railway station this hotel is a very good starting point for exploring Rome. Remember the Chine Town of Rome is just around the corner from this hotel. A LOT of shops only a few hundreds meter away. We will recommend this hotel very much. There is a good standard on the hotel, the service is good and it is centrally situated to all the main places in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Kayleigh990
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights at the beginning of November 07. Overall we liked our stay- we had a double room on the 6th Floor which was nicely decorated and the bed was very comfortable! There was a safe in the room and mini bar which came in useful. Although the reception staff were very friendly, we were a bit disappointed as we asked for extra pillows and they didn't arrive after asking them 3 times and also, we asked for a wake up call on our last morning as we had to be up early to catch the coach the airport and we did not get it! Luckily I woke up naturally and we still made it in time but it could have been disatorous! The best thing about the hotel is its location- it is a 2 minute walk from Termini Station so if you are being dropped off at Termini station you are best walking to the hotel becuase a taxi might take you on a "scenic route"! Most of the attractions like the Trevi Fountain, Coliseum, Forum, Spanish steps are within walking distance taking about 10-15 minutes to each depending how quick you walk! The Vatican is a bit further over the River Tiber- although you could walk there (we walked back) you are best getting the hop on- hop off bus from Termini Station so you can see where all the other sites are on the way! There is also plenty of restuarants and shops near the hotel! As for Rome itself- we loved! We managed to see everything in the 2 days but would have liked to go for longer! Tip: If you are an E.U citizen, take some ID to the attractions as you can get half price admission in most of them.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight not long enough in Rome, DUH!”
Reviews.Author: pandaboys
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Bookings.com. We chose it due to closeness to Termini, price (EUR149) and no real negative reviews. We were really happy with our choice. The location was great, we easily walked everywhere we needed to in the 20 hours we had in Rome! We walked past the hotel when we arrived from the airport train and thought we'd made a mistake with the directions but we were on the right street just on the wrong side of the road. Coming from Termini the hotel is on the left side of the road, just past a corner with a small potted tree on either side of the entrance. I don't actually think it had the hotel name on the outside and we didn't take a picture of the entrance but our holiday is still a bit of blur - round the world in 32 days. The room was spacious and clean, bathroom was small and shower tiny but water pressure good and nice and hot. View out on to street was lots of fun. We had a corner room so had windows looking out onto two streets. We had no problems with traffic noise. We walked down to Forum and round Colesseum and took some night shots. Up very early (6ish) and headed out to squeeze in as much as we could before breakfast - Trevi Fountain and Spanish steps and just us taking pictures. Breakfast was fine. Good coffee, cereal, yoghurt and lots of sweet pastries and donuts. Not our kind of thing but it was good carb loading! Walked down to Colosseum and took tour and we were on our train to Venice at just after 1pm. We wouldn't hesitate to recommend the hotel to any of our friends visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Chris019
Reviews.Content: Hotel only 5 mins from main Termini station so very convenient and easy to find when you arrive. Reception staff very welcoming and spent 10 mins giving info on Rome. Lift is ancient but quite quaint. Rooms were big and very clean. Main gripe though that chest of drawers and bedside cabinets had no hadles on so could not open!! Did not affect us as we just used wardrobe but might be annoying for some. Also bathroom the smallest I have ever seen although shower was good. Breakfast was a sugarfest - certainly not to our taste. Choice of sugary cereals, sugary croissants, pastries, bread (but no toaster) but only toppings honey, nutella or jam. Even coffee (out of machine) was very sugary. Found Rome very expensive to eat out. Very long queues to get into vatican museums - good tip is to go into St Peters Sq and Basilica in the morning then go to museum in the afternoon by which time queues much reduced. Overall Welcome Residences good location and fair value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the place in spite of water problems”
Reviews.Author: BirminghamRoger
Reviews.Content: This hotel is 15 min walk from the Colosseum and Forum and about an hours walk from St Peter's, take the metro if exhausted from sightseeing. It is 5 min from the main Termini station. We loved the decor, the room and especially the antique lift from the 1930s! Our room was not in the hotel itself but a few doors away, but this was no problem. Passers by seeing us with the doorkey must have thought we lived there which was amusing! The only problem was the water supply in our room, which was variable and lukewarm at best. Other rooms seemed ok from what fellow guests told us, and most likely the problem was the renovation work going on. This apart it is a lovely hotel, as close as you need to be to the main attractions, and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location!”
Reviews.Author: LosAngelesCaligirl
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 4 nights in September 2007 and we really liked the hotel. The location is great, it's just a few minuted to walk to the main subway station so you can get around the city easily and we also took a day trip to Florence. The staff was extremely professional and our room was clean and quiet. This place is a great value for the price and very nice for the 3 star rating. Don't be put off by some of the negative reviews. We would definitely stay here again when returning to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “superb staff and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: SonOfPierre
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well situated close to sites and the train station/metro stop. It is a downtown hotel so it can be a bit noisy, but nothing worse than any other central location. The staff here made our trip. Everyone was very helpful with recommendations on what to see and where to eat. There are a lot of cafes and restaurants in the surrounding area. If you stay here or are near by you should definitely go to Alesso's -- excellent food and homemade limoncella to die for. Also in the area is Bar Washington, our worst eating experience in Italy; surly staff and lousy food, avoid it.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome Home, Roma Pass - beat my expectations Angel Tours - not great”
Reviews.Author: kelygirl
Reviews.Content: I heard that staying near the train station in Rome is kind of sketchy, however my husband and I were pleasantly surprised when we arrived. The room was average and had a smallish flat screen on the wall, lots of storage space and the bathroom was of average size with a bidet. We also had a balcony, which was nice. The bed was VERY comfortable, kind of like a tempurpedic. I would have liked to have 2 pillows each, but we also didn't ask for them. The TV is also a clock that we used for the alarm on mornings we had to wake up early. They offer body wash/shampoo combo, but no conditioner. The breakfast wasn't fantastic, but it worked. The milk for my cereal was room temperature, and they offered several types of pasteries - some were really good! The service staff was very nice. As for the location, in my opinion, it couldn't be beat! It was a block away, and with the Roma Pass that offers unlimited public transport rides, it worked out great to get to the Coloseum, Spanish Steps, Trivi Fountain, Vatican, etc. We would walk around at night and felt extremely safe. Roma Pass is fantastic - buy it at the airport as soon as you land in Rome and it covers your 30 min. train ride to the station along with public transport as I had mentioned and 2 free amusements ( we used it for the Coloseum - they have a separate line so we didn't wait a minute to get in, and the National Museum) if you were to visit other places included on the Roma Pass, I am told you also get discounts. Friday we went to the Vatican and did the Angel Tour so we were able to enter before the rest of the public. This would be great had we not waited for late tourists for the entire hour and entered as the public entered! On their website they say they'll wait for late comers, however, they do not say that they make the entire tour group wait along with them!! Big red flag in my opinion. The tour guides were very nice, and kept the group to 15 at most which was nice. They kept everything pretty light in a stuffy museum and if you're really interested in religious art, it may be worth it. It's a LONG tour - lasting 3 hours & if you're not an art enthusiast, I would definitely skip the Vatican Museum and go directly to the Basilica - which is free!!!

Reviews.Title: “Be careful when you book this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ashdale5
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived in Rome late last Thursday night having booked this hotel on recomendation from a family member who had stayed there previously. When we got to reception they checked us in and then informed us that our room was not actually in the hotel itself, but in another building "close by." A porter escorted us by foot to a building on Via Nacionale which is two or three blocks away from the hotel. To get to the room we had to first unlock a door to get to a courtyard, then unlock a gate to get to the building, then another door to get to the hallway and finally the door to the room. This meant carrying a big bunch of keys around for the entire stay as there was no reception at this building. In the room itself there was a small bathroom and a small bedroom. The view from the window, which was tiny, was the wall of another building less than ten feet away so very little light got into the room. The TV, advertised as satellite,had one channel working and even this was hazy. Worst of all, when I picked up the phone to call the hotel to see if we could be moved to another room, we discovered the phone didn't work either. Not even a dial tone on it. Rather than let this ruin our trip to Rome,we made the most of it and enjoyed our first three days of sightseeing. On our last evening we returned to the room to shower before heading out but when we attempted to leave we discovered that we were locked in. The door from the hallway to the top of the stairs had been locked from the outside and because there was no keyhole on the inside we were unable to get out. Luckily we had taken a hotel business card and rang the number on it from my mobile phone. After three fruitless conversations with the receptionist, who didn't seem to know that we were actually staying at his hotel, and a thirty minute wait, finally someone arrived to open the door for us. By this time we had run out of patience so we packed our bags to go to the main hotel buliding and request to be moved to another room. I asked the porter to wait so we could go with him to the main hotel,but when I came back with our bags he had gone. My wife and I had to drag our bags the three blocks back to the hotel at 10pm on our last night in Rome. When we got to the reception the porter who I had asked to wait for us was sitting next to the receptionist but hadn't even mentioned that we were looking to change rooms or that we were on our way. I explained to the receptionist, who was also the night manager, our issues with the room and the fact we were locked in,and that if nothing else the safety issue of having a door that could be locked from the outside was scandalous for a reputable hotel. It was very obvious from our conversation that he had never even been to the building we were staying in, never mind the room, and he kept insisting that the hotel was fully booked and there was nothing he could do about it. I asked him to call his manager and he talked to him on the phone,but the best solution they could come up with was a single room for the night. I looked at this room and there was barely enough room for one person in there. Luckily my wife had gone to the Bettoja Hotel Nord next door and they had a room available for 50 euro less than we were paying. The hotel manager insisted that I pay for my three nights stay in full which I did,simply to just get out of there. Maybe the main hotel is beautiful. Maybe the staff are friendly and courteous. Maybe the breakfast is sensational. Unfortunately I can't judge any of this because we were sent to a building three blocks away with none of the above.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Welcome Residences !”
Reviews.Author: happyhols0770
Reviews.Content: Booked for my husband's 40th birthday and had a brill time, 6 of us went so we had 3 rooms, all on different floors and each one was nicely decorated, no one mention any night time noise to me, but then we were in the middle of a city! The rooms were immaculately clean, comfy beds, they even folded your pj's! towels changed each day. Sylvia and the other staff were all lovely and told us lots of tips and places to go, etc. Fantastic location, 2 mins to the Termini station. Don't let the outside of the hotel put you off, this is a great place without the overpriced tag. Could go on about Rome, but you need to go and experience it for yourselves. Don't miss the Colosseum though and let your imagination run wild! CHOW !!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy but would stay again”
Reviews.Author: cathhughes
Reviews.Content: Loved Rome. Chose this hotel because I liked the old fashioned look of the place and when we arrived it had a lovely feel about it. Also booked it for its location near the railway station and this was excellent. As backpackers around Italy we loved the fact it was just on the parallel road to the Termi Station, but this also meant we could eat cheaply around there, use the launderette and internet rooms. Had to change rooms after the first night because of the noise of delivery vans to our hotel and one across the road from 5am. Moved to an internal room and that was lovely and quiet. Nice breakfast choice and friendly, helpful staff. We also used the Metro and I really must warn people about pickpockets on the Metro. I know we are all aware of it, but you would not believe how fast and easily they steal your wallets. We saw one case that was 2 little innocent looking 10 year old girls who had done it. Luckily in both our case and the above one both wallets were dropped onto the floor in the chaos that arose. Please be careful. Fantastic very nice and cheap place to eat - was a Chinese restaurant just behind the Opera House Theatre by the Station. Lots of local Chinese people eat there and we went 2 nights and had lovely meals. Great iced coffees available in the "News Cafe" between Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps. No service charge for sitting out on the street tables. Watch out for 40% service charges in some places. Collaseum and Vatican - Must get there really early. We arrived at 9 am and queued in both places. Vatican - in the end we paid 45E each and went on a brill guided tour around the Vatican and St Peter's Cathedral. Also paid for 24 hours on an open top tour bus. Great value for money. Ear plugs provided for you to listen to the onboard commentary. Have a wonderful time in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: jessBexleyheath
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the welcome. After reading a variety of reviews about the property and the price that we paid i was a little apprehensive. The hotel had a brilliant location and was central for all travel and many attractions. Couldnt fault the hotel at all and the staff were very friendly and approachable. Would definitly return to the welcome on any future trips to rome. For the price we paid i had extra money for SHOPPING, EATING AND DRINKING! Which were all excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Ok Until!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jadam35
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews about this Hotel before my trip to Rome and was impressed so booked online to stay there. When we arrived the staff were fantastic and offered advice on all our enquiries, from what to do, to restaurants. Our room was Ok, although the air con didnt work, the door pushed open without the key and there was some minor damage to furniture etc. (scuffs on walls, marks on furniture) Most of this is expected in budget hotel rooms (apart from the door) so overall we were impressed. Great mini bar too. I asked for the door to be fixed 4 times for security reasons, and after 4 days it was. However when we returned to the Hotel on our 4th day we were told that when they fixed the door they noticed some damage to a set of drawers. (the marks that were there when we arrived) I explained this was already there to them and one of the staff said not to worry, explain this to the manager who would be in the next morning - a young lady with blonde hair.
