When this young lady turned up she was not apparently the manager, he was in Hospital with his wife who was giving birth! He then turned up oblivious to the fact his wife was in hospital and said he would discuss this with me. He informed me I should have seen the damage and told him straight away, and as I hadnt I would have to pay almost one thousand euros to him or be detained by the Police and not allowed to leave the Country. I told him to inform the police and gave him my documents to copy. He then dissappeared from the Hotel and I never saw him again. Whatever happened here was hopefully a one off and I do not think it represents the staff (apart from the manager)as they were very helpfull, but it totally ruined the rest of our Trip and I intent to post this article on as many sites as possible! To sum up, great to start with, but as you can see, this could be terrifying to a lot of people and cost them a lot of money!

Reviews.Title: “Very good, shame about the coffee!”
Reviews.Author: LankyLancastrian
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant hotel with very good sized rooms. This seems to be an old apartment block which has been turned into a hotel and the lift comes in very handy at times. Very convenient for Termini station and all the tourist buses. The staff are very helpful and excellent at recommending good local trattorias for food. Breakfast is very good bar the coffee and the juice machines in the corner. These are not a patch on anything else you will sample in Rome so sadly do avoid. Certainly reasonably priced and would use again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and a Great Wee Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tarff
Reviews.Content: For those on a less expensive city break this hotel is perfect. It is located literally 2 mins walk from Romes main Termini train station, which itself has the 'Leonardo Express' running directly to and from Fiumicino Airport (11 Euro single ticket, journey time 30 mins) Termini is also the main Metro stop in Rome, the only station where the A and B lines meet, and so is a perfect hub from which to enjoy this amazing city. The hotel itself is situated on a busy little street just to the left of Termini. It is just off Via Cavour, a main street packed with bars and restaurants, and there is an internet cafe right next to the reception. The room we stayed in, which was in a block a few doors down the road from the main hotel building, was big enough for the two of us, and was very clean with bed linen and towels changed daily. It also has a free working safe and a television. The bathroom was small but very clean and the shower worked well (hot water is NOT required during a Roman summer!) 2 tiny little issues though. Although we booked a room with a double bed we were given 2 singles pushed together, and while these were comfy enough they tended to slip apart leading to more than one jarring mid-sleep fall. The other issue concerns the breakfast. As others has said it is very 'cakey' It consisted of, in total - iced croissants, huge sugared donuts, 2 types of cereals, bread, a small selection of jams, yoghurts, tarts, juice and coffee. Although it filled us up it would have been nice to see some meats, cheeses and more rolls and bread available, but maybe thats just Rome? But those are just 2 trifling matters, ones not woth complaining about at all. The hotel was fantastic and the staff brilliant, even providing us with a free city map on arrival and willing to recommend restaurants and places to visit. Just a few words abotu Rome itself. We went in the middle of July and it was roasting hot. So hot that we tended to go back to the hotel about 3pm each day for a 2 or 3 hour nap just to get out of the sun, so take lots of light clothes and buckets of suntan lotion! Also be prepared to queue if you're not an early-bird! Although we followed the advice of those before us and skipped the collosuem queues by buying our tickets at the Palatine office we discovered a 4 hour queue at the Vatican to climb St Peters dome, and what looked like a mile-long queue to the Vatican Museums at around 10am. Strangely once we were done with the Vatican at around 1pm the museum queue was non-existant and we walked straight in So many sights to see but you can't miss the Colosseum, Vatican, the Trevi Fountain at night and the Roma Forum. Other wee gems are the Mouth of Truth, the grisly Cappuccini Monks graveyard near Barberini metro stop and the view from the top of Castel San Angelo. The Spanish Steps were a dissapointment, not particularly grand and full of beggars and street traders. Sorry for rambling on but this city is amazing. Watch out for the guys selling handbags and dont even look at the guys selling roses. Buy a 7-day metro ticket for 16 euro and enjoy every part of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Smashing place - would stay again”
Reviews.Author: northumbrian
Reviews.Content: Super place - clean, friendly and convenient for termini and alot of the sites - spanish steps and trevi only a stroll away. Hotel lift was delightful and the rooms and breakfast excellent value. If you stay tell Alex on the front desk "Mr Bean recommended you do!"

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DebB-TA
Reviews.Content: We stayed June 29-July 1 in a family room on the main floor right beside the breakfast room. A door in the breakfast room would start banging between 7:30 - 8:00 a.m. That was ok for us because we wanted to wake up early to start sight seeing. If you wanted to sleep in this would definitly be a problem. We found the hotel to be perfect it had two bedrooms and a bathroom. It was clean and very comfortable with working air conditioning. The front desk staff were very friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. The location is awesome - you can walk everywhere except the Vatican, but the Termini station is very close. The breakfast was yogurt, cereal, pastries, juice and a coffee machine (espresso, cappicino, mocachino etc.). We loved Rome - we went to the Vatican, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Coliseum and Pantheon. We were offered English tours at the Vatican and Coliseum which we took and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: ajr13
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a short break in Rome - and this hotel was a real gem. Located only 5 minutes' walk from Termini station, we found warm and friendly staff who were happy to answer questions and point out places of interest. The room was spotlessly clean with very welcome air con, useful safe and an excellent shower. Some contributors have criticised the breakfast - and it is very much cake based - but we imagine typical Italian and always well presented in pleasant surroundings. And the lift was nowhere near as bad as some people here have suggested! We would definitely recommend this hotel and would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Visit. Diefiantely the last one. Never again.”
Reviews.Author: DaneNWUk
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Welcome Residences and can safely say that the hotel was the only dissapointment in the whole trip. This was our second visit there and whilst the last one was a delight this one was terrible. Standards have defiantely deteriorated. Especially given the fact that the room rate has almost doubled since last year. I placed a positive review of the hotel after our last visit and would definately rescind it. Booked for three nights. Firstly the positive aspects of the hotel. The location is excellent and the bathrooms in both rooms we had (we had to move rooms) were spotless. On the down side. In both rooms we had you could write your name in the dust on the surafaces of the bedroom furnature( bedside tables, dressing tables etc.). In our first room the door would not close properly and could only be locked by pulling it closed and locking it from the inside with the key. The bathroom door wouldn't close at all let alone lock. In both rooms we had the air conditioning did not work properly and whilst we had it set to 19 degrees it never managed to get below 25 degrees (not good in Rome at the end of June). In both rooms the units seemed to work more like giant fans than air coolers. At midnight on our second night we were woken by a jolt as the leg dropped off the bed only to be told be reception that there was nothing they could do until the following day. When we returned from a day sightseeing the following day our bed had been 'repaired; by placing telephone directories under the broken corner leaving the bed tilted. Upon checking I also found the bed linen hadn't been changed (as indeed it hadn't on the previous day). Not ideal or acceptable in hot, sticky, Rome. Since returning I've seen that their literature states fresh linen every day which is what I'd expect when paying over £100 a night for a room. I asked reception about how often linen is supposed to be changed three times and they refused to be pinned down and wouldn't give me a straight answer. No additioinal toiletries had been left in the bathroom after the day of our arrival luckily we always carry spare. After refusing to sleep on a bed propped up by telephone directories with dirty sheets we were offered a room change. The new room was very small but at least the door closed. There was no was of securing the door from the inside (lock deadbolt etc.) which we found very worrying. Again this room was dusty with an air conditioning unit which just seemd to circulate the air and not lower the temerature. The wardrobe consisted of an alcove behind a curtain with a safe which was too high for me to reach. The bathrooom was again spotlessly clean if very small (so small it had to have a sliding door). The small shower cabinet had no shelf or place to put soap or shower gel which meant having to wash with one hand whilst holding the shower gel or risk slipping on it on the floor. The breakfast in this hotel definately remains the worst that I have had in any hotel anywhere in the world and personally after trying it the first two days avoided it and found a local cafe for lovely coffee and great pastries. To summaries all I can say is it was very had to find positive things to say about the hotel and we will not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Usham
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews on this site I was slightly worried about staying at this hotel. However there was nothing to worry about, it was a great hotel and we really enjoyed our stay here. Rooms are clean, large and newly decorated with a/c and a mini bar. Even the bathroom was quite big too. The hotel has character and we loved the old glass lift. Breakfast was not so great, it consisted of sweet crossiants, cakes, tarts, cereal and bread you can't toast. There was no ham, cheese or fruit but you can get this from the supermarket nearby. The coffee is from a machine and isn't strong. Staff are really friendly they provide a map and very good advice on what to see, when to go, how to get there and recommend some good restaurants. The location is ideal it's right next to the station so you can get any bus back or a metro to wherever you need to go for a euro (single). We walked to a lot of places too and nothing was more than a 10-15 minute walk away. To get to the hotel, come out of the station so the bus stand is right in front of you. Turn left and cross the main road at the lights. Turn right to walk along the main road and take the second exit on your left down the side of a restaurant. There is a market stall on your right selling cases. The hotel is directly in front of you on the left corner. There are lots of lovely restaurants and snack bars nearby, it's round the corner to the opera house and Via Nazionale too where there are even more shops. I highly recommend this hotel as it is good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms with all you need”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_City_Girl
Reviews.Content: The rooms are great--large by European standards and decorated nicely. Each room has its own personality. They all had mini bar refrigerators and the beds were comfortable. However, our first room the a/c didn't work and they moved us to another room. The a/c sort of worked in that room and then they had electrical problems on that whole floor and they changed our room again. In the last room, the a/c worked great and it was perfect. Rooms in the front of the hotel have more street noise than the ones on the side or back. Location is excellent for using the Termini or buses. Restaurants in the area were excellent and we were able to walk to every location except the Vatican, which we used the Metro. Good restaurants in the area that were very close were Antica Boheme and Monte Arci. Trimani Wine Bar was overpriced and the Italian cheese plate was highly unpleasant. If you want even more authentic Italian, go to Colline Emiliane which is very near the Barberini Metro stop. Walking down the Via Cavour from the hotel there are a few wine shops that have great prices. But if you want even cheaper prices, go to the SuperMarket behind the Santa Maggiore. The staff is very friendly and helpful regarding any need. Breakfast at the hotel was so-so, but at the corner, the restaurant had great coffee and paninis for getting you started.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: LoveToTravelAlbanyNY
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable. Clean. Nice breakfast. Great location - close to the Termini and close to the Metro. Very nice staff. A good solid find.

Reviews.Title: “I guess it can be nice once they have fixed everything”
Reviews.Author: Miti81
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Welcome residences from the 23rd to 27th of May 07, When we arrived we were put into the building next to their main building (where the reception was located), the room was on the sixth floor and very small, it wasn’t quite finished, the extractor in the bathroom was missing, the card security system and air-conditioning were put in but it was not working, the room was so hot that we hardly slept on our first night. Next day we asked to be moved and were moved to the main building. This room was much better and although the air-conditioning was still not perfect, the room was a lot cooler, bigger and nicely decorated. Breakfast wasn’t nice at all, if you have the option don’t pay for it. There was nothing appealing on the breakfast bar and their coffee machine wasn’t working. However, the rooms were clean and the location was ideal, Reception staff were helpful, friendly and knowledgeable and I think once they have finished all the work the hotel will be a good value for money. If you decide to stay in this hotel ask on arrival to be put into the main/old building. The one next door is on-going work.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel , Good location except breakfast and wake up call!”
Reviews.Author: Jack_n_Jill_rocks
Reviews.Content: Hi, I stayed in this hotel during my ROME trip in May,2007 end. I took Ryanair flight and reached ROME CIAMPINO Airport late night. I took Terravision bus which runs from airport to termini frequently. Its better to take return ticket which will cost around 14 Euros. I reached Termini aaround mid night and the rome looks bit lousy at the time. NEVER EVER TRUST THE TAXI GUYS IN ROME. I asked some taxi guys about the location but they all tried to fool me by suggesting that its very far. But when I asked few noble guys and referred to the map, its hardly 100 mtrs walk (3 minutes) from TERMINI. They don't have a big board but can be easily located on Via Giovanni 7 street. The reception (Silvia, James (not sure) were really helpful. The reception is the best part of the hotel. The room was pretty ok with mini bar , big bed, nice bathroom (no bath tub) and locker. The lift is very scary and kind of antique peice. But its ok as you don't need it all the time. The reception people were very good and helpful. Room was fantastic. The best part is that this place is so close to ROME Termini from where you can easily take trains to go to Venice, Pisa or Florence and no need to worry about time in day/night. All tours start from Termini alos which is just acros the road. There were few small problems which i faced regarding breakfast and wake up call. Vreakfast is no very good and doesn't include fruits etc. Its very very simple. Better take room without breakfast as it looks stupid paying money for it. Another thing if you have to leave from hotel at 7:00 AM to catch the flight, they don't provide breakfast even if you have already paid for it. They say it doesn't open before 7:30 which is ridiculous. Lot of hotel do that... Never trust the hotel reception for Wake up calls. Carry your mobile and set alarm on that. I asked them to give me wakeup call on 3 days and everytime they came to wake me up arounf 1 or 2 hours after the actual time. They just note it down somewhere in paper and forget it. I luckily always use alarm on my mobile. Except breakfast and wake up call, this hotel is really good to stay. Thanks, Rahul I

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: emilysj
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed at the welcome residences hotel may 15th-18th 2007. A HINT WHEN TRAVELLING FROM CIAMPINO AIRPORT TO THE HOTEL; When leaving ciampino airport, there is a desk to your right where you can book a coach from the airport to the main station termini stazione in the centre of rome, the coach company is called Terravision and for just 8 euro's per person the coach will take you to from the airport to the station in rome center which is less than 5 minute walk to the hotel, the coach trip was about 30-50 minutes depending on traffic, but well worth getting the coach as taxi's are triple this price. Where the coach drops you off you can purchase a coach ticket for your journey back to the airport also 8 euro's the coach will pick you up just up the road opposite the royal hotel, although the ticket office isnt signposted, so it may be worthwhile booking a return ticket at the airport 16 euro's p/p. The coach will drop you off at the station from there walk through the station straight ahead to the exit, cross the road turn left then its the 2nd turning on your rightto the hotel. The hotel isn't very well signposted there is a small gold plaque on the outside next t the door. On arrival to the hotel we were greeted by a very polite lady (sorry i dont recall her name) although we had pre-paid for the hotel they do request a credit card for damages that may be caused. The lady was very polite and very helpful, she gave us our room keys, one good thing they do is provie you with a very handy map, and she then circled places of interest and tips on how to get to them, which we found very useful. There is a very old fashioned lift although it looked scary it did work and was suprisingly quiet, you have to hold the button until the lift is at your floor open the door close the shutters and hold your floor button, reliable lift although doesnt look it!!! Our room was basic, tele, minibar, shower etc. Beware the hotel is non smoking which we werent aware of. Although the room was basic it wa very tidy and neat, bed sheets and towels changed daily. It is noisy at night but not overly noisy, as the hotel is on a main road opposite station but the noise didnt bother us, and able to sleep ok! From the hotel you can see a fountain to the left from our window which was nice!! Alot of people have written in their reviews that the breakfast was poor, but we were rather suprised, they have a selection of sweet pastries, crossaints, cereals coco pops, and a wheat nut cereal, as well as toast, bread etc. The juice from the machine is nice although not in english so lucy dip as to what you get, i didnt try the hot drinks machine, but my partner did and wasnt so keen on the tea (the mugs are pretty small) The coffee though was ok. Would ve nice if there was a hot drinks machine located elsewhere as only time available was at breakfast time 7-10 am. Although mini bar reasonably priced. We had a cold drink and crisps total3 euro's. Beware when buying drinks outside the hotel as they say me coming two bottles of cold drink 8 euro's (about £6) learnt from our mistakes though they should be about 2 euro's 50 cents to 3 euro's. The hotel is excellent location the colloseum is about 15-20 minute walk, its worth getting a guided tour 12 euro's as it gets you straight into colloseum without queing or 3 euro's if you que. From the colloseum we walked to fontain di trevi then the panthoen and back to te hotel, you have to walk as there are so many things to see on the way to the sites. Although Vatican City we didnt walk to as a bit far but you can get the metro a 24 hou ticket was 4 euro's p/p very good and Vatican City was the 6th stop about 10 mins in metro and well worth a visit we walked from there to Castel sant angelo although it was closed when we went due to trade union meeting worth a visit also, then onto piazza del tribunalland across the 2nd bridge from there to piazza del popolo and then back on the metro to the hotel. Also saw trinita del monti a church. You do have to get up early about 730/8 am for a warm shower as was cold on our first day, due to other guests using all warm water although the rest of our trip the water was warm. The staff are very helpful. I would definatley recommend this hotel, very good location, helpful staff and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Jinx45
Reviews.Content: Family of three ,2 plus teenager. Found the Hotel nice and central to the railway. Walking within 3-5 minutes. They let us check in very early and even gave us an apartment instead of room. The apartment was a little further away but the hotel staff (jamie) was very helpful. Gave us local map circled places to see and a couple of restaurants which we tried and were great! Hot spot for email not working in lobby. The guy that delt with that was away. But there was an internet point next door. 1 euro 1/2 hour. Shower tiny, jug didn't work. Bed comfy. Very noisy city but had double glazing. Lots of walking! Which was the best way to see city. Book Vatican Musuem if you are planning a trip!!!!And catch metro there 1 Euro for 75 minutes travel anywhere. If someone ask you something ask How Much!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value a little gem - it's almost tempting not to tell you!”
Reviews.Author: Jane1706
Reviews.Content: We have been to Rome many times and this is the first hotel which we feel we can recommend to others. The cost is very reasonable and excellent value for money. The hotel was a little hard to find - locate it on a good map first before you start walking and there is no obvious sign just an entrance into a lovely reception area. The location, very close to Terminni and the bus station is perfect. There are also some reasonable and bars close by. All the staff, particularly at reception are charming and more than willing to help. The reception staff all speak excellent English. Our bedroom on the third floor was a little noisy but you have to expect that in a major capital city. The bed was one of the most comfortable I have experienced in a hotel and the furniture was adequate. It was good to have a safe (free of charge), a mini bar and the drinks were reasonably priced. The bathroom was a little small but beautifully clean. Towels were changed every day and the bed linen every two days. Breakfast was fine - a selection of bread and cakes, good coffee and fruit juice. you can have a more substantial breakfast by paying a small amount extra. The breakfast room is a little small and you can have to wait for a table - there is little concept of queuing except amongst the more polite! There are some very nice touches in the hotel - interesting pictures and ornate furniture. My sister and her family had a suite which had a sofa bed and very nice bathroom with a juccuzzi - excellent value. A final of warning please be careful of pick pockets they are everywhere and you are particularly vulnerable on the buses especially number 64 which is the stopping bus to the Vatican. Use the express number 40 which doesn't stop so often and so you are less likely to become a victim as the pick pockets want a quick getaway.

Reviews.Title: “ Location but warnings, thieves! Mark 2”
Reviews.Author: Southerness
Reviews.Content: I was interested to read the article by Snowflyer, England - Oct 2, 2006. We had a similar experince of my partner's bag being stolen during breakfast (3rd week in October 2006). Like the description the staff were extremely unhelpful and refused to call the police . Her bag contained her passport, mobile phone and cash. I am now alarmed to read that this had already happened. When we reported this to the police they told us that the hotel should have phoned the Police directly - which like Snowflyer they refused. Be warned reagrding the lack of security.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: NikP
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Suite in June 2006. Positives: 1) Excellent location - most attractions are walking distance. The main station (Termini) is just a stones throw away. 2) Very friendly, cheerful and helpful staff who also speak good english. 3) Good rooms - well maintained and cleaned by the house keeping staff. Negatives: 1) A little noisy if the windows are kept open. 2) Average quality of breakfast (no fruits, cheese, meat etc.) 3) Rooms could do with some fine tuning - e.g. shower curtains need to be put, AC needs to be more effective. Conclusion: Overall a very pleasant and enjoyable stay. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but warning, thieves!”
Reviews.Author: Snowflyer
Reviews.Content: We just got back from staying in this hotel for a weekend. We were impressed with the comfortable room and the excellent location. However, be warned of the lack of security. On the second morning we had breakfast in the dining hall in the hotel only to have our bag stolen right under our noses by a thief who we were told (by fellow guests) had followed us in off the street, straight past the reception desk right in front of the hotel staff and guests. The staff were extremely unhelpful and refused to call the police or check the CCTV cameras that they have in the hotel. The bag contained both our passports, my wallet, phone and other items. This theft was not taken seriously, and as they never have any security on the door this could easily happen again. Be warned!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location: but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Pistyll
Reviews.Content: Booked at the last minute through a Travel Web site recommendation list. Hotel very convenient for the rail station and airport bus transfers, about 15 mins fbus ride from the city centre. Room well furnished and clean. Flat screen satellite TV, 50 channels -not tuned to any English medium. Room comfortable but traffic noise loud - in my first floor corner room. Location, cleanliness and room fittings are very good. Breakfast satisfactory, but room small and at one stage full. Lobby is the only public area.

Reviews.Title: “Probably would choose another hotel”
Reviews.Author: msp132
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent if you're coming in by train. It's only a couple of blocks from Termini -- which is great -- and the neighborhood, although it may look a little sketchy later in the evening, is actually perfectly fine. We felt very safe walking around both during the day and night. Our room was VERY basic. Our queen-sized bed was two twins PUSHED together -- there was nothing holding it together, so by the second night, we didn't even bother trying to sleep in the "same" bed for fear of ending up on the floor! We had scaffolding outside our window due to the renovations, so we couldn't leave it open and the air conditioner didn't cool the room very well. Our tiny (even by European standards) shower was a bit grimey -- this was obviously not one of the renovated rooms. The staff was extremely friendly and the breakfast was all SUGAR. If you want a little cheese or ham, this isn't the place. Cakes, sweet-filled croissants and pastries was the only thing on the menu. Coffee came from a big dispenser/machine. All in all, there's absolutely nothing special about this hotel. Perhaps after the renovations are complete...?

Reviews.Title: “loved the residences”
Reviews.Author: ruari
Reviews.Content: very close to termini, no problems with the area, there with 3 kids, wandered streets with no problem. location perfect for sights and closeness to station takes away hassle when arriving by train or coach. staff very helpful. in refurbished room, standard good for 3 star, lots of clean towels and bedding. breakfast ok, plenty of it and served to 10am. down side can be noise of traffic, but you do get used to it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Enough”
Reviews.Author: SKDIJA
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nights for a Rome sites based holiday, hotel very clean,triple room more than adequate. Staff very helpful and pleasant.Price very good, breakfast a bit sugary but just what you need before a days trekking around the city. Builders were rennovating the property but most people seemed to be up and around before the noise became a problem. I had read some bad reports about neighboorhood around Termini, I stayed there with my wife and daughter and experienced no problems. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: Alison_Steve
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel online based on its central location and reasonable price, stayed for four nights in a double room at the end of June. The hotel is literally 2 minutes walk from the main Termini station. A word of warning - there is no obvious sign outside, just a small brass plaque by the door, but the hotel is number 7 in the street and is usually recognisable by the view of the spectacular entrance lobby through the open door! Our room was very clean and comfortable, with an air chiller unit (a must - it was 36 degrees outside), a huge bed, modern en suite bathroom, good shower, safe, and flat panel TV. We also had a minibar fridge which had enough space for our many water bottles! Some other reviews I've seen have said the breakfast isn't the best - well no, it isn't, but it's by no means the worst either... as long as you like cakes! The best part about this hotel is definitely the location. 2 minutes to the station, where Rome's two metro lines intersect; 15 minutes' leisurely walk to the Colosseum; plenty of places to eat nearby (try the restaurant with the cream coloured canopies outside on Via Cavour, on the left hand side as you walk towards Santa Maria Maggiore). Summary: we wouldn't hesitate to book another stay here. PS A general Rome tip: if you're staying for a few days, it's worth buying a Roma Pass (tourist info centres and museums, including the Colosseum, sell them). For 18 euros you get three days' unlimited public transport travel, plus free entry to your first two museums / monuments and reduced price entry to others. Considering that it costs 11 euros just to get into the Colosseum, this is a pretty good deal.
